{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-3-01-2021-03-09017-1-041418246", "text": "Innovation Engineer

Den Jobinserenten von Ad Novum direkt kontaktierenVanessa Singer
Recruitment Business Partner bei AdNovum
That's your role
As a team member of the AdNovum Incubator, you are a curious personality who is open to new ideas and thinks "out of the box" to find new solutions for the needs of the market. The examination and critical assessment of new technologies, business models, and working methods is an integral part of your interest. With your communication skills, you are able to convince people of new solutions and drive their implementation in a collaborative and agile way. Become part of our innovative and dynamic team in Zurich and write a success story with us! In the role of an Innovation Engineer (80-100%) you will have the following responsibilities:Driving greenfield innovation to identify and create the future growth drivers of AdNovum
Scouting and evaluating digital trends and new technologies
Identifying, analyzing, and abstracting customer needs
Validating use cases based on proof-of-concepts and prototypes
Initiating and managing innovation projects, from the idea to the implementation of a customer show case and development of a business case (end-to-end responsibilities)
Assessing the potential application of new business models and working methods
Collaborating with internal and external stakeholders at various levels, from development to presentation to the leadership team
Strengthening AdNovum's innovation brand by participating in conferences, editing articles as well as organizing webinars 
This is you
University Master’s degree (ETH/Uni/FH) in Computer Science or comparable
In-depth understanding of the latest technologies (e.g. Blockchain and Machine Learning) and their application potential
Experience in software engineering, software architecture and software integration as well as the ability to familiarize with new tools/frameworks in a speedy and efficient manner
"Make it work" and "can do" mentality; enjoyment of being a driving forceFast and structured comprehension of complex interconnectionsHigh social competence and excellent communication skills
Solution-oriented work, high degree of independence, creativity, passion for innovation and entrepreneurial mindset
Very good command of German and English Mastering Digital PotentialIn Switzerland, AdNovum is among the companies of choice for the secure digitalization of business processes. Our solutions are deployed by prestigious finance and insurance enterprises, as well as by government agencies. They are also of interest to companies in other sectors who wish to set themselves apart in the market by means of innovative digitalization solutions. Here at AdNovum, we nurture a solution-oriented engineering culture. Apart from flat hierarchies and an open door policy, you will find in our company true development whizzes for groundbreaking software and security solutions. Lateral thinkers driven by pioneer spirit and initiative can expect from us a multitude of opportunities for development, both at the beginning and at later stages of their career. AdNovum is an internationally positioned company, yet deeply rooted in Switzerland. Our 560 employees develop pioneering software solutions in transnational teams across the headquarters in Zurich and offices in Bern, Budapest, Ho Chi Minh City, Lausanne, Lisbon, and Singapore.  For data privacy reasons, we only accept applications submitted via our online portal. Applications received by e-mail cannot be processed. Thank you for your understanding. AdNovum Informatik AG accepts only direct applications and explicitly refuses to conclude contracts with recruitment agencies. Any applications submitted by recruitment agencies will be treated as direct applications."}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-3-01-2021-03-09018-1-026402483", "text": "Principal Consultant - Enterprise Architecture (Java/JavaScript)

Zühlke Engineering AG

zurück

Drucken

Weiterempfehlen

Zu Merkliste hinzufügen

Bewerben

Zurück zur Trefferliste

Principal Consultant - Enterprise Architecture (Java/JavaScript)

The Zuhlke Opportunity.

You are inspired by digital transformation projects. As a principal consultant, you will support our customers in the development of ground-breaking architectural overviews. You will identify innovative ways in which new, disruptive technologies can be integrated into traditional architectures or how companies can develop platforms and ecosystems that economically support new digital business models. An important part of your work will be your powerful communication at C-level. You will play a key role in our service development and offer support in recruiting and developing talent.

What your job will include?

You will give advice in sophisticated, strategically important architecture projects. Your strength is in developing enterprise architectures together with interdisciplinary teams.

You will enjoy positioning Zuhlke and our portfolio effectively on the market (pre-sales) and you will bring quotations to a successful conclusion. Your architecture proposals are future-oriented and facilitate the implementation of business strategy or new business models.

You are very familiar with the most important issues in architecture management and can incorporate this knowledge into your consultancy mandates.

You can assess IT landscapes methodically and identify quickly which systems and processes are functioning efficiently. You can identify critical weaknesses and propose effective countermeasures.

Concise, targeted communication with management and agile developer teams will be a regular component of your work. Your personal qualities help build trust, team spirit, energy and clarity.

You will facilitate architecture workshops and collectively develop ideas for architectures, architecture management and road maps.

Your concepts accurately explain meaning and purpose, opportunities and risks, and result in well-founded recommendations.

You are self-critical, dynamic and don’t lock yourself in an ivory tower.

What you should offer?

Successfully completed university degree, ideally in information technology, business informatics or similar

Extensive professional experience as an enterprise architect; experience in more than one industry is desirable but not a requirement. Thorough knowledge of architecture frameworks (e.g. TOGAF or other lightweight frameworks)

Competence in the areas of Lean, Agile and DevOps

Recent hands-on technical background in software engineering, ideally with Java (max. 5 years ago) and experience with business analysis and project management are required. Practical experience with current architecture concepts such as microservices, SOA and omnichannel

Recent hands-on coding (max. 2 years ago) is required as this role may from time to time be expected to roll up their sleeves and directly contribute to the work

Wide-ranging knowledge of current technologies (e.g. cloud, mobile, IoT, big data/machine learning/AI, blockchain or AR/VR) and their influence on enterprise architecture

Outstanding communication skills in English

Ability to learn quickly and strong problem-solving skills

Analytical, customer-oriented, creative and innovative

Team-oriented with strong personal integrity, valuable coach, building trust with customers in the long term

What we offer?

At Zuhlke Asia, you get the best of both worlds. You can leverage on the benefits of working in a stable, large, highly reputable company with a long history of success while enjoying the freedom and autonomy of working in a fast-growing start-up environment. Zuhlke offers you networked innovation power and the security of a long-running, international success story. We support your personal development with specialised workshops and active knowledge sharing among experts.

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-3-01-2021-03-09018-1-026794613", "text": "Quantitative Manager in Credit Risk Management – Financial Services EMEIA FSO, Zurich

EY

	Quantitative Manager in Credit Risk Management – Financial Services EMEIA FSO, Zurich

	In a world that’s changing faster than ever, our purpose acts as our ‘North Star’ guiding our more than 300,000 people – providing the context and meaning for the work we do every day. In doing so, we play a critical role in

	building a better working world

	for our people, clients and communities. Thanks to our innovative services in auditing, tax consulting as well as transaction and management consulting, we proudly lead our clients into the future. 

As the only one of the Big 4 with a specialist cross-border practice dedicated to the

	Financial Services

	Sector, we offer our clients seamless, consistent and high-quality services around the globe.

Our

	Consulting

	business offers a broad range of functional and cross-country services dedicated to providing high-value and trusted advice to clients, with a specific focus on business transformation programs in the Financial Services industry.

We are currently looking for a motivated and committed Senior Consultant / Manager with a specialization in credit risk modeling to further strengthen our practice within the FSO Consulting Risk Management team in Zurich.

	What you can expect – enriching experiences that will last a lifetime

	Engage in consulting engagements where you will support our clients (financial institutions ranging from leading global market players to more regional focused institutions) in challenges related to credit risk modeling and management as well as further financial and non-financial risks. Topics range from the development or review of quantitative models applied for regulatory purposes, financial accounting or business steering to firm-wide model risk management, with approaches including advanced analytics and innovative machine learning techniques. We also support our clients with advice regarding the setup of risk functions or overall risk frameworks.

	Perform regulatory audit mandates where you will review financial risk models on behalf of the national regulator to assess compliance with regulatory requirements.

	Support financial audit mandates where you will contribute specialist expertise in the assessment of all kinds of risk-related models, the valuation of corresponding accounting estimates or the application of advanced analytics.

	Depending on your experience, take on team and/or project management responsibilities.

	Develop your technical and leadership skills by gaining experience in diverse projects as well as through internal and external training opportunities.

	What you can contribute – skills for shaping the future

	A Master of Science or PhD in mathematics, physics, statistics, econometrics or other relevant quantitative field

	3-5 years of relevant professional experience in a consulting environment, a model development or validation team in the financial industries

	Strong quantitative skills, in particular deep understanding of quantitative modeling techniques, with practical experience in credit risk (Basel III – IRB, IFRS9)

	Ideally additional knowledge and experience in further risk types and/or advanced quantitative finance topics, e.g. counterparty credit risk / exposure simulation

	Good IT and programming skills, with practical experience in languages such as Python, R, VBA, SQL

	A strong interest in taking responsibility, developing technical excellence and advancing innovative approaches in credit risk modeling and management

	Key success factors: team player, goal-oriented, commitment, quick understanding, analytical and organizational skills, as well as project management skills;

	In an international environment, a proficient level of business English is a prerequisite; fluency in German is a clear plus.

	Stick to your plans and realize your goals with us! Design your career with EY in a culture that promotes diversity and education.

	International multi-cultural team of highly motivated professionals

	Constant personal development with a steep learning curve – a system of trainings, mentoring, counselling and on-the-job learning

	Modern working environment and equipment, fostering mobile working flexibility

	Transparent performance-based recognition and progression system

	Acquire a fully accredited corporate MBA (EY Tech MBA) from Hult International Business School, whilst working with EY, completely free*

	Your ambition is as bold as ours. As part of our high-performing teams, you’ll build the tech skillsets and growth mindsets to become the leader you want to be. The leader the world needs. Harness our scale, our tech, our teams and our culture to realize your potential. Learn from the best, surround yourself with the curious, ask better questions to seek better answers.

	The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

	Make the next step and apply for this position online. Ref. No: ZUR001JC. For further information please contact our recruitment team ([email] /  41 58 286 33 66).

* exception of EY contractors, interns and alumni.

	Bewerben

	Zurück

	Drucken

	Weiterempfehlen

	Merken

	Bewerben"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-3-01-2021-03-09019-1-027514746", "text": "Hochschulpraktikant/in International Relations

Stellenmarkt

	Nächste Stelle

	24. Februar 2021

	Hochschulpraktikant/in International Relations

	Bundesverwaltung

	Bern

	Für Studenten

	Öffentlicher Dienst, Verbände und Einrichtungen

	Hochschulpraktikant/in International Relations      Neu

	Praktikum  
	nicht angegeben
	Bern  Student

	Mit Expertise in die Zukunft.

	Sie unterstützen während des Praktikums den Dienst International Relations in inhaltlichen und organisatorischen Belangen.

	Ihre Aufgaben

	Unterstützen des Dienstes bei der Umsetzung des Engagements in nationalen, internationalen und regionalen Organisationen und Prozessen, insbesondere im Bereich der Internet Gouvernanz, Informationsgesellschaft und Künstlichen Intelligenz

	Recherchieren, Bericht erstatten sowie Analysen und schriftliche Beiträge erarbeiten zu den Fragen der Internet Gouvernanz, Informationsgesellschaft und Künstlichen Intelligenz

	Unterstützen des Dienstes bei der Organisation und Durchführung von nationalen und internationalen Anlässen im Zuständigkeitsbereich des BAKOM

	Erstellen von Sitzungsprotokollen

	Ihr Profil

	Kürzlich abgeschlossener Hochschulabschluss

	Aktive Kenntnisse einer zweiten Amtssprache mit Englischkenntnisse

	Gute redaktionelle Fähigkeiten

	Ausgeprägtes Interesse an nationalen und internationalen Fragen der (Tele-)Kommunikation, Medien, inklusive digitalen Inhalten, Märkten und Plattformökonomie

	Von Vorteil: Erfahrungen aus den Bereichen (Tele-)Kommunikation, Medien, inklusive digitalen Inhalten, Märkten und Platt-formökonomie, resp. im Bereich der internationalen Zusammenarbeit

	Zusätzliche Informationen

	Sekretariat Dienst International Relations, Tel. 058 460 54 50

	Die Anstellung erfolgt gemäss den Richtlinien der Bundesverwaltung für Hochschulpraktikantinnen und -praktikanten. Das Praktikum ist auf 12 Monate begrenzt. Stellenantritt nach Vereinbarung.
Referenznummer: 44786

	Über uns

	Das Bundesamt für Kommunikation (BAKOM) nimmt Aufgaben im Bereich der Medien, des Fernmelde- und Postwesens sowie der Informationsgesellschaft in der Schweiz wahr und sorgt für eine stabile und fortschrittliche Kommunikationsinfrastruktur. Es ist Teil des Eidgenössischen Departements für Umwelt, Verkehr, Energie und Kommunikation (UVEK).

	Als Mitarbeiterin oder Mitarbeiter des BAKOM führen Sie die Schweiz in die Zukunft. Sie übernehmen Verantwortung in herausfordernden Projekten mit dem Ziel, die hohe Lebensqualität in unserem Land zu erhalten. Das BAKOM bietet Ihnen die Möglichkeit, in einem modernen Arbeitsumfeld einen wesentlichen Beitrag für die erfolgreiche Entwicklung der Schweiz zu leisten.

	Die Bundesverwaltung achtet die unterschiedlichen Bedürfnisse und Lebenserfahrungen ihrer Mitarbeitenden und fördert deren Vielfalt. Gleichbehandlung geniesst höchste Priorität."}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-3-01-2021-03-09019-1-027529732", "text": "PhD Position - Genomic selection 2.0: Developing targeted vs universal machine learning approaches for improving the rate of genetic gain in crop species (RESPONSE DP, ESR 26)

Stellenmarkt

Nächste Stelle

25. Februar 2021

PhD Position - Genomic selection 2.0: Developing targeted vs universal machine learning approaches for improving the rate of genetic gain in crop species (RESPONSE DP, ESR 26)

ETH Zürich

Zürich

Vollzeit

Pharma und Medizintechnik

PhD Position - Genomic selection 2.0: Developing targeted vs universal machine learning approaches for improving the rate of genetic gain in crop species  (RESPONSE DP, ESR 26)

100%, Zurich, fixed-term

Within the European Union’s Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme under the Marie Sk?odowska-Curie grant agreement No 847585, ETH Zurich is offering a 36-month PhD position for an early-stage researcher (ESR) in the area of sustainable food systems.

Job description

Genomic selection (GS) is a powerful method to increase the selection efficiency and genetic gain in crop breeding. New machine and deep learning approaches are set to revolutionise the data input structure for GS model development as well as the resulting prediction accuracy. We are looking for applicants to a doctorate position on "Genomic Selection 2.0: Developing Targeted vs Universal Machine Learning Approaches for Improving the Rate of Genetic Gain in Crop Species”.

The doctoral candidate will be investigating the power of GS in multiple crops and drive the discovery of trends, statistical models, and machine learning algorithms and their implementation in a plant breeding setting. The species proposed in this study from Puregene and the Molecular Plant Breeding group of ETH Zurich are apple (

Malus domestica

L. Borkh), common bean (

Phaseolus vulgaris

L), perennial ryegrass (

Lolium perenne L.

), buckwheat (

Fagopyrum esculentum Moench

), wheat (

Triticum aestivum

L.), and flower as well as hemp type cannabis (Cannabis sativa L). During the project, the ESR will

(i) Develop different statistical models for multiple species with given datasets, which will provide in-depth knowledge on the requirements for datasets to maximize prediction accuracy and how different models work for different data structures

(ii) Establish machine learning approaches and compare them to linear models

(iii) Improve existing datasets using high resolution phenotyping, genome phasing or targeted resequencing of specific genome regions

A planned secondment of nine months at Puregene ([wwwadr]) in Zeiningen, Switzerland is part of this project. Under the supervision of Maximilian Vogt, head of Plant Breeding at Puregene AG, the ESR will be involved in collecting phenotypic (field and glasshouse) and genotypic data. The successful candidate is expected to produce quality research to be published in in open-access, peer-reviewed journals relevant to the field, as well communication within the network of Puregene.

Benefit

We are offering an interesting position at the interface of science and policy. While working in an international, interdisciplinary and innovative research environment at ETH Zurich, the ESR will be jointly co-supervised by the group Molecular Plant Breeding at ETH Zurich and Puregene AG.

The complete 36 months will be under a 100% working contract.

The PhD salary follows the regulations of ETH Zurich and will be according to EU regulations for Marie Sk?odowska-Curie Early Stage Researchers. The monthly gross salary will not be lower than CHF 3920.

The successful candidate will be matriculated and will have a working contract at ETH Zurich. The candidate will work in Switzerland. The secondment will take place in Zeiningen, Switzerland.

Expected starting date of the working contract:

01.10.2021.

Your profile

To perform successfully, potential candidates should have:

A master's degree in Computational Biology or Plant Sciences/Plant Breeding with a strong background in Computational Biology

Experience in using genomic technologies to analyse and model complex traits

Knowledge on multi-variate genomic prediction for crop breeding, ideally combined with the ability to develop software and run software packages appropriate for analysis of large data sets including multiple layers of genomic, phenotypic and environmental data

Skills to apply genetic and phenotypic data simulation methodology to evaluate prediction accuracies of models and complement empirical statistical analysis methodology

Thrive to establish effective relationships and to represent and promote the research in industry and academia

The candidate of choice is:

An enthusiastic, problem solving person who likes working in a multidisciplinary team

A team player that can also work independently

Eligibility:

Early stage researcher in the first four years (full-time equivalent) of their research careers, including the period of research training, starting at the date of obtaining the degree which would formally entitle them to embark on a doctorate either in the country in which the degree was obtained or in the country in which the initial training activities are provided.

At the time of recruitment (for call 4 = July 1, 2021) by the host organisation, researchers must not have resided or carried out their main activity (work, studies, etc.) in Switzerland for more than 12 months in the 3 years immediately before the reference date. Compulsory national service and/or short stays such as holidays are not taken into account.

Language requirement:

Proficient oral and written English skills are expected. Knowledge of German is a plus.

Main Research Field:

Molecular Breeding, Genomic Selection

Sub Research Field:

Plant Genetic Resources, Genomics, Statistical Modelling, Linear Models, Mixed Models, Machine Learning, Deep Learning (Neural Networks), Genetic Gain, Plant Breeding

RESPONSE is open to applicants of any nationality."}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05061-1-000079028", "text": "Predictive Maintenance Engineer (m/w/d)

Predictive Maintenance Engineer (m/w/d)

Hidrostal AG, Neunkirch, Schweiz

Haben Sie sich schon einmal gefragt, wie das Abwasser von Zuhause in die Kläranlage kommt? Oder wie der Blattspinat schonend in der Lebensmittelfabrik transportiert wird? Predictive Maintenance Engineer (m/w/d)

Betreuung und Weiterentwicklung von Steuerungs- und IoT-Lösungen

Generelle Mitarbeit in einem kleinen, kompetenten und vielseitig beanspruchten Team

Solide Erfahrung im Bereich Steuerungs- und Regelungstechnik, wie auch SPS Programmierung

Berufserfahrung mit Rotating Equipment, vorzugsweise mit Strömungsmaschinen wie Zentrifugalpumpen

Erfahrung in der Datenanalyse im Zeit- und Frequenzbereich (FFT)

Beherrschen von Datenanalysetools, vorzugsweise Matlab

Erfahrung mit LabVIEW-Programmierung

Enthusiastische, selbstmotivierte Arbeitsweise und die Fähigkeit, selbstständig zu arbeiten

Sehr gute Englischkenntnisse

Wir suchen eine kommunikative innovative Persönlichkeit, flexibel und belastbar

Als am Markt erfolgreiches und unabhängiges Unternehmen, bieten wir Ihnen eine Position mit viel Zukunft. Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt und möchten Sie uns kennenlernen? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre kompletten Bewerbungsunterlagen in
elektronischer
Form. Bitte senden Sie diese an:

Hidrostal AG

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05076-1-000090630", "text": "Projektingenieur (m/w/d) Electrical Engineering

Projektingenieur (m/w/d) Electrical Engineering

Do you like to be on the cutting edge of innovation? If you’re motivated confident and looking to challenge yourself to be your best, then you’ve come to the right place! This is a role where you to showcase your skills inside and outside of the organization. You’ll work with a variety of customers to evaluate their needs and translate them into workable specifications and processes for your teammates. You’ll also be responsible for ensuring the final product is ready to meet our customer’s expectations before final shipping.  Come join a team where you’re treated like family, you can grow and learn strong core values from dedicated leaders focused on quality and excellence!
Standort:
Wohlen, CH, 5610

Projektingenieur (m/w/d) Electrical Engineering

Zur Verstärkung unseres Systems Engineering Teams im Bereich OSS Equipment Sales & Execution in Wohlen suchen wir einen motivierten, offenen

Projektingenieur (m/w/d) Electrical Engineering

Ihre Aufgaben

Mitarbeit bei Projektstudien und Erarbeitung von kundenspezifischen Problemlösungen

Erstellen von elektrotechnischen Fertigungsunterlagen und Steuerungssoftware (SPS, Roboter)

Inbetriebnahme und Prüfung von Kundenanlagen, Unterstützung bei der Projektübergabe (Abnahme, Schulung) im Werk oder beim Kunden im In- und Ausland

Unterstützung bei der Erstellung der Handbücher und technischer Dokumentationen

Weiterentwicklung bestehender Produkte und Evaluierung neuer Komponenten und Technologien

Ihr Profil

Solide technische Grundausbildung und Weiterbildung auf Stufe HF oder FH (Elektrotechnik, Automation oder Systemtechnik) und einige Jahre Berufserfahrung in einer vergleichbaren Funktion

Vertiefte PLC Kenntnisse mit Siemens Tia Portal

Erfahrungen mit EPLAN, CNC (SINUMERIK) und Robotik (ABB, Fanuc) von Vorteil

Gewandt im Umgang mit international tätigen Kunden in deutscher und englischer Sprache

Selbstständig, neugierig, proaktiv und teamfähig

Bereitschaft für Reisen und Kenntnisse im Umgang mit ERP Systemen runden Ihr Profil optimal ab

Wir bieten

Dynamisches Arbeitsumfeld in einem erfahrenen Entwicklungsteam

Interdisziplinäre Projekte in einem internationalen Umfeld

Abwechslungsreiche Arbeit mit viel Eigenverantwortung

Es erwartet Sie eine attraktive Aufgabe in einer Hightech-Branche. Sie haben die Möglichkeit Ideen und Visionen einzubringen und die Entwicklung unserer Anlagen aktiv mitzugestalten. Interessiert? Dann möchten wir Sie kennenlernen!

Über uns

Oerlikon entwickelt Werkstoffe, Anlagen und Oberflächentechnologien und erbringt spezialisierte Dienstleistungen, um Kunden leistungsfähige Produkte und Systeme mit langer Lebensdauer zu ermöglichen. Gestützt auf seine technologischen Schlüsselkompetenzen und sein starkes finanzielles Fundament setzt der Konzern sein mittelfristiges Wachstum fort, indem er drei strategische Faktoren umsetzt: Fokussierung auf attraktive Wachstumsmärkte, Sicherung des strukturellen Wachstums und Expansion durch zielgerichtete M&A-Aktivitäten. Oerlikon ist ein weltweit führender Technologie- und Engineering-Konzern, der sein Geschäft in zwei Segmenten (Surface Solutions und Manmade Fibers) betreibt. Der Konzern ist mit über 10 600 Mitarbeitenden an 179 Standorten in 37 Ländern präsent und erzielte 2020 einen Umsatz von CHF 2,3 Mrd.

Oerlikon Metco bedient weltweit Kunden aus den Bereichen Luftfahrt, Energieerzeugung, Fahrzeugtechnik, Öl und Gas sowie anderen spezialisierten Industriemärkten und verfügt über ein dynamisch wachsendes Netz von mehr als 40 Niederlassungen in EMEA (Europa, Naher Osten und Afrika), Nord- und Südamerika und Asien-Pazifik. Werden auch Sie Teil unseres zukunftsorientieren, internationalen Teams.

Sustainability is a living principle for Oerlikon.
[wwwadr]

Unser Fokus liegt auf der Gewinnung talentierter, engagierter Menschen, die unsere Kernwerte teilen: Integrität, Teamgeist, Exzellenz und Innovation.  Wir schauen über blosse Qualifikationen hinaus und legen den Fokus auf Kompetenz und Potenziale.  Wir glauben auch, dass es bei der Vergütung darum geht, Menschen für ihre Arbeit gerecht zu bezahlen, ihnen aber auch Möglichkeiten aufzuzeigen. Unser Bewerbungsprozess ist objektiv und transparent gestaltet.

Wenn Sie dieses Mal nicht sehen, was Sie suchen, aber trotzdem bei Oerlikon einsteigen möchten, klicken Sie bitte auf den Button "Bewerbung", um Ihren Lebenslauf einzureichen und uns mitzuteilen, was Sie interessiert. Dann kann unser Recruiting-Team Sie kontaktieren, wenn die richtige Gelegenheit dazu kommt. Folgen Sie uns einfach auf Facebook und LinkedIn, um über neue Stellenangebote informiert zu werden!

Unsere Mitarbeitenden

Oerlikon bietet engagierten Mitarbeitern eine faszinierende Auswahl an Aufgaben und Karrierewegen. Lernen Sie unsere Mitarbeitenden aus der ganzen Welt kennen.

Wang Jun

President Oerlikon China

Cathy Jiang

HR Manager, Manmade Fibers Segment

Entdecken Sie Oerlikon

Wir entwickeln Beschichtungen, die Automotoren, Flugzeugtriebwerke oder Kraftwerkturbinen leistungsfähiger, effizienter und langlebiger machen.

Unsere Vliese für Filter sorgen für reine Luft und klares Wasser. Und mit unserem Wissen in der additiven Fertigung bringen wir die nächste industrielle Revolution voran.

Oerlikon ist ein Schweizer Unternehmen mit einer über 100-jährigen Tradition. Unsere Mitarbeitenden sind einer Vision verpflichtet: innovative industrielle Lösungen für ein besseres Leben zu entwickeln.

Lernen Sie uns kennen!

Stelleninformation

Wohlen, CH, 5610"}

Manage Digital Strategy

Build internal digital network (pilots, sandboxes, people)

Establish factory of the future (ideal state)

Together with ManEx and CoE ENG, develop automation and robotics road map for all T&W sites

You have:

10 plus years of experience in an Innovation or Development role in similar industry

Join us and Impact Your World

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05229-1-000079459", "text": "Master Planner 100 m/w/d

Job Description

Für unseren Standort in Grenchen suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine/n

Master Planner 100% m/w/d

Ihre Aufgaben umfassen und sind nicht beschränkt auf:

Verantwortlich für die Erstellung eines wöchentlichen Master-Produktionsplans (MPS) und die Sicherstellung der Rohstoffverfügbarkeit.

Pflegen einer genauen Umsatzprognose.

Planung und Fixierungszeitraumverwaltung von Produktionsaktivitäten (Umplanung, Nacharbeit, ausgelagerte Arbeit)

Sicherstellen, dass der MPS immer 100% genau und erreichbar ist.

Erreichen und Aufrechterhalten des 95% MPS-Ziels.

Materialbestände innerhalb der Zielwerte halten und gleichzeitige Minimierung von überschüssigen, veralteten und ausgelaufenen Produkten.

Erstellung von Gesamtprojektionen für bestimmte Produkte

Durchführung eines monatlichen RCCP’s (Rough Cut Capacity Planning) für Ressourcen, Schichten, Ausrüstung und geplante Stillstände.

Festlegen von Mindestbestellmengen (MOQ) und Abgleichung mit der Gesamtanlageneffizienz (OEE).

Bestandsverwaltung und -kontrolle.

Verantwortlich für die Erstellung und Aktualisierung von Schwachstellenberichten.

SLOB-Verwaltung (Plant Slow Moving & Obsolete).

Lösen von Fertigungskonflikten für Standort / Portfolio im Zusammenhang mit der Produktionsplanung. Verwaltung und Kommunikation der Auswirkungen von herstellungsbedingten Veränderungen.

Führen / unterstützen aller Aktivitäten des Compliance-Prozesses, einschliesslich Änderungskontrolle, Abweichungen, Ereignisse und Nichtkonformitätsberichte, und Bewertung der Auswirkungen auf das Angebot.

Bereitstellung von Asset-spezifischen Eingaben für die End-to-End-Supply-Chain-Prozesse und Sicherstellung, dass die Planungsstammdaten (Sicherheitsbestand, Vorlaufzeiten usw.) im ERP-System korrekt und aktuell sind.

Aktive Teilnahme an Meetings zur Einführung neuer Produkte und Prognosen für Neuprodukte (NPI’s).

Durchführung von Planungsaktivitäten während Phase-in-Phase-out-Programmen.

Folgende Qualifikationen bringen Sie für diese Stelle mit:

4-jähriger Universitäts- bzw. FH Bachelor-Abschluss oder gleichwertiges.

Supply-Chain-Zertifizierung (APICS / IBF) von Vorteil.

5 - 10 Jahre einschlägige Erfahrung.

Erfahrung mit ERP & Advanced Planning System (Rapid Response oder gleichwertiges).

Produktionsplanung oder Fertigungserfahrung in einer medizinischen, pharmazeutischen oder Verbraucherindustrie.

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05246-1-000079508", "text": "Sr. Scientist Psychophysiology, Human Perception &

Sr. Scientist Psychophysiology, Human Perception &

At Firmenich people are at the heart of the company, we are committed to equal employment opportunities and value diversity in the workplace.

Firmenich FOR GOOD, NATURALLY

At Firmenich, we are all creators of positive emotions to enhance wellbeing, naturally. Join us!

Swiss and family-owned for over 120 years, we create fragrances and flavors for the world’s most desirable brands, delighting billions of consumers every day.

Led by our passion for taste and smell, we put our creativity and innovation to work every day to delight the senses.

Driven by our purpose and guided by our fundamentals, we seek to enable solutions that contribute to greater health and nutrition and hygiene and sanitation, while preserving nature’s most precious resources and empowering sustainable livelihoods across our value chain.

The department of Human Perception & Bioresponses, R&D at Firmenich SA in Geneva, Switzerland, has a vacancy for a Senior Scientist Psychophysiology, Department of Human Perception & Bioresponses, R&D in our Geneva headquarters, Switzerland

Key Responsibilities:

	•  Research the chemical senses and their role in human cognition

	•  Design and conduct innovative psychophysiological research that combines EEG, peripheral physiology, and behavioral measures of chemosensory and multisensory experiences

	•  Lead the psychophysiology laboratory and implement innovative analyses and measurements

	•  Present results and ideas to peers and business partners; write manuscripts and patents

	•  Transfer laboratory methodologies and paradigms to support large-scale and realistic / contextual testing

	•  Support line manager to translate knowledge to business

	•  Support line manager with strategic thinking in own area of expertise and participate in shaping the R&D strategy and support its implementation

	•  Develop and retain talents, set SMART objectives for team members, and evaluate their performance

	•  Establish efficient communication with other R&D team members and business functions

We value:

	•  PhD, or equivalent degree, in Psychology, Cognitive Neuroscience or a related field

	•  Expertise in conducting psychophysiological measurements (incl. EEG, ECG, EMG, GCR, HR) including in the maintainance and development of a psychophysiological laboratory

	•  Advanced statistical knowledge (e.g. multivariate analysis, machine learning, modelling of behavioral and/or psychophysiological data)

	•  Solid programming skills (preferably in Python, R, or Matlab)

	•  Minimum of 5 years of research experience, ideally within the chemical senses

	•  Experience in an industrial setting and creating business value from science will be a plus

	•  High degree of motivation, self-organization, and team-orientation

	•  Excellent communication and networking ability

	•  Fluent in English; knowledge of French or willingness to learn is a plus

We offer:

	•  Highly socially and environmentally responsible company

	•  A world-class infrastructure in a R&D center characterized by strong collaborative spirit between teams

	•  Possibility to influence strategic decision-making

	•  Global and intercultural environment"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05355-1-000085627", "text": "Software Engineer

Software Engineer

Als Entwickler,  Total- und Generalunternehmer  begleiten wir den  Lebenszyklus von Immobilien.  In demBewusstsein, Lebensraum für Menschen zu gestalten, setzen wir alles daran,  immer einen Schritt voraus zu  sein  und  so  Vorsprung  zu  gestalten.  Durch  Zusammenarbeit,  Begeisterung und Erfolgswillen. Mit intelligenten Lösungen, die Kompetenz und Kreativität ausschöpfen  und so nachhaltig Mehrwert schaffen.

Wir suchen Dich für unser Digital Office an unserem Standort in Zürich als

Software Engineer

Deine Aufgaben

Du unterstützt uns bei der technischen Realisierung unserer digitalen Plattform-Strategie sowie bei der Definition und Entwicklung der Software-Architektur

Du wirkst bei der Entwicklung des digitalen Produktportfolios sowie weiterer Produktkomponenten und Schnittstellen zu Subsystemen mit

Du arbeitest mit unseren Software-Entwicklungslieferanten sowie dem zukünftigen Entwicklungs-Team zusammen und berätst sowohl die Stakeholder als auch die Realisierungsteams

Zudem arbeitest du an der Erstellung der Qualitätsstandards mit und unterstützt bei deren Durchsetzung

Neben der aktiven Gestaltung der Roadmap gehört auch die Konzeption, das Design und die Entwicklung von zukunftsweisenden Technologien mit Schwerpunkt Cloud, AI und Blockchain zu deinen Aufgaben

Dein Profil

Must-have

Du bringst ausgewiesene praktische Erfahrung mit neuesten Web- und Datenbankentechnologien mit und hast mindestens fünf Jahre Erfahrung als Software Engineer (Frontend/Backend)

Zudem hast du Erfahrung mit moderner, agiler Softwareentwicklung (CI/CD, Testautomatisierung) sowie agiler Arbeitsmethoden (Scrum, Kanban)

Deutsch und Englisch beherrschst du fliessend

Nice-to-have

Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von Microservices mit Node.js

Erfahrung mit SQL und No-SQL Datenbanken

Erfahrung mit Frontend-Frameworks, wie z.B. Angular, React, Vue oder Svelte

Erfahrung in der nativen und/oder hybriden Mobile-App Entwicklung

Erfahrung mit Cloud-Plattformen wie GCP, Azure oder AWS

Erfahrung mit Docker und Kubernetes

Verständnis für Big Data, Data Analytics, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, User Experience Design, SEO etc.

Deine Perspektiven und Benefits

Bei uns nimmst du eine wichtige Rolle ein und übernimmst Verantwortung. Du kannst deine Fähigkeiten unter Beweis stellen und dich aktiv einbringen. Bei Steiner kannst du dich auf eine spannende, ausbaufähige und abwechslungsreiche Position sowie interessante Perspektiven und Projekte freuen. Zudem bieten wir dir fortschrittliche Anstellungsbedingungen in einem von Teamgeist geprägten Umfeld eines bekannten und erfolgreichen Unternehmens. Du profitierst nicht nur von attraktiven Entwicklungs- und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowie einem modernen und gut gelegenen Arbeitsplatz, sondern kommst auch in den Genuss von aussergewöhnlichen Benefits. Mehr dazu erfährst du hier.
Wenn Du dich von dieser Herausforderung angesprochen fühlst, dann klicke einfach auf «Jetzt bewerben». Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Steiner AG |  Human Resources
Hagenholzstrasse 56 | 8050 Zürich"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05565-1-000088139", "text": "Quality Assurance Specialist

Together, we can beat cancer.

At Varian, a Siemens Healthineers Company, we bring together the world's best talent to realize our vision of a world without fear of cancer. Together, we work passionately to develop and deliver easy-to-use, efficient oncology solutions. If you want to be part of this important mission, we want to hear from you.

As a Quality Assurance Specialist at Varian, you are accountable that the design and development processes are followed, specific controls are in place and documented to ensure adequate quality at all product realization stages.

You keep abreast of regulatory procedures and changes to ensure compliance throughout the complete product life cycle. In addition, you are supporting the RA/QA team in internal and external audits.

You work in close collaboration with other teams and stakeholders in Europe and overseas.

Finally, due to the safety critical nature of radiation therapy, your commitment to quality is a must.

Main Responsibilities:

Ensures compliance requirements according to 21CFR part 820, Directive 93/42/EEC, Regulation (EU) 2017/745, ISO 13485, and the company quality manual.

Ensures in close collaboration with design and engineering teams that all product realization processes are applied, and the product is compliant.

Review of the design and development documentation for adequacy and ensures that they are consistent with the company wide, global processes.

Supports, evaluates, and monitors that the required verification and validation processes are performed and documented.

Is involved in design and development phase from beginning to support risk management and to implement the required controls at the final production stage.

Defines and ensures that statistical data is collection and analyses of the statistical data thereafter.

Supports and evaluates engineering teams with the root cause analysis and corrective actions implementation.

Requirements:

Degree in engineering or related technical field with comparable educational background

Experience in international standards and government regulations applicable to medical devices, preferably in artificial intelligence, cloud computing, radiation emitting devices, or wireless communication

Experience in design quality assurance in medical devices or in other regulated industry

Ability to work with international standards and regulations applicable to medical devices

Experience of working and communicating with different regulatory authorities and corresponding relationships is an additional plus that may complete your profile

Fluence in English, written and verbal, ideally good German skills

Fluence in English, written and verbal, ideally good German skills

You are communicative, focused and analytical. In addition, you can express your ideas and research in written form. You are used to working independently, open to discussing ideas and solutions with your colleagues. You thrive in an international work environment and in cultivating your contacts with partners in Europe and overseas.

Varian is required to comply with all local and applicable regulations that may be associated with vaccine requirements for certain roles.

Fighting cancer calls for big ideas.

We envision a world without fear of cancer. Achieving this vision takes dedication and commitment from all of us, every single day. That's why we celebrate and value the distinctly beautiful and intersectional identities of each of our employees. We are a mirror of our patient-base, which allows us to innovate. Big ideas come from everywhere, and the best ideas are fostered by our unique individual experiences. At Varian, we encourage you to bring your whole self to work and believe your bold and authentic perspective will help to power more victories over cancer.

#TogetherWeFight

Privacy Statement"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05588-1-000081685", "text": "Lead Data Scientist, Biogen Digital Health - Digital Biomarkers, Gait & Posture

Job Description

Neurological diseases are highly complex, devastating, and there are still significant challenges in how we understand and treat them.

At Biogen Digital Health (BDH), we aspire to transform patients’ lives by making personalized & digital medicine in neuroscience a reality. Leveraging data-science and digital technologies, we drive solutions to advance research, clinical care, and patient empowerment.

We stand with our colleagues at Biogen developing pioneering treatments in neuroscience. We believe that now, more than ever, biology and technology should go hand-in-hand to better meet patient needs, while enabling a shift towards more prevention-focused, affordable, and equitable care.

Our team at Biogen Digital Health rejects the status quo and lives by agile principles. We strive for impact through excellence, innovation, and collaboration.

We bravely go where others won’t.

Our people are interdisciplinary, passionate, and champion caring deeply, working fearlessly, and changing lives.

The Lead Data Scientist for Gait & Posture in Digital Biomarkers Data Science will advance precision and personalized medicine through the development and validation of transformative digital measures and algorithms using biometric monitoring technologies (BioMeTs) for people living with MS, neuromuscular diseases (amyotrophic lateral sclerosis [ALS] and spinal muscular atrophy [SMA]), Parkinson’s disease (PD) and/or Alzheimer’s Disease (AD).

Principal accountabilities:

Design digital outcome measurement development strategies quantifying gait and posture, including technical verification, analytical and clinical validation together with BDH Science, Medical, and Measurement Solutions

Lead the development of end-to-end signal processing pipelines, feature engineering and disease and behavioral models for potential biomarkers/endpoints from sensor-based BioMeT data, including clinical studies using KonectomTM, a BDH smartphone-based digital outcome assessment of cognitive and motor functions

Lead the analyses and the communication of results, including at conferences and in peer-reviewed publications for audiences in the therapeutic area of interest, sensor science, machine learning and digital medicine.

Develop and grow your team

Form and foster Biogen internal and external alliances to advance the field of digital outcome measurements acceptance

As a Lead Data Scientist in the Digital Biomarkers Data Science team within BDH Sciences, you will:

	•  Design digital outcome measurement development strategies quantifying gait and posture, including technical verification, analytical and clinical validation together with BDH Science, Medical, and Measurement Solutions

	•  Lead the development of end-to-end signal processing pipelines, feature engineering and disease and behavioral models for potential biomarkers/endpoints

from sensor-based BioMeT data, including clinical studies using KonectomTM, a BDH smartphone-based digital outcome assessment of cognitive and motor functions

	•  Lead the analyses and the communication of results, including at conferences and in peer-reviewed publications for audiences in the therapeutic area of interest, sensor science, machine learning and digital medicine.

This role is of key importance to achieve the strategic vision and objective to make Biogen a recognized leader in digital health neuroscience, hence contributing to our corporate vision & strategy – this role will report to the Head of Digital Biomarkers Data Science.

Qualifications

	•  PhD in biomechanical engineer, data science, bioinformatics, computer science, or applied mathematics

	•  More than 10 years Pharma/Biotech/Tech industry experience, alternatively extensive leadership experience in academic/clinical centers of excellence

	•  Thought leadership in the field of sensor-based signal processing and disease modelling leveraging state of the art methodologies, programming languages, and tools for the development of digital outcome measures

	•  Experience initiating and leading complex, interdisciplinary research, and development projects, especially in the fields of software and technology implementation in support of clinical studies

	•  Solid track-record of scientific publications in the field of digital measurements of function and human behavior for gait and posture

	•  Fluent in English

Additional Information

Why Biogen?

Our mission to find therapies for neurological and rare diseases is a unique focus within our industry and this shared purpose is what connects us as a team. We work together to overcome obstacles and to follow the science. We are resilient as we strive to make an impact on our patients’ lives and on changing the course of medicine.

Together, we pioneer. Together, we thrive."}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05603-1-000096812", "text": "Senior Solution Architect with D365 FO Knowledge 80-100% (m/w/d)

The Bossard Group is a leading international supplier of product solutions and services in industrial fastener and assembly technology headquartered in Zug. Choose Bossard as your employer and benefit from attractive employment conditions. To complement our Group IT team, we are looking for an experienced

Senior Solution Architect with D365 FO Knowledge 80-100% (m/w/d)

Your Mission

As a senior Solution Architect, you join the newly established IT Architecture team and participate in shaping the future architecture, organization and strategy, especially with respect to agility and cloud. You bring strong hands-on expertise with Microsoft D365 F&O and its integration with other systems in a hybrid landscape (on-premises and Azure Cloud). You bring experience in designing and building solutions and can readily switch in a bi-modal IT world between taking architecture ownership in projects mode and acting as a change agent and servant leader for agile products teams. You ensure the solutions and products to developed or implemented are fit for their intended purpose by providing end-to-end leadership on solution design encompassing all solution layers - business, software, data, integration, infrastructure and security.

Your tasks

Contribute to the definition of the IT Cloud Strategy, Governance (incl. costs), IT applications architecture blueprints (AS-IS and TO-BE), roadmaps, security principles, standards and reusable patterns.

Define, contribute to and communicate a shared technical and architectural vision across our major ERP program (D365 FO implementation), projects, and different products team

Participate in planning, definition, and high-level design of the solution and exploration of solution alternatives for future enablers (IT and Business capabilities)

Work with IT Portfolio Manager, to define, analyze (workload assessment), split, and realize the implementation of enabler epics (Business and IT capabilities)

Establish global ERP and IT landscape architecture by integrating Dynamics 365 solutions across functional lines (supported by technical architects from our implementation partner)

Define subsystems and their interfaces, allocate responsibilities to subsystems, understand solution deployment, and communicate requirements for interactions with solution context

Ensure that IT solution design balances functional, service quality, security and system management requirements

Assess and translate internal customers’ processes and requirements into D365 solution or best of breed solutions, including systems integrations and recommended ISV's

Review and approve design documents and solution from external partners

Provide advice on ERP system performance by proposing metrics to measure business and operations systems success

Ensure solution integrity, compliance, testing, and documentation

Coaches, supports and advices the department and business partners

Stay up to date and share industry best practices and provides feasibility studies when building new solutions

Your qualifications

10-15 years of total experience in Software development, integration, data and solution design

5+ years’ experience in Solution Architecture

Bachelor or Master of Computer Science or a related discipline and several years of work experience in solution architecture roles

Experience and deep understanding of Dynamics 365 for Finance & Operations

SAFe (or similar) and TOGAF Enterprise Architect certification is a plus

Deep knowledge in Microsoft Azure technologies (such as Power Apps, Azure Web Apps, Logic Apps, API Gateway, Application Gateways, DB-PaaS, Azure Service Bus)

Strong learning aptitude; ability and drive to learn new technologies independently

Strong ownership mindset; self-motivated and passionate; able to deliver without being asked

Excellent leadership, communication, visualization and presentation skills in English (German at B2 or higher a plus), able to communicate with technical and business audiences effectively

Are you interested in this sophisticated position to be a part of building the future for Bossard? Please contact Sibylle Bachmann or apply here. For further information please contact Stéphane Hinderer (+41 41 749 61 78)

Bossard AG
Human Resources
Postfach
6301 Zug"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05641-1-000092975", "text": "Data Engineer Digital Transformation & Products Labs 80-100%

Your field of responsibility

An outstanding opportunity to join us as an Experienced Data Engineer to drive and build solutions for our internal customers within a big data platform. Studying fundamental and high impact business questions related to Preventive Analytics Detection that directly affect the direction of the company and the industry at large. Design and develop features, pipelines, algorithms, build minimal viable products, carry out extensive validation with business experts and operationalize your methods. Your responsibilities include development, maintenance and extraction of knowledge from strategic internal data sets, as well as manage documentation of data attributes and data sources in a concise way to support the development of an in-house developed capability for Preventive Analytics Detection.

Your future colleagues

The Chief Risk and Compliance Officer function is a highly visible, dynamic area where you can be an integral part of the decision-making that supports the bank’s business. We drive strategic and sustainable returns, and offer risk, controls and regulatory advice. You will join a team that is renowned for its dynamic and engaged culture. We believe our colleagues are our best asset. Become part of a highly motivated Analytics team at Credit Suisse. Join an international, demanding environment and work with us on the latest innovations in predictive analytics and visualization techniques to pioneer in building the state of the art technologies. Become part of an open-minded team with a strong team spirit in a collaborative, dynamic, and flexible working environment. We are a department which values Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) and is committed to realizing the firm’s D&I ambition which is an integral part of our global cultural values.

Remote Working? N/A - pending TWWW agreement
Your skills and experience

We are looking for a self-starter with demonstrable experience as an independent problem solver. You are willing to co-operate in a highly collaborative environment and contribute to the team's success while be taking on additional responsibilities to become a respected knowledge carrier within the team. We expect you to be a results-oriented individual who demonstrates integrity, responsibility and confidentiality required for dealing with sensitive data.

You will be a good match if you have:

A PhD or Master’s degree in Computer Science, a quantitative field (e.g. Statistics, Mathematics, Physics), or an equivalent education

5+ years of work experience as Data Engineer, preferably in the financial industry

Proficiency in Python and SQL is a must and familiarity with assembling and analyzing big data sets from disparate sources

Experience in working with distributed computing environments (e.g. Spark, Hadoop or similar)

Demonstrated ability in building data pipelines and ability in understanding & creating efficient data models for complex business problems

Demonstrated ability in applying statistical modelling, machine learning and exploratory analysis to large datasets: anomaly detection, classification, scorecard models, segmentation, clustering

Experience working in agile software team, good knowledge in software life cycle management including version control (GIT)

Ability to manage stakeholder to effectively collaborate and build professional relationships across all organizational levels

Excellent written and verbal communication skills with proficiency in English, German is an asset.

Dedication to fostering an inclusive culture and value diverse perspectives

*LI-CSJOB*

Mr. Albinus would be delighted to receive your application.
Please apply via our career portal.

Your new employer

Find a new home for your skills, ideas, and ambitions. Credit Suisse offers you the ideal environment to progress your career, attractive benefits and excellent training.

We are a leading wealth manager with strong global investment banking capabilities founded in 1856. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, and with more than 45,000 employees from over 150 nations, we are always looking for motivated individuals to help us shape the future for our clients.

Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success. We are committed to building a culture of inclusion with a deep sense of belonging for all of us. We will consider flexible working opportunities where possible. Our bank provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities, as well as those with other needs or beliefs as may be protected under applicable local law. If you require assistance during the recruitment process, please let your recruiter know."}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05720-1-000101563", "text": "Spezialist Data & Analytics (w/m/d) Teilzeit/Vollzeit

Spezialist Data & Analytics (w/m/d) Teilzeit/Vollzeit

Was in vielen anderen Unternehmen nur leere Versprechen sind, ist bei uns oberste Regel: &Los. Es steht für das Vertrauen, das wir in unsere Mitarbeitenden und deren Fähigkeiten setzen. Denn wir sind überzeugt, dass ein gemeinsamer Erfolg nur möglich ist, wenn jeder den nötigen Freiraum bekommt, Talente bestmöglich einzusetzen. Das bringt nicht nur Dich persönlich weiter, sondern das gesamte Unternehmen. Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung!

Daten sind Deine Welt. In einem kleinen Team begleitest Du den Bereich Operations in eine datengetriebene Zukunft. Du begehst keine ausgetretene Wege, sondern erschliesst Neuland. Dabei begegnest Du Anforderungen, Datenquellen, fachlichen Views, Reports und vorausschauenden Analysen. Nebst diversen Untiefen wartet ein motiviertes und modernes Umfeld auf Dich, das laufend aufgebaut wird.

Deine Verantwortung

Erschliessung der Daten in Abstimmung mit DWH (Azure)

Erstellung fachlicher Views als Grundlage für Ad-Hoc und Standard Reporting (SQL, Synapse)

Entwicklung von Standard Reports (Power BI, Excel) und ad-Hoc Analysen

Konzepte und Umsetzung von Analysecases

Ansprechpartner für predictive Analytics in Koordination mit Analytics Team

Enge Koordination mit Prozessmanagement und Automatisierung (z.B. RPA)

Die Stelle kann in Vollzeit oder Job-Sharing besetzt werden

Deine Qualifikation

Abschluss im Bereich Betriebswirtschaft, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder Informatik

Mehrjährige Erfahrung in der Erschliessung von Daten/Reporting

Erfahrung im Bereich DB Design und DWH

Hohe Selbstorganisation, Zuverlässigkeit, Verantwortungsbewusstsein

Gute analytische Fähigkeiten und strukturiertes Denken

Ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in Deutsch

ArbeitsortBaselAnstellungsartVollzeitBerufserfahrungMit BerufserfahrungBeginnnach Vereinbarung
Was wir bieten

Kontakt

Lea Marmet
Recruiting Partner
+41 58 280 16 96
Mache den ersten Schritt und bewerbe dich ausschliesslich online. Wir berücksichtigen nur Direktbewerbungen.

Für diese Stelle können wir keine Bewerbungen über Personalvermittlungen berücksichtigen.

Kennst Du schon deine zukünftige Führungsperson?

Frank Scherwey
Operations Development
[email]

Arbeiten bei Helvetia

Wir bei Helvetia suchen Menschen mit Ecken und Kanten. Echte Persönlichkeiten, die mit Herz bei der Sache sind, mutig vorangehen und nicht davor zurückschrecken mal auf Gegenwind zu stoßen. Denn nur wer Neues ausprobiert und daraus lernt, bringt sich selbst und das gesamte Unternehmen weiter. Dieses Vertrauen schenken wir all unseren Mitarbeitenden und genau das macht Arbeiten bei Helvetia auch so besonders. Wir sagen dazu: &Los.
Mehr erfahren
Arbeiten bei Helvetia bedeutet: &Los.

Hier wirst Du arbeiten

Was uns auszeichnet

Friendly Workplace

Helvetia setzt sich mit dem Betrieblichen Gesundheits- management fit@helvetia für die Gesundheit und Zufriedenheit ihrer Mitarbeitenden ein. Für dieses Engagement wurde Helvetia im Dezember 2016 von der mit dem Label «Friendly Work Space» ausgezeichnet.

kununu Auszeichnung

Was Mitarbeitende und Bewerbende über uns sagen

Top-100 Arbeitgeber 2018

Helvetia gehört weiterhin zu den Top-100-Arbeitgebern in der Schweiz. Universum befragte 11'000 Studenten der 70 führenden Hochschulen.

«We pay fair»-Auszeichnung

Die Löhne von Helvetia per 31. Dezember 2017 scheinen dem in der Bundesverfassung verankerten Grundsatz «gleicher Lohn für gleichwertige Arbeit» zu entsprechen.

Top Employer 2022

Wir sind zertifiziert als ein Top Employer Unternehmen, das herausragende Mitarbeiterbedingungen bietet. Wir stellen uns jährlich dem anspruchsvollen Audit des Top Employer Instituts.

Best Recruiters 2020

Wir wollen einen durchgängig positiven Rekrutierungsprozess bieten. Im Jahr 2020 wurden wir hierfür wiederholt mit dem ersten Platz im Rahmen der Best Recruiter Awards ausgezeichnet.

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05730-1-000093177", "text": "Stagiaire Master en Data Engineer (h/f) 100% - 6 mois

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05850-1-000091008", "text": "AppDynamics Sales Executive, Switzerland (sourcing)

Please note this posting is to advertise potential job opportunities. This exact role may not be open today, but could open in the near future. When you apply, a Cisco representative may contact you directly if a relevant position opens.

Why you’ll love AppDynamics:
AppDynamics is an application performance monitoring solution that uses machine learning and artificial intelligence (AI) to provide real-time visibility and insight into IT environments. With our unique AIOps solution, you can take the right action at exactly the right time with automated anomaly detection, rapid root-cause analysis, and a unified view of your entire application ecosystem, including private and public clouds. Using AppDynamics, you’ll finally align IT, DevOps, and the business around the information that helps you protect your bottom line and deliver excellent customer experiences. We make the digital world work. Our vision is to empower people and machines to continuously advance business performance to benefit everyone.
What You'll Do:
AppDynamics are looking for a strong performer who strives to push boundaries and develop their career each and every day. Evolving at a rapid pace, AppDynamics are dominating the Application Intelligence marketplace thus require experienced a-players with a thirst for action and an appetite for massive earnings.
This role entails that you establish trust and credibility with end users & partners through conducting product demo’s both in-person and via web-based technologies as well as:

Articulate and lead AppDynamics’ complex sales cycles to present the value of our full product suite to decision makers

Developing relationships within enterprise organizations, presenting to C-level executives the value of our integration services

Forecast sales activity and revenue achievement in salesforce.com, while creating satisfied customers

Who You'll Work With:
Working in an individual contributor position within a high-energy team who have a track record of significant over achievement. Pipeline generation is the lifeblood of our operation and in joining this team; you must possess that same aim to uncover new opportunity as part of your daily operating rhythm. While especially hardworking, the team retains a significant focus on personal and professional development, therefore we will only seek individuals wishing to grow and develop their careers.
Who You Are:
First and foremost, you will ideally have a Bachelor’s Degree or strong Software Sales experience, along with excellent negotiation skills.

5+ years of quota-carrying experience in a complex technology solution-selling environment, consistently meeting and exceeding sales quota

Both SaaS and on-premise selling experience a MUST

Previous Sales Methodology training in MEDDIC, SaaS Performance Management or Applications experience, and strong customer references preferred

Experience handling the sales cycle from business champion to the C-level

Excellent presentation and poise

Strong digital literacy, including Salesforce.com, Microsoft Word, Powerpoint and excel

Looking at the future of AppD within Cisco, people need to be able to work with channel partners, Cisco and our OEM products. This is essential for success

Why AppD+Cisco?:
The world is changing. Today, people and devices are more connected than ever before, raising the bar for performance and the customer experience alike. At AppDynamics, we’re unified in our mission to empower the enterprise with an AI-powered application performance monitoring solution that provides visibility and insight into the IT environment, as well as unified monitoring down to the network, so you can make mission critical and strategic decisions that drive business forward in real-time. When AppDynamics was acquired by Cisco for $3.7B it was the day before we were planning on going public. This strategic acquisition was 2.4 times more than we were planning to exit at, which highlights how much Cisco values the AppD business. So, why did they invest so much in us? As part of Cisco, AppDynamics will serve a critical role in helping drive Cisco's continued transformation into a software company. Being a part of the Cisco family allows us to benefit everyone - We do all of this while striving for a culture that empowers every person to be the difference, at work and in our communities.
AppDynamics is an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, protected veteran status, or any other unlawful factor. AppDynamics complies with all applicable laws, including those regarding consideration of qualified applicants with criminal histories (such as the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance). If your disability makes it difficult for you to use this site, please contact [email]. AppDynamics participates in E-Verify.
We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation."}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05863-1-000088599", "text": "Intelligent Automation - Technical Consultant (m/f/d)

About Atos

Atos is a global leader in digital transformation with 110,000 employees in 73 countries and annual revenue of € 12 billion. European number one in Cloud, Cybersecurity and High-Performance Computing, the Group provides end-to-end Orchestrated Hybrid Cloud, Big Data, Business Applications and Digital Workplace solutions. The Group is the Worldwide Information Technology Partner for the Olympic & Paralympic Games and operates under the brands Atos, Atos|Syntel, and Unify. Atos is a SE (Societas Europaea), listed on the CAC40 Paris stock index.

The purpose of Atos is to help design the future of the information space. Its expertise and services support the development of knowledge, education and research in a multicultural approach and contribute to the development of scientific and technological excellence. Across the world, the Group enables its customers and employees, and members of societies at large to live, work and develop sustainably, in a safe and secure information space.

We are looking for a German and English speaking ‘Intelligent Automation - Technical Consultant’ (m/f/d) to join the local team in Basel / Zurich.

The consultant should be able to lead the technical implementation of the different projects.

Your Tasks

Delivery of RPA consulting and implementation engagements with Industry leading RPA Platforms (e.g. UiPath, Automation Anywhere, BluePrism etc.)

Support in extending and optimizing the industrial RPA approach

Supporting RPA related business development activities

Supporting interviews with stakeholders to understand the automation needs

Assess & analyse potential opportunities for automation

Collecting and analysing application, IT landscape and infrastructure data to feed into the RPA use cases

Preparing and supporting workshops to play-back findings and explore solutions to specific issues

Documenting inputs and outputs for the specific client Business & IT landscape

Working on engagements to assess, design and execute successful RPA plans & technical designs

Identify and build reusable automation components, enablers and accelerators

Preparing solution, technical design and bid documentation for RFIs/ RFPs

Your Profile

Strong track record of implementing market leading RPA platforms. (e.g. UiPath, Automation Anywhere and/or BluePrism)

Demonstrated consulting experience in the area of RPA/ Intelligent Automations

Strong experience of process improvement concepts like lean & six sigma (Digital process improvements desired)

Good understanding of possibilities of Public and Private Cloud environments

Proposing end-end solution architecture and strategy composed of business, information, application and infrastructure domains

Experience programming in C#, C++ and/or Java, html, css

Microsoft Technology (VB .NET, Windows, Internet Explorer, SQL Server, Web Services)

Bachelor or Master’s degree in Computer Science, engineering or equivalent professional experience in relevant area

Structured problem solving, including hypothesis-based techniques

Demonstrating innovative and collaborative behaviours

Strong written and verbal communication, presentation, client service and technical writing skills, coupled with a strong interest in further developing and integrating operations with technology skills

Able to hit the ground running and demonstrate immediate value on high-velocity projects

Mandatory skills: Business Fluent written and spoken German and English

Here at Atos, we want all of our employees to feel valued, appreciated, and free to be who they are at work. Our employee lifecycle processes are designed to prevent discrimination against our people regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, or any other aspect which makes them unique. Across the globe, we have created a variety of programs to embed our Atos culture of inclusivity, and work hard to ensure that all of our employees have an equal opportunity to contribute and feel that they are exactly where they belong."}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05865-1-000079923", "text": "Data Scientist Intern - QuantumBlack

You will join QuantumBlack’s leading data science team for ~12 to 16 weeks in either Spring or Autum in Zurich. You will gain experience working in interdisciplinary teams consisting of data scientists, data engineers, machine learning engineers, designers and McKinsey experts.

You will also be joining a team that will challenge you and invest in your professional development through client projects and R&D workstreams as a plus. You will be helping the best organizations in the world solve their most difficult problems.

QuantumBlack helps companies use data to drive decisions. We combine business experience, expertise in large-scale data analysis and visualization with advanced software engineering know-how to deliver results. From healthcare to Formula One, we help companies prototype, develop, and deploy bespoke data driven solutions to make better decisions.

You will work closely with our team of data scientists with backgrounds in fields such as (but not limited to) robotics, machine learning, physics, applied mathematics and neuroscience.

In this role you will work on either R&D workstreams, on live client projects, or a mixture of both. You will attend data science journal clubs and attend interdisciplinary team meetings.

You will be exposed to the most challenging problems by connecting real world business questions to machine learning methods and translating the results of your R&D work into actionable business solutions.

You share our curiosity for new methods and technologies, and our enthusiasm for data science challenges. As such, you will support our client services lead to identify business hypotheses and metrics, and you'll have the opportunity to define and drive the analytical scope and method for projects, including formulating and shaping the models.

You will communicate complex analytics concepts in a clear and concise manner to business leaders. You will use math, stats and machine learning to derive key insights across various industry sectors including Formula 1, pharma, automotive and high-tech. You will have the chance to write highly optimised code to advance our internal Data Science toolbox, and you'll develop world-class data science products for clients as well as for our data science team.

Real-World Impact – No project is ever the same; we work across multiple sectors, providing unique learning and development opportunities internationally.

Fusing Tech & Leadership – We work with the latest technologies and methodologies and offer first class learning programmes at all levels.

Multidisciplinary Teamwork - Our teams include data scientists, engineers, project managers, UX and visual designers who work collaboratively to enhance performance.

Innovative Work Culture – Creativity, insight and passion come from being balanced. We cultivate a modern work environment through an emphasis on wellness, insightful talks and training sessions.

Striving for Diversity – With colleagues from over 40 nationalities, we recognise the benefits of working with people from all walks of life.

Our projects range from helping pharmaceutical companies bring lifesaving drugs to market quicker to optimising a Formula1 car’s performance. At QuantumBlack you have the best of both worlds; all the benefits of being part of one of the leading management consultancies globally and the autonomy to thrive in a fast growth tech culture:

Healthcare Efficiency – We helped a healthcare provider improve their clinical trial practices by identifying congestion in diagnostic testing as a key indicator of admissions breaches.

Environmental Impact – We designed and built the first data-driven application for a state of the art centre of excellence in urban innovation by collecting real-time data from environmental sensors across London and deploying proprietary analytics to find unexpected patterns in air pollution.

Product Development – We worked with the CEO of an elite automotive organisation to reduce the 18-month car development timeframe by improving processes, designs and team structures.

BenefitsThis is a paid internship.

Visit our Careers site to watch our video and read about our interview processes and benefits"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05880-1-000101953", "text": "Management Consultant - Banking

Business Consulting Deine Aufgabe

Als Business Consultant für Banking bist Du ein massgeblicher Faktor bei der Lösung von komplexen Herausforderungen unserer Bankkunden rund um Digitale Transformation, Strategie und Business Innovation. In interdisziplinären Teams ermöglichst Du durch deine empathischen und analytischen Fähigkeiten wichtige Einsichten und leitest daraus fundierte Empfehlungen ab. Deine menschlichen Qualitäten schaffen Vertrauen, Teamgeist, Energie und Klarheit. Unsere Kunden unterstützt Du in ihren Entscheidungen und hilfst ihnen herausragende Ergebnisse zu erzielen.

Du verantwortest anspruchsvolle Consulting Mandate im Bankensektor und leistest fachliche Beiträge dazu. Dabei hast Du einen integralen Blick auf die Mandate und behältst neben der Customer Experience auch die Business- und Technologieaspekte stets im Auge.

Zusammen mit unserem Sales Team gelingt dir die Akquisition von anspruchsvollen Beratungsmandaten durch deine ausgezeichnetes Banken-Know-how, deiner kompetenten und integren Persönlichkeit, sowie deinen Fähigkeiten bei der Ausarbeitung und Präsentation von Offerten (Pre-Sales).

Digitale Transformation unterstützt Du bei unseren Bankkunden durch Deine analytischen Insights und Deinen Beitrag zu einer wirksamen Strategieentwicklung insbesondere für Prozess- und Angebotsinnovationen.

Dank Deiner langjährigen Erfragung aus dem Bankensektor kennst Du Dich mit ihren Kernprozessen, Herausforderungen und aktuellen Trends aus. Du sprichst die Sprache unserer Klienten und beherrschst das Consulting-Handwerk.

Du prägst den Aufbau und die Positionierung der Dienstleistungen im Bankensektor massgeblich mit, repräsentierst Zühlke wirkungsvoll auf dem Markt und hilfst weitere Top-Talente zu rekrutieren und entwickeln.

Dein Talent

Technischer oder betriebswirtschaftlicher Hochschulabschluss, idealerweise mit Schwerpunkten in Innovation, Technologie oder Customer Experience

Mindestens 6 Jahre Praxiserfahrung im Bankensektor oder in der Beratung mit starkem Bankenfokus

Erfahrungen in Business Development oder Dienstleistungsentwicklung

Praxiserfahrung in Customer-Centric Innovation und Strategy, sowie in den Bereichen Customer Research und Design Thinking

Kenntnisse von aktuellen Technologietrends (u.a Big Data/Machine Learning/AI, IoT, AR/VR, Blockchain, Cloud, Mobile) und deren Potential für Business-Innovation von Vorteil

Schnelle Auffassungsgabe, ausgeprägt analytische Problemlösungskompetenz, hervorragendes Einfühlungsvermögen, Kreativität, Mut und Überzeugungskraft

Teamorientierte, aufgeschlossene, integre Persönlichkeit, nachhaltig im Vertrauensaufbau zu Kunden und Mitarbeitenden

Überzeugende Kommunikationsfähigkeiten sowie sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse

Warum Zühlke

Wertschätzende Kultur - wir kommunizieren offen miteinander, schätzen uns ehrlich ein und arbeiten gerne im Team.

Weiterentwicklung - wir investieren 10% unseres Umsatzes in die Entwicklung unserer Mitarbeitenden. Wir helfen dir, durch kontinuierliche und qualitativ hochstehende Weiterbildung zu wachsen.

Wissensaustausch - wir verfolgen einen interdisziplinären Ansatz, eine Kultur des Wissensaustauschs und des voneinander Lernens.

Internationale Topic Groups - wir tauschen Erfahrungen und Wissen miteinander aus und unterstützen uns gegenseitig bei der Weiterentwicklung innerhalb unserer internen Communities.

Toller Arbeitsplatz - wir bieten eine Kultur des Vertrauens, ermutigen unsere Mitarbeitenden, über den Tellerrand zu schauen und ihre Ideen zu teilen.

Festanstellung 80-100% Zürich Jetzt bewerben"}
