{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05888-1-000098820", "text": "Applied AI/Research Analytics Lead

Applied AI/Research Analytics Lead - (18029196)
Description

About Syngenta:

Syngenta is a leading science-based Agtech company; dedicated to bringing plant potential to life. Each of our 28,000 employees in more than 90 countries works together to solve one of humanity’s most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture.

Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. No matter what your position, you will have a vital role in safely feeding the world and taking care of our planet. Join us and help shape the future of agriculture

About this opportunity: Help drive adoption of advanced machine learning in our Technology and Digital Integration (TDI) function, Crop Protection R&D

As part of Syngenta's digital transformation journey, there is an increasing emphasis on data-driven approaches in R&D. From exploiting new digital technologies in the lab to extracting maximum value from existing knowledge, data- and model-driven decision making is changing the way we do science and develop new solutions for sustainable food production.

We are looking for a data scientist or machine learning engineer with a solid technical foundation, a sense of curiosity and interest in applying diverse AI technologies to a broad range of real-world R&D challenges.

Reporting into the Digital Science & Technology team, you will be responsible for building a strategic vision for deployment of advanced machine learning capabilities across the R&D organization and driving its adoption for maximum impact. As a technical expert, you will collaborate with a diverse set of predictive modellers, data scientists and R&D domain experts from many different scientific disciplines to understand problems and use your judgment to find the best solutions.

Qualifications

With your background in machine learning, you should be familiar with major ML approaches used to solve analytics and decision problems in different domains, such as machine vision, generative algorithms or agent-based policy optimization. You have enough understanding of ML algorithms to tweak models, and from experience, you understand practical aspects of deploying different AI technologies, such as data needs, tooling, and scalability. Rather than needing to be an expert in a specific field, you will work with diverse scientists and IT delivery teams to understand which features to exploit, and identify approaches that can be used across different parts of the organization. A background in life sciences is a plus, but not essential.

Ideally, you are a hands-on person who enjoys working with a diverse set of people and bringing them together, is motivated to continuously learn and expand your horizon, and likes prototyping and creatively applying new methods.

Good communication skills, strategic thinking and the ability to work flexibly in cross-functional teams are essential.

In return for your skills and knowledge Syngenta will offer:

Flexible working location in office base and or home working

Competitive benefits package

The opportunity to work with and learn from highly qualified and experienced employees

We embrace and encourage diversity, and this is what drives our innovation and lets us outperform the market. [wwwadr]

Primary Location
: GBR-Berkshire-Bracknell
Other Locations
: CHE-Basel-Basel
Job
: R&D - Research"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05888-1-000098824", "text": "AI Planner Trainee

AI Planner Trainee - (18035421)
Description

Syngenta Group is one of the world’s leading agriculture innovation companies, with roots going back more than 250 years. Its 48,000 people across more than 100 countries strive to transform agriculture through breakthrough products and technologies that play a vital role in enabling the food chain to feed the world safely, sustainably and with respect for our planet. Swiss headquartered and Chinese-owned, the Group draws strength from its four business units – Syngenta Crop Protection headquartered in Switzerland, Syngenta Seeds headquartered in the United States, ADAMA headquartered in Israel, and Syngenta Group China – that provide industry-leading ways to serve customers everywhere.

AI Planner Trainee – 12 months (18035421)

In this 12-month internship position you will maintain agreed service levels of the business by managing the end-to-end supply chain for a number of allocated active ingredient families - Ensure efficient use of the end-to-end inventory, whilst minimizing working capital - Work closely with various stakeholder (commercial, supply chain managers, sourcing team).

Accountabilities:

Manage the overall supply/demand balance for the respective portfolio by reviewing the sales forecast, AI net demands, and then creating balanced production/purchase plans for the planning horizon

Proactively identify demand uncertainties and future supply constraints to develop options/scenarios, ensuring that future supply plans are optimized

Provide operational coordination across the end-to-end supply chain to achieve the right balance between inventory and customer service levels

Utilize financial metrics to optimize cash management when managing trade-offs between inventory, production, purchases, and logistics decisions

Actively contribute to and coordinate execution of supply chain (re)design activities in close

Qualifications

Requirements:

Degree or equivalent in Business, Logistics, Science or Engineering, formal supply chain qualification preferred

Understanding of Supply Chain Planning processes & relevant experience in a supply chain planning environment

ERP and manufacturing processes knowledge

Focus on cost optimization and ability to manage differentiated supply chains

Highly responsive with the ability to prioritize and to communicate in a concise and timely manner

Ability to translate system figures and market insights into workable plans

Ability to understand and reconcile conflicting objectives

Team player, able to work across functional boundaries and cultures

Being able to challenge and discuss issues at various levels of the organization

What we offer:

We offer a position which contributes to valuable and impactful work in a stimulating and international environment

Flexible working arrangements and environment with an open culture and diverse workforce

The opportunity to work with and learn from highly qualified and experienced employees

Learning culture (Together we Grow) and wide range of training options

You will profit from an onsite doctor, gym, canteen, and other benefits

Interested? We look forward to receiving your online application including all relevant documents (cover letter, CV, diploma, certificates) – reference number 18035421.

Please be aware that the job title may differ from the position title.

Learn more about our team and our mission.

Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, or any other employment practices for reasons of race, colour, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status.

#LI-CS1

Primary Location
: CHE-Basel-Basel
Job
: Human Resources - General Management & Other"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05892-1-000089379", "text": "Software Engineer III, Front-End, Android System UI Engineering

Build Android’s core user experience in Kotlin and Java.

Work with PM and UX to imagine and refine the interactions and surfaces that users live with every day on their devices.

Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.

Experience with data structures or algorithms in either an academic or industry setting.

Experience with software development Java programming languages.

Experience with graphical user interface.

Preferred qualifications:

Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science or related technical field.

Experience with front-end frameworks, full-stack development, and/or API development.

Experience with one or more of the following: UI Design, User Experience, Graphical User Experience, Critical User Journeys, Animation, Operating Systems, Mobile, Mobile Interfaces, Kotlin, Android, and/or Android Apps.

Experience developing accessible technologies.

Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.
With your technical expertise you will manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables. You will design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions.

Android System UI is the tight-knit but growing team responsible for the overall user experience of the Android OS. We work with our UX and Product Managers counterparts through the entire lifecycle of every feature to craft the essential interactive parts of the operating system itself, including: ambient display, lock screen, authentication, biometric UI, notifications and related APIs and policies, including do-not-disturb, and wallpaper, theming, and customization, notably Material.

We relentlessly pursue performance, robustness, and user delight, because code will end up in the Android Open-Source Project and find its way into devices built by of original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) globally.

Android is Google’s open-source mobile operating system powering more than 3 billion devices worldwide. Android is about bringing computing to everyone in the world. We believe computing is a super power for good, enabling access to information, economic opportunity, productivity, connectivity between friends and family and more. We think everyone in the world should have access to the best computing has to offer. We provide the platform for original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) and developers to build compelling computing devices (smartphones, tablets, TVs, wearables, etc) that run the best apps/services for everyone in the world."}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05892-1-000089412", "text": "Software Engineering Manager, Mobile Infrastructure, YouTube Studio

Be responsible for the mentoring, growth, and happiness of your engineers, inspiring them to achieve their goals

Work across the YouTube Studio organization, ensuring that product engineering teams are productive and have the right tools to do their job

Work with the leadership team on roadmaps and strategies to ensure teams are working on and building the right things

Be accountable for the projects your team is working on and contribute technically where necessary

Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field or equivalent practical experience.

Experience managing software engineering teams.

Experience working with Mobile (e.g., iOS or Android) development and test automation.

Preferred qualifications:

Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related technical field.

Experience with platform engineering, building tools and infrastructure for engineering teams.

Experience with DevOps and continuous delivery/deployment concepts.

Experience with cross-platform tooling.

Like Google's own ambitions, the work of a Software Engineer (SWE) goes way beyond just Search. SWE Managers have not only the technical expertise to take on and provide technical leadership to major projects, but also manage a team of engineers. You not only optimize your own code but make sure engineers are able to optimize theirs. As a SWE Manager you manage your project goals, contribute to product strategy and help develop your team. SWE teams work all across the company, in areas such as information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. Operating with scale and speed, our exceptional software engineers are just getting started -- and as a manager, you guide the way.
At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together."}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05895-1-000083838", "text": "Professur für Healthy Ageing (Departement Gesundheitswissenschaften und Technologie)

Professur für Healthy Ageing

Hauptinhalt

The Department of Health Sciences and Technology ([wwwadr]) at ETH Zurich invites applications for the above-mentioned position.
The new professor will be expected to be a world-renown expert in the field of ageing research, in the promotion of healthy ageing or in the prevention of ageing-associated diseases like neurodegeneration or diabetes. In particular, she or he may have a long-standing expertise in the elucidation of biological mechanisms of ageing using human cohorts and/or model organisms to apply expertise in functional genetics or pharmacological/nutritional interventions. Alternatively, the successful candidate is an expert in applying exercise to prevent or mechanistic aids to ameliorate symptoms of functional decline. The research will provide unprecedented approaches to promote healthy ageing by preventing or reverting physiological, yet widely undefined hallmarks of higher age. Specific expertise may include (i) biological mechanisms of ageing, using model organisms like yeast, fruit flies, roundworms and/or mice, (ii) genetics of ageing and age-associated diseases, including neurodegeneration and metabolic disorders, (iii) mechanism-based prevention of physiological decline by pharmacological, nutritional or exercise interventions, as well as tissues engineering and replacement, and (iv) the quantification, maintenance and restoration of movement capacity applying high-end engineering and robotics approaches. Particular interest goes to researchers with a translational medical focus.
Additional prerequisites are a strong motivation and an indisputable commitment to teaching. The professorship will be embedded in the Department’s programme in Health Sciences and Technology, Food Sciences, as well as Human Medicine. In general, at ETH Zurich undergraduate level courses are taught in German or English and graduate level courses are taught in English.
Please apply online.
Applications should include a curriculum vitae, a list of publications, a statement of future research and teaching interests, a description of the leadership philosophy, and a description of the three most important achievements*. The letter of application should be addressed to the President of ETH Zurich, Prof. Dr. Joël Mesot. The closing date for applications is 31 May 2022. ETH Zurich is an equal opportunity and family friendly employer, values diversity, strives to increase the number of women professors, and is responsive to the needs of dual career couples.

*Die ETH Zürich legt Wert auf eine qualitative Bewertung akademischer Leistungen. In diesem Sinne sind Sie gebeten, eine kurze Beschreibung Ihrer drei wichtigsten Errungenschaften den Unterlagen beizufügen (maximal je eine halbe Seite). Dies können neben Forschungsergebnissen auch besondere Leistungen in der Lehre und deren Weiterentwicklung, Dienstleistungen zugunsten der akademischen Gemeinschaft oder der Gesellschaft, Softwareentwicklungen, Patente, Wissens-? und Praxistransfer, Spin-?offs und dergleichen sein."}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05895-1-000083846", "text": "Cloud engineer 60%-100%, fixed-term

Cloud engineer
60%-100%, fixed-term
The Swiss Data Science Center (SDSC) is a national center between EPFL and ETH Zurich, whose mission is to accelerate the use of data science and machine learning techniques broadly within academic disciplines of the ETH Domain, the Swiss academic community at large, and the industrial sector. The SDSC is composed of a large multi-disciplinary team of data & computer scientists and experts in relevant domains, distributed between our offices in Lausanne and Zurich.

Project background

The main mission of the SDSC’s engineering team is to build and deploy Renku (see our beta deployment at renkulab.io), an open source software platform that empowers data scientists to produce reproducible, reusable and verifiable analyses.

Job description

We are looking for a creative engineer to join our ranks. In this role, you will help build the infrastructure and application backbone of the Renku project. Your contributions will enable new features and ensure smooth access to instances of Renku for hundreds of researchers, analysts and students from around the world in fields as varied as astronomy, ecology, and personalized medicine. In addition, you will work closely with the rest of the Renku team to enable uninterrupted platform development by providing rock-solid internal infrastructure.

More specifically, you will contribute to the following areas:

Deployment, monitoring, profiling and troubleshooting of our development and production environments

Automating the lifecycle of our cloud infrastructure

Improving the deployment recipes of our platform

Consolidate and further the devops culture across the Renku project

Your profile

You are an engineer with a minimum of a BSc in Computer Science or a related discipline and feel capable of working with our technology stack:

We deploy and manage several Kubernetes clusters in an Openstack-based cloud environment.

Terraform is our tool of choice for infrastructure management.

We use GitOps (Flux) and Helm to manage the applications lifecycle.

Our CI/CD pipelines are based on GitHub actions and Bash/Python scripting.

Please note that we do not expect successful candidates to have deep knowledge in all the above technologies and frameworks. Ideally, you will have experience with some and be eager to learn more along the way.

We offer

Our engineering and operations team loosely follows an agile methodology. We work with a very flat hierarchy which gives individual engineers a high degree of autonomy and responsibility, and we encourage all of our team members to contribute their unique viewpoints to the overall decision making. The platform we are building is multi-faceted which means that our team is equally varied and constantly learning.

We offer a stimulating, collaborative, cross-disciplinary environment in a world-class research institution. Our engineering team of 19 hails from more than 10 countries and we are committed to upholding the team’s diversity in the future. We value work-life balance and will readily consider part-time employment options as well as occasional or regular home-office work.

In this dynamic position, you will make full use of your engineering skills. We encourage experimentation and creativity by actively promoting learning of new technologies and approaches on the job. We are dedicated to open source software and we encourage our team members to seek out opportunities to engage with and contribute to open source communities as a part of their development process.

ETH Zurich
ETH Zurich is one of the world’s leading universities specialising in science and technology. We are renowned for our excellent education, cutting-edge fundamental research and direct transfer of new knowledge into society. Over 30,000 people from more than 120 countries find our university to be a place that promotes independent thinking and an environment that inspires excellence. Located in the heart of Europe, yet forging connections all over the world, we work together to develop solutions for the global challenges of today and tomorrow. Working, teaching and research at ETH Zurich"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-05898-1-000087083", "text": "ML Engineer for Imaging

EPFL, the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology in Lausanne, is one of the most dynamic university campuses in Europe and ranks among the top 20 universities worldwide. The EPFL employs more than 6,000 people supporting the three main missions of the institutions: education, research and innovation. The EPFL campus offers an exceptional working environment at the heart of a community of more than 16,000 people, including over 12,000 students and 4,000 researchers from more than 120 different countries.

The EPFL Center for Imaging serves as a hub for state-of-the-art technologies in imaging science. The only one of its kind in Switzerland, the center pools the expertise of over a hundred laboratories distributed across the five EPFL schools. Its mission is to facilitate cross-disciplinary research in the field and anchor EPFL’s position as a world-leading institution in imaging science. It is also responsible for addressing the ever-growing needs in image handling and analysis of the EPFL imaging community. [wwwadr]

ML Engineer for Imaging
Your mission :
You will use Machine Learning and Deep Learning for image quantification on various projects in the Image Analysis Hub of the EPFL Center for Imaging.
More specifically you will:

Support EPFL’s wide community of scientists (ranging from astrophysics through biomedical imaging to quantum physics) with machine learning for image quantification. This requires experience and critical use of ML, knowing when ML is a viable strategy, which pitfalls to avoid and in what cases outputs can be trusted;

Contribute to the development and safe use of ML applied to image analysis at EPFL. This means creation of best-practice advice, as well as well-documented software tools and pipelines. This will be done in a strong context of Open Science and will benefit from professional programming experience with documentation and testing.

This technical role is closely linked with the “Image Analysis Engineer” also being recruited within the EPFL Center for Imaging. Main duties and responsibilities include :

Application of ML and DL techniques to the multitude of different image-analysis problems that the Image Analysis Hub will be involved in

Development of innovative learning-based techniques with wide applicability

Deploying ML at scale with optimised pipeline to run on large computers

Overseeing the correct use of ML in the Hub’s projects and collaboration through the creation of best-practice guides, as well as critical testing and evaluation of trained networks

Promote and co-supervise student projects led by specialised laboratories that address concrete problems generated by other actors in imaging

Be involved with student projects on imaging topics, providing supervision and training

Animate and support our “Image Analysis Hotline” chat

Your profile :
You are an image-analysis specialist with a MSc degree in a technical field (Engineering or Maths) who has used ML in a number of projects.

Essential skills and experiences:

Experience with creating and training networks for different image quantification tasks

Excellent familiarity with at least one of the main ML frameworks

Understanding of the decisions and importance of creating a suitable network for training

Good programming skills for imaging, especially in Python and CUDA

Desirable qualifications:

Experience with the development of open-source libraries and are familiar with various open environments (Jupyter notebooks, github)

Experience with advanced, scientific visualisation

We offer :

A stimulating, collaborative, cross-disciplinary environment in a world-class research institution that is at the forefront of imaging science

Over a hundred laboratories perform elite research in imaging, covering all scales from the atomic to the cosmological one, and spanning a broad range of applications

Equipment with advanced imaging facilities that provide access to the latest cutting-edge technologies

You will engage on a daily basis with a dynamic and creative community of scientists, and you will be involved in a large variety of exciting research problems in imaging. By joining the EPFL Center for Imaging, you will consolidate a growing team of experts working to anchor EPFL at the cutting edge of imaging technology for research applications, at a time when many exciting opportunities for imaging science are also emerging at the Swiss level.
Start date :
As soon as possible (July 2022 at the latest). Term of employment :
Fixed-term (CDD)Work rate :
100%Duration :
1 year, renewable (for at least 2 years). Remark :
Only candidates who applied through EPFL website or our partner Jobup’s website will be considered. Files sent by agencies without a mandate will not be taken into account.Reference :
Job Nb 2215apply online"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-06169-1-000084830", "text": "Internship - Python programming in Histology

JOB DESCRIPTION
Job Overview:

Company Overview:

At Labcorp, we believe in the power of science to change lives. We are a leading global life sciences company that delivers answers for crucial health questions —because we know that knowledge has the potential to make life better for all. Through our unparalleled diagnostics and drug development capabilities, we provide insights and accelerate innovations that not only empower patients and providers but help medical, biotech, and pharmaceutical companies transform ideas into innovations. Here, you can join our more than 70,000 employees, serving clients in more than 100 countries, as we work together to make a real impact on people’s lives. Join us in our pursuit of answers.

Advancing healthcare from the laboratory through the clinic requires many different strengths, experiences and perspectives of our exceptional people around the world. Explore our wide range of diverse opportunities and rewarding career pathways and see how you can work with an energizing purpose to discover your extraordinary potential.

Global Internship Program:

Exciting opportunity to be part of the Labcorp 2022 Global Internship Program as a Histology Intern!

As a Labcorp intern, you will have the opportunity to support meaningful assignments that compliment an education in STEM+ Business and Healthcare disciplines, and are inspiring and valuable in our mission to improve health and improve lives across the globe.  In addition to department work, we support your professional development and career exploration through program workshops, leadership speakers, employee resource group introductions, new hire panel discussions and small group ‘coffee chats’.

Capitalize on a dedicated training and development program that will support your scientific and professional career aspirations, and take pride in delivering work that helps save the lives of millions of people around the world.

About the Team:

The Central Laboratory Services perform laboratory testing to support clinical trials from our pharmaceutical industry clients. The laboratory is composed of multiple departments with specialized technical expertise.

Internship Assignment Summary:

Programming to develop some process automatization and interface applicable to AI and multiplex assays in Immunohistochemistry for oncology trials.

Education/Qualifications:

Minimum of a BSc in Biological Sciences or any related field

Information technologies applied to biology background preferred (master level)

Ability to collaborate with various stakeholders and internal/external colleagues

Embraces diverse ways of thinking through various forms collaboration and partnership

Proficiency in English is mandatory

Experience:

Experience with Python programming mandatory

Apply NowSave job"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-06172-1-000090245", "text": "Ph.D. positions within ERC project: "Perceptually-Driven Optimizations of Graphics Content for Novel Displays"

Faculty of Informatics

Ph.D. positions within ERC project:

“Perceptually-Driven Optimizations of

Graphics Content for Novel Displays”

The Perception, Display, and Fabrication Group at the Università della Svizzera italiana
(USI) in Lugano, Switzerland, is looking for highly motivated Ph.D. candidates to work at the
intersection of computer graphics, novel display technologies, and visual perception within
the ERC Starting Grant project “Perceptually-Driven Optimizations of Graphics Content for
Novel Displays”. The positions are fully-funded. We offer a competitive salary in line with
Swiss universities.

The goal of the project is to develop new content adaptation and generation techniques for
future displays, such that the displayed images closely match the capabilities of novel
display devices as well as the requirements of human perception. The approach should
assure that the computational resources are not wasted for generating content which is
irrelevant to observers, and guarantee the highest perceived quality possible. We would like
to focus on the newly emerging display technologies such as virtual reality and augmented
reality displays which allow for addressing all visual cues available in the real world.

Asuccessful candidate should have:

Master degree in computer science or a closely related field,

a good programming and math skills,

knowledge of computer graphics/vision tools, such as OpenGL, OpenCV, Matlab,

fluent English, both written and spoken,

a strong desire for research and publishing at top venues,

an experience with deep learning frameworks will be an additional advantage.

The course work and interests in one or more of the following areas are desired:

computer graphics & rendering,

image & video processing,

new display devices (such as VR and AR),

human visual perception,

eye tracking,

machine learning.

Applications should be sent directly to Prof. Piotr Didyk ([email]). The subject of
the e-mail should start with the phrase “[Application]”.
The documents should include:

CV,

transcripts of records,

a statement of purpose,

contacts to 2-3 persons who agreed to write recommendation letters,

a complete list of publications, if any.

page 2 / 2

Perception, Display, and Fabrication Group at the USI Lugano in Switzerland conducts
high-quality research in the field of computer graphics and computer vision. Their goal is to
combine computational techniques with human perception and hardware design to create
better display and fabrication techniques. The areas of expertise include computer graphics,
new display technologies, image/video processing, 3D printing, computational fabrication,
and human perception. We focus on publishing at the top computer graphics and computer
vision venues. Many of our works have been presented as technical papers at the ACM
SIGGRAPH conference series. We expect the candidates to contribute to this success. The
group has several ongoing collaborations with world-leading research centers including MIT,
Harvard, University of Toronto, Adobe Systems, Nvidia, and Max Planck Institute. The future
group members are expected to take an active part in these activities.

The Faculty of Informatics at Università della Svizzera italiana is defined by its passion
for scientific research. Around 200 top researchers from around the world conduct research
in several computer science areas, with tens of millions of Swiss francs in competitive
funding obtained to date. Over the years, the Faculty has become one of the leading
research centers in Switzerland and an international point of reference in many fields.
More information about the faculty: [wwwadr]

More information about the positions and the group:

contact: [email]

visit: [wwwadr]"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-06194-1-000086195", "text": "Dipl. Fachfrau/-mann Operationstechnik 80%-100%

Dipl. Fachfrau/-mann Operationstechnik

80% - 100%
Per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung suchen wir eine/-n Dipl. Fachfrau/-mann Operationstechnik.

Ihre Aufgaben
Unser moderner Operationsbetrieb mit den Fachgebieten Viszeral-, Gefäss-, Neuro-, Kinderchirurgie, Hand-/Plastische Chirurgie, Traumatologie, Orthopädie, Urologie, Gynäkologie sowie Kiefer und ORL bieten Ihnen garantiert einen abwechslungsreichen Arbeitsalltag.
Dank der eingeführten Fachspezialisierung können sie sich nach der Einführung in den Bereichen der Gruppe "Innere Organe" (Viszeral-,Thorax-, Gefässchirurgie, Gynäkologie, Urologie und Kinderchirurgie) oder der Gruppe "Muskuloskeletal" (Orthopädie, Traumatologie, Neurochirurgie, Hand-/Plastische Chirurgie, Kieferchirurgie und ORL) vertieft einarbeiten.

Ihr Profil
Sie sind eine kompetente, flexible und motivierte Dipl. Fachperson Operationstechnik mit grossem beruflichem Engagement und zeichnen sich durch Belastbarkeit und Einfühlungsvermögen aus. Eigeninitiative, Kreativität, Organisationstalent und teamorientiertes Handeln sind Ihre Stärken. Durch Ihre kommunikative Art fällt es Ihnen leicht, mit den interdisziplinären Schnittstellen im Spital eine gute Zusammenarbeit zu pflegen.

Unser Angebot
Unser OP-Betrieb beinhaltet insgesamt 18 modern ausgestattete Operationssäle. Neben 6 voll integrierten Sälen verfügen wir auch über einen Hybrid-OP. Modernste Eingriffsmethoden wie z.B die Robotik, 3D Laparoskopie oder navigierte Eingriffe finden bei uns ihren Einsatz.
Wir bieten Ihnen zudem einen modernen Arbeitsplatz in einem interessanten und abwechslungsreichen medizinischen Umfeld. Sie profitieren von unseren zeitgemässen Anstellungsbedingungen, attraktiven Mitarbeitervergünstigungen und einem breiten Aus- und Weiterbildungsangebot. Ein kollegiales und motiviertes Team erwartet Sie.

Wünschen Sie weitere Auskünfte?
Ralf Baltensperger
Leiter Pflege
Tel. 052 266 42 74

Gerne erwarten wir Ihre vollständige Online-Bewerbung.

Für diese Stellenvakanz wünschen wir keine Unterstützung durch Personalvermittlungen.

Ihre Vorteile am KSW
Arbeitszeit / Ferien
Mind. 26 Tage Ferien pro Jahr – für alle Mitarbeitenden.
Teilzeitarbeit, flexible, gleitende Arbeitszeiten, Home-Office und unbezahlte Urlaube – alles möglich am KSW.

Fort- und Weiterbildungen
Jährlich 40 überfachliche und 50 fachliche Fortbildungen – nutzen Sie das breite Angebot.

KSW-Kultur
Wir haben ein Zeichen für eine unkomplizierte Zusammenarbeit gesetzt: seit dem 1. Januar 2020 sind wir im KSW alle per "Du".

Vorsorge
Mitarbeitende vom KSW profitieren von sehr guten Sozialleistungen. So liegt die Pensionskassenlösung mit der BVK weit über dem gesetzlichen Minimum.

Gesundheit
Interne Trainingsmöglichkeiten, Vergünstigungen auf Fitness-Abos, in Apotheken sowie bei den beliebtesten Krankenkassen - profitieren Sie von einem umfassenden Angebot für Ihre Gesundheit."}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-06226-1-000090880", "text": "PhD Student in Programming Languages and Software Engineering (m/w/d) 100 %

PhD Student in Programming Languages and Software Engineering (m/w/d)
100% (unlimited, by 01.09.2020)
Your tasks

Design of new programming languages, runtimes, and type systems

Code analysis and empirical studies on software development

Consistency and fault tolerance in distributed systems

Software engineering for artificial intelligence

Languages and middleware for distributed event processing and realtime analytics

Language-based software security

Your profile

University degree in computer science or mathematics, or a comparable subject

The ideal candidate has a Programming Language, Software Engineering or Distributed Systems background. Depending on the specific target project, candidates with a Security background are also welcome

Good communication skills in spoken and written English

Strong skills in high-level object-oriented programming languages and ability to work independently in programming non-trivial systems

You look for a young, dynamic, and diverse working environment and want to bring in your creativity for the benefits of the team and all its members

You are interested in working with complex topics

You are motivated by both personal and team accomplishments

You enjoy lifelong learning and you have a keen interest to learn new technologies

You enjoy working in a research environment

The Programming Group is part of School of Computer science at the University of St.Gallen. The group develops research in programming languages (language design, theory, and implementation) and software engineering (tools, programming techniques, design of software systems). We are looking forward to your online-application. apply here
Inspirational Work Environment

Executive Education

Network

Family & Career

Equal Opportunities

Fit and Healthy

Inspirational Work Environment

At the HSG, as Europe's leading business university, we operate in an entrepreneurial environment where you will meet highly qualified, ambitious experts - both regionally and internationally. For example, you benefit from a modern IT infrastructure and, in our library via HSGswisscovery, from nationwide access to the wealth of scientific information available.

Executive Education

We support internal and external executive education opportunities. Our internal executive education programme offers you a practical, dedicated and didactically mature transfer of knowledge in the form of seminars, e-learning, coaching and collegial advice. We support task-specific external training and executive education financially as well as with regard to the time required.

Network

We promote our culture of cross-functional collaboration and create space for forging valuable relationships - also with external partners. Regular exchanges and internal events help to strengthen these relationships and make them long-lasting.

Family & Career

We provide our employees with flexible work time models with a variable number of hours per week. As a family-friendly employer, we offer part-time positions, 16 weeks of maternity leave and a subsidised crèche, as well as support with childcare during the vacations.

Equal Opportunities

The University enables equal opportunities for all employees and students. This applies to degree courses and work, as well as academic careers, university management positions and the reconciliation of studies, work and private commitments. We are committed to this with various measures in the areas of teaching, research, administration and the Presidency.

Fit and Healthy

We help you stay fit and healthy. In addition to our diverse range of sports activities at the university, most of which are free of charge, and campaign weeks for corporate health management, we also offer you fruit in the workplace. In our canteen you will find a wide selection of freshly prepared meals - from vegetarian to fish dishes - at discounted prices.

Further information on working at the HSG can be found here.

Professor

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2022-03-06228-1-000103117", "text": "Post-doctoral Researcher in Accounting

Introduction

UNIL is a leading international teaching and research institution, with over 5,000 employees and 17,000 students split between its Dorigny campus, CHUV and Epalinges. As an employer, UNIL encourages excellence, individual recognition and responsibility.

Presentation

The Department of Accounting and Control (DAC) invites applications for a

Post-Doctoral Researcher in Accounting

Job information

Date of start:                  01.05.2022 or to be agreed
Duration of contract:        2 years (for the duration of the funding)
Employment rate:           100%
Work location:                HEC Lausanne-UNIL, Anthropole Building

Your responsibilities

70% of the time will be allocated to research and teaching activities linked to the research project granted by the Sandoz Family Foundation – Monique de Meuron programme to the supervisor, Professor Gaia Melloni.
The specific research programme that Prof. Gaia Melloni was awarded is in the field of sustainability accounting and looks at the incorporation of social and environmental information into traditional financial reports and approaches that make possible to track organizations’ financial performance alongside their environmental and societal impacts.
A second main area of investigation explores whether businesses that have adopted sustainable behaviours have been more resilient during the Covid-19 crisis.
More information are available here:
[wwwadr]

30% of the time will be allocated to research and/or other related activities.

Your qualifications

	•  PhD degree (or near to completion) with excellent skills of quantitative data collection and analysis;

	•  Strong interest for research in the fields of Sustainability accounting, Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) disclosure and/or performance measurement, Corporate Social Responsibility (CRS).

	•  Skills in textual analysis, coding and programming language (e.g. Python) and/or data mining, machine learning.

	•  Fluency in English and strong academic writing skills.

What the position offers you

We offer a nice working place in a multicultural, diverse and dynamic academic environment. Opportunities for professional training, a lot of activities and other benefits to discover.

Contact for further information

For further information about the position, please contact Professor Gaia Melloni. E-mail [email].

Your application

Deadline : 28.02.2022

Applicants should submit a curriculum vitae, a letter of motivation, two letters of recommendation, university transcripts, job market paper and/or other working papers.

Applications should be sent only through the UNIL website [wwwadr] position no. 18782. Only applications submitted through this website will be considered.

Additional information

University of Lausanne
[wwwadr]

HEC Lausanne
[wwwadr]

Department of Accounting and Control
[wwwadr]

UNIL is committed to equal opportunities and diversity.
[wwwadr]

UNIL supports early career researchers.
[wwwadr]

Seeking to promote an equitable representation of men and women among its staff, the University encourages applications from women."}

Description

We are looking for a Technical Delivery Manager (TDM) to drive continuous improvement through applying agile / lean tools and techniques to deliver solutions of value. You’ll be responsible for the planning and shaping of technical delivery for our AI Products roadmap ensuring business and technical requirements are met.

Responsibilities

Agile delivery management for a state-of-the-art AI product covering cloud-based and stand-alone microservices with data analysis and orchestration flows built-in.

Drive AI platform evolution; supporting growth across multiple industry segment

Coordinating the delivery and development for multiple projects

Ensuring technical teams deliver on time and on budget

Ensuring clear reporting and communication across multiple stakeholders

Manage complex deliverables with cross-functional impact and multiple technical domains

Working with Architects to make sure designs adhere to functional / non-functional requirements

Requirements

Extensive experience in Agile product delivery in a technical engineering environment.

Ability to lead on a range of Agile techniques

Solid understanding of professional software engineering practices including; service orientated architecture, product development, design systems, build processes and release models

Ability to challenge and improve organizational processes impacting pace of the team.

Benefits

With more than 50 nationalities represented in our global team, you will work regularly with teammates in other countries, and with our community of researchers, editors, and authors from around the globe.

Our mission to create solutions for healthy lives also extends to the working environment we provide for our employees.

This includes:

100% remote working

Employees now have the flexibility to choose where they want to work, with remote working available on a part- or full-time basis.

Learning & Development

All employees have access to LinkedIn Learning (and Pluralsight for our technology team), an annual personal learning budget, and dedicated L&D time.

Wellbeing

We offer free online yoga classes, an employee assistance plan, access to the Headspace app, and four wellbeing days on top of your annual leave allowance.

Volunteering opportunities

Employees can dedicate three days each year to volunteer for a personal cause or through our volunteering partner platform, Alaya.
Apply for this job"}

Description

We are looking for a Data Scientist to work on production-ready Artificial Intelligence (AI) to support our industry-leading AI publishing platform. You will focus on recommender systems and work with Product Owners, ML Engineers and Data Engineers to develop solutions that will evolve our cutting edge AI Review Assistant (AIRA).

Key Responsibilities

Development, optimization and evaluation of ML models and algorithms

Technological review of data science solutions and communication to non-technical stakeholders

Proactive identification of opportunities for potential AI products within Frontiers

Effective collaboration with product managers, ML engineers, software and data engineers design scalable state of the art ML models

Key Requirements

Solid experience of working as a Data Scientist

Familiarity with: Regression techniques, ensemble methods, decision trees, clustering techniques

Proficiency in Python

Willingness to share and adopt best work practices on a common codebase (Python packaging, version control, pull requests, testing, continuous integration)

Experience with SQL and big data platforms (e.g. Spark, Azure Databricks)

Familiarity with problem specification formulation and translation to functional/non-functional requirements for ML model building

Familiarity with identifying under/over fitting in ML models and bias/variance trade-offs

Familiarity with algorithm selection giving consideration to accuracy, training time, model complexity, parameters' and features' management

Candidates are encouraged to share portfolio of recommender systems projects.

Benefits

With more than 50 nationalities represented in our global team, you will work regularly with teammates in other countries, and with our community of researchers, editors, and authors from around the globe.

Our mission to create solutions for healthy lives also extends to the working environment we provide for our employees.

This includes:

100% remote working

Employees now have the flexibility to choose where they want to work, with remote working available on a part- or full-time basis.

Learning & Development

All employees have access to LinkedIn Learning (and Pluralsight for our technology team), an annual personal learning budget, and dedicated L&D time.

Wellbeing

We offer free online yoga classes, an employee assistance plan, access to the Headspace app, and four wellbeing days on top of your annual leave allowance.

Volunteering opportunities

Employees can dedicate three days each year to volunteer for a personal cause or through our volunteering partner platform, Alaya.

Who we are

Frontiers is an award-winning open science platform and leading open access scholarly publisher. We are one of the largest and most cited publishers globally. To date, our 200,000 freely available research articles have received more than 1 billion views and downloads and 2 million citations. Our journals span science, health, humanities and social sciences, engineering, and sustainability and we continue to expand into new academic disciplines so more researchers can publish open access.
Apply for this job"}

Product Manager / Product Owner (Data Acquisitions)
remote
Lausanne, Vaud, SwitzerlandTechnologyFull time
OverviewApplicationShare this job
SVGs not supported by this browser.

Description

We are looking for a Product Manager / Product Owner to complement our product management team, to lead the acquisition and centralization of data sources (first, second and third party data) and to support our AI capabilities through reliable data inputs / pipelines.

This is a unique opportunity to work in the team that builds our Artificial Intelligence Review Assistant (AIRA) - which has been featured on numerous news outlets.

[wwwadr]

[wwwadr]

Key Responsibilities

Create and own the data acquisition roadmap for our AIRA suite of products

Discover new data sources that would bring value to our consumers

Lead the acquisition of third party datasets, via data crawling initiatives, partnerships or engaging with vendors

Perform cost-benefit analyses on acquiring a third party service or building an in-house solution

Extend our current crawling capabilities to support multi source data crawling

Build a strong logging and traceability process to ensure data lineage for all the incoming data sources

Connect with our internal teams to get access to internal datasets generated by our Publishing Platform and our CRM

Ensure proper integration of all acquired data sources in our data storage

Work in close collaboration with our Data Consolidation team to craft appropriates data models and schemas

Collaborate with data stakeholders to create access layers in our data platform and to enable surfacing data to internal consumers

Proactively propose and lead cross-departmental initiatives related to our Objectives and key results (OKRs)

Work with data scientists and data architects to ensure the most appropriate data structures are built and data quality is ensured

Take responsibility for the user experience and collaborate with designers and stakeholders to create the best solutions

Requirements

Solid background of working as a Product Manager / Product Owner

Prior experience with cloud data platforms, such as Databricks

Data awareness and fluency, ability to deep dive into raw datasets to find key information that will enable you to make decisions for your product

Strong analytical skills and independent, entrepreneurial approach

Experience with software development and data processing

Experience with Agile Methodologies

Solid communication skills in English, both written and verbal are vital

Desirable Skills

Statistical analysis and mathematical experience is welcome

Previous experience with Salesforce projects

Experience with defining technical specifications describing requirements for data transfer, transformation and storage, with attention to big data topics,

Ability to understand and challenge architectural decisions

Benefits

Competitive salary.

Participation in Frontiers annual bonus scheme

25 leave days + 4 well-being days (pro rata and expiring each year on 31st of December)

Great work-life balance.

Opportunity to work remotely

English classes.

Team building/sport activities and monthly social events.

Lots of opportunities to work with exciting technologies and solve challenging problems

Who we are

Frontiers is an award-winning open science platform and leading open access scholarly publisher. We are one of the largest and most cited publishers globally. To date, our 200,000 freely available research articles have received more than 1 billion views and downloads and 2 million citations. Our journals span science, health, humanities and social sciences, engineering, and sustainability and we continue to expand into new academic disciplines so more researchers can publish open access.
Apply for this job"}

Junior Consultant Technology Advisory (Cloud, Agile, AI) (part-time possible, all genders)

Führenden Banken und Versicherungen dabei helfen, ihr Geschäft mithilfe neuer Technologien zu modernisieren. Dabei gewinnst du tiefe Einblicke in die Prozesse und Systeme unserer Kunden und entwickelst dich schnell zum gefragten Berater bzw. zur gefragten Beraterin. Das ist genau dein Ding?

Dann lebe deine Leidenschaft in einer Position, in der du den Status quo herausforderst und innovative Strategien entwickelst, die beweisen, dass du verstanden hast, wie sich Technologien auf Branchen- und Geschäftsmodelle auswirken.

Das erwartet dich

Du begleitest die Transformation von IT-Umgebungen und -Organisationen zur Unterstützung digitaler Geschäftsmodelle (Multi-Speed IT, Agile Delivery, DevOps)

In diesem Zuge unterstützt du die Modernisierung der

	IT-Anwendungslandschaft

	(z.B. API-zentrische Architekturen)

Mit deinen erfahrenen Kollegen konzipierst, implementierst und steuerst du Cloud-Lösungen mit Blick auf Sicherheits- und regulatorische Anforderungen

Ausserdem lernst du, auf was es in der Entwicklung von Business Cases und Proofs of Concept für die Anwendung innovativer Technologien (z.B. AI, Blockchain, Analytik) ankommt

Mit wachsender Erfahrung übernimmst du Personal- und Projektverantwortung

Darauf freuen wir uns

Diplom-/Masterstudium

	der (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, des (Wirtschafts-) Ingenieurwesens, der Wirtschafts- oder Naturwissenschaften

Praxiseinblicke ins Bank- und Versicherungsumfeld, möglichst mit Industriefokus

Erste Erfahrung in Agile IT, DevOps, Cloud, Enterprise Architecture, IT Operating Model Design, Artificial Intelligence und/oder RPA

Starkes Interesse am Finanzsektor und dessen technologischem Wandel

Sehr gutes Deutsch und Englisch, projektbezogene Mobilität, Kommunikationsstärke und eine hohe Kundenorientierung

Bei Accenture arbeitest du mit authentischen Persönlichkeiten, die eines gemeinsam haben: Leidenschaft für Veränderung. Wir suchen ständig neue Mitarbeitende, die mit ihrer Persönlichkeit, ihrem Wissen und ihren Fähigkeiten unsere agilen und interdisziplinären Teams noch besser machen. Als Möglichmacher nutzen wir die Synergie von Technologie und menschlicher Intelligenz, um digitale Innovationen zu entfachen und die Welt ein bisschen besser zu machen. Werde Teil unseres Teams und entwickle sowie implementiere Strategien, die die Wettbewerbsfähigkeit und das Wachstum unserer Kunden stärken.

Dein Kontakt

Du hast Fragen? Dann wende dich gerne an unser Recruiting Team per E-Mail an

	Klicken und Email senden

	oder telefonisch unter 0041 44 219-5005.

Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Projekt:

Maintenance Support Techniker (m/w/d)

Maintenance Support Techniker (m/w/d) - Elektrotechnik /

	GMP /

	Englisch

	/ Service / Deutsch

Projekt:
Für unseren Kunden Roche Diagnostics in Rotkreuz suchen wir einen Maintenance Support Techniker

Hintergrund

	:

Wir suchen eine kommunikative und teamfähige Maintenance Persönlichkeit für den Bereich TechSupport. In dieser spannenden Position sind Sie für den Unterhalt sowie den 2nd Level Support von Testsystemen der Instrumentenfertigung zuständig und sind bereit in interessanten Entwicklungsprojekten für zukünftige Testsysteme aktiv mitzuwirken.

Aufgaben:

	•  Reparatur der Testsysteme bei Systemausfall und Sicherstellung der erneuten fehlerlosen Funktion

	•  Reparatur / Ersatz von Equipment oder Software auf den Testsystemen

	•  Einstellung und Parametrierung von Messequipment

	•  Reparatur von ersetzten Baugruppen an den Testsystemen

	•  Prüfen der Funktionstüchtigkeit der Systeme

	•  Schulen der 1st Level Supporter in den Linien an den Testsystemen

	•  Mithilfe bei der Requalifizierung von reparierten Systemen

	•  Erstellung der Nachweise bei Reparatur und Veränderung der Testsysteme

	•  Übernehmen von Dispatcher-Aufgaben

	•  Sicherstellung und Einhaltung von regulatorischen Anforderungen

	•  Unterstützung und Mithilfe im Bereich der Preventive Maintenance

	•  Bearbeiten der Supportfälle im Ticketing System inkl. entsprechender Dokumentation (Wiki)

	•  Beschaffung, Einlagerung und Bewirtschaftung von Ersatzteilen für Testsysteme

	•  Periodisches Reporten der persönlichen und laufenden Aktivitäten

Nebenaufgaben und Verantwortungsbereich:

	•  Unterstützung bei Fragen und Problemstellungen in der Produktion

	•  Mithilfe bei der Erstellung von Anforderungen für neue Testsysteme

	•  Unterstützung in den Bereichen Predictive Maintenance

	•  Mitwirken bei interessanten Zukunftsprojekten wie Augmented Reality, etc.

Must Haves:

	•  HF/FH und/oder mindestens 5 Jahre Berufserfahrung in den Bereichen Mess- und Prüftechnik, Elektrotechnik und Informatik

	•  Mindestens 5 Jahre Erfahrung im Unterhalt von technischen Systemen oder als Service-Techniker

	•  Erfahrung im Informatikumfeld Hardware, Software, Konfigurationen

	•  Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

	•  Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift (B2)

	•  Bereitschaft an Randstunden ausgefallene Systeme zu unterhalten

Zusätzlich erwünscht:

	•  Erfahrung im medizinischen bzw. regulierten Umfeld

	•  Offene, teamfähige und positive Persönlichkeit

	•  Neugierig, proaktiv und interessiert an neuen Herausforderungen

	•  Strukturierte Vorgehensweise, schnelle Auffassungsgabe und vernetztes Denken

	•  Verantwortungsbewusste, zielorientierte und zuverlässige Arbeitsweise

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-3-01-2022-03-09003-1-037907394", "text": "Power Platform Consultant (w/m/d)

Power Platform Consultant (w/m/d)

isolutions AG

Bern/Basel/Zürich

bewerten
Bewertung abgegeben

Bei uns findest du eine Crew von über 200 top motivierten Tech Cracks, von denen du lernen kannst und die von dir lernen möchten. Wir fordern uns gegenseitig heraus, für unsere Kunden die besten Lösungen zu finden! Denn wir haben den Anspruch, unseren Kunden stets die bestmögliche Customer Experience zu bieten, damit auch diese ihre Kunden ideal betreuen können.

Unser solides Wachstum der letzten Jahre, soll sich auch in der Zukunft fortsetzen. Damit wir dies erreichen können, suchen wir Mitarbeiter*innen, die mitgestalten möchten. Personen, die Freude daran haben unsicheres Terrain zu sicherem Terrain zu machen. Crewmembers, welche Fach- oder Führungsverantwortung übernehmen möchten. Gemeinsam machen wir es möglich!

Möchtest du Teil unserer Crew und unserer Vision werden, uns unterstützen und über dich hinauswachsen, neue Aufgaben übernehmen und die Zukunft gemeinsam mit uns gestalten?

Dann suchen wir dich!

Power Platform Consultant (w/m/d)

Dafür stehst du am Morgen auf...

Du berätst unsere Kunden bei der Umsetzung ihrer Requirements in anwenderfreundliche Geschäftsanwendung, basierend auf unserer Microsoft 365-/Power Platform-Lösungen.

Du entwickelst selbstständig Lösungen mit Microsoft Power Platform (Power Automate / Power Apps / AI Builder / DataVerse) und/oder entwickelst bestehende Lösungen weiter.

Zusammen mit deinem Team vermittelst du dein Wissen weiter und schulst unsere Kunden in Workshops bezüglich deinen erarbeiteten Lösungen.

Du übernimmst Verantwortung für Lösungsdesign und Umsetzung, und entwickelst deine Fähigkeiten laufend weiter.

Was du vorzugsweise mitbringst...

Track Record im Bereich Plattform: Power Apps, Power Automate, M365.

Ausgeprägte Passion für Technologie und Freude daran „leading edge“ zu sein, was die Produktpalette von Microsoft anbelangt.

Spass daran, dein Wissen mit anderen zu teilen, sei das in Knowledge Based Artikeln, Blogposts, Reference Cases, LinkedIn Posts oder auf der Showbühne unserer Events.

Ein Herz für Consulting: Du erkennst Kundenbedürfnisse rasch, findest pragmatische Lösungsansätze und weisst, wie man diese technisch umsetzt.

Ein „Growth Mindset“: Bereit neues zu lernen und persönlich zu wachsen.

Idealerweise ein (Fach-)Hochschulabschluss in Wirtschaftsinformatik oder Informatik.

Interessiert an einem Arbeitspensum von 80% bis 100%, Hauptarbeitsort in

	Bern

	,

	Zürich

	oder

	Basel

	sowie flexibler Reisebereitschaft in der deutschsprachigen Schweiz.

Was wir dir bieten können...

Top ausgestattete Büroräumlichkeiten im obersten Stockwerk des Circles beim Flughafen, im Postparc in Bern und an sehr guter Lage in Basel.

Top Unternehmenskultur – unsere Mitarbeiter umschreiben sie mit Attributen wie hilfsbereit, kollegial/familiär, challenging, „Learn-it-all“ statt „Know-it-all“, ambitioniert und natürlich das gemeinsame Feiern von Erfolgen.

Viele Mitarbeiter*innen, die genauso motiviert sind wie du. Von deren Know-How du profitieren kannst.

Moderne Art der Zusammenarbeit mit flexiblen Arbeitsorten und -zeiten.

Die Möglichkeit dich mit uns im Zuge des Wachstums weiterzuentwickeln.

Eine Organisation mit flachen Hierarchien und ausgeprägter Kooperationen zwischen den Geschäftsabteilungen.

Die Möglichkeit isolutions und unsere gemeinsame Zukunft mitzugestalten und eine attraktive Perspektive für deine berufliche und persönliche Entwicklung.

Zeitliche und finanzielle Unterstützung deiner beruflichen Weiterbildung möglich.

Instantané du poste

Ingénieur industriel/mécanique/process
Expérience de 3-5ans minimum en production/engineering
Première expérience de management gestion d'équipe réussie

Découvrez notre vidéo de présentation du projet :

	Extension du site de Production Nespresso à Romont

	ainsi que notre page LinkedIn

	Nespresso Centres de production

Résumé position

Dans le cadre de la forte croissance du nouveau site de production de Nespresso situé à Romont, qui fabrique les capsules Vertuo (dernière technologie des capsules Nespresso), vous serez en charge des résultats du secteur Torréfaction de l'usine (également appelé Sous-Comité Local Torréfaction). Vous serez garant de la sécurité, de la qualité et de la performance du secteur Torréfaction. Vous définissez et pilotez la feuille de route (Operational Master Plan à 12-24 mois) du secteur. Vous coordonnez, accompagnez et coachez les membres du Sous-Comité Local Torréfaction et les Working Groups (WGs) de la zone dans le but d'assurer l'atteinte des résultats. Vous êtes garant du plan d'activités des WGs et garantissez l'adhérence aux standards de la zone. Au quotidien, vous garantissez l'utilisation d'outils de résolution de problèmes adaptés.

Un jour dans la vie de-

	•  Garant de la culture sécurité de sa zone, il définit les standards élevés, communique ouvertement, confronte les risques et implique les collaborateurs dans l'application des standards en matière de sécurité (MSI, Safety map, PPD...) et de qualité (QMS, food safety, arbre de décision...). Il est garant de la bonne gestion des incidents SHE, qualité et du pilotage des améliorations de sa zone.

	•  Il pilote les indicateurs de performance de sa zone (RiR, FTR, AI...), coordonne les analyses et définit avec le SCL les prochaines actions/jalons pour atteindre ou dépasser les objectifs sur le trimestre à venir et les suivants (Operational Master Plan).

	•  Lead et participe aux revues opérationnelles (journalière et hebdomadaire). Déclenche les actions pour sa zone et en assure le suivi. Assure le coaching et l'audit des équipes opérationnelles sur les standards de sa zone. Accompagne les réalisations des activités des WGs Production et Maintenance sur sa zone et les coach dans l'analyse et la résolution des problèmes.

	•  Il est le garant de l'amélioration du secteur Torréfaction au travers des change management et PDCA, ainsi que des projets de résolution de problème dans le but d'assurer l'atteinte des résultats de sa zone.

	•  Il est le garant du plan d'implémentation TPM de sa zone et participe au déploiement de la méthodologie TPM de l'usine en tant que membre d'un pilier.

	•  Il compile les besoins en ressources (effectifs, formateurs et coach, matériel, machine, budget-) liés aux jalons définis et définit les priorités. Il est le garant de la montée en compétence des membres des WGs (opérateurs, techniciens, formateurs internes-) qu'il accompagne

	•  Il participe à la construction du budget du secteur torréfaction.

Qu'est-ce qui va vous faire réussir?

	•  Diplôme d'ingénieur en industrie (mécanique / chimique / agroalimentaire) ou équivalent

	•  Expérience de 3 à 5 ans minimum dans un environnement de production industriel

	•  Expérience réussie d'au moins 2 ans dans la gestion d'équipe dans un environnement de production/maintenance

	•  Expérience souhaitée dans la gestion de projet d'équipement industriel. (ex. démarrage de nouvelles installations)

	•  Connaissances techniques et très bonne maîtrise des outils de résolution de problème avec expérience des outils TPM.

	•  Maîtrise du français et anglais courant

	•  Capacité d'écoute et bonne communication

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-3-01-2022-03-09007-1-037794525", "text": "Spezialist Datenanalyse und Statistik (m/w/d)

Qualitätsentwicklung

Spezialist Datenanalyse und Statistik (m/w/d)

Spezialist Datenanalyse und Statistik (m/w/d)

80% (unbefristet, ab 01.04.2022 oder nach Vereinbarung)

Ihre Aufgaben

Konzeptionelle und analytische Weiterentwicklung der datengestützten Verfahren und Instrumente im Bereich Absolventen:innendaten und hochschulstatistische quantitative Monitoring-Daten

Vorantreiben der Anwendung und Nutzung statistischer Methoden und Analysen im Bereich Qualitätsentwicklung und Absolventen:innendaten für vielfältige Ansätze zur Weiterentwicklung der Studienprogramme, des Angebots der Serviceabteilungen, der Berufs- und Beschäftigungsfähigkeit nach dem Studium bzw. Doktorat sowie im Rahmen von Rankingaktivitäten und Akkreditierungen

Unterstützung bei der konzeptionell analytischen Weiterentwicklung des «Studienprogramm-Management-Cockpits» und der Indikatoren- und Kennzahlentwicklung (insb. Performance und Placement Data)

Vorbereitung und Durchführung empirischer Erhebungen und statistischer Analysen von Daten aus Befragungen und anderen Quellen

Zielgruppenspezifische Informationsbereitstellung für Entscheidungsträger:innen auf verschiedenen Ebenen

Abstimmung und Koordination mit internen Stakeholdern (u.a. Studienprogrammen, Academia, Serviceabteilungen, Alumni) und externen Netzwerken (z.B. Bundesamt für Statistik, Schweizer Universitäten)

Ihr Profil

Masterabschluss (FH/Uni) in Wirtschafts- oder Sozialwissenschaften mit quantitativem Schwerpunkt (z.B. Business Analytics, Predictive Analytics, Data Science), Mathematik, Statistik oder anderer Studienrichtung mit solider empirischer Methodenausbildung

Anwendungserfahrung und fundiertes Wissen im Bereich statistische Methoden und Instrumente für empirische Erhebungen und vertiefte Analysen

Sehr gute Kenntnisse statistischer Programmpakete wie z.B. SPSS, SAS und idealerweise fundierte Kenntnisse in R, Python

Power BI-Kenntnisse (insb. Daten visualisieren und analysieren, erstellen von Reports und generieren von Dashboards)

Analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten

Freude an der Zusammenarbeit in einem kollegialen Team

Selbstständige Arbeitsweise und Fähigkeit, sich ergebnisorientiert in neue Themengebiete einzuarbeiten

Sichere Kommunikation auf Deutsch und Englisch

Die Servicestelle für Qualitätsentwicklung der Universität St.Gallen (HSG) ist Teil des Prorektorats Aussenbeziehung. Unsere Aufgaben umfassen die Unterstützung, Koordination und Durchführung von Qualitätssicherungs- und -entwicklungsmassnahmen in den Bereichen Lehre, Forschung, Weiterbildung und Verwaltung. Hierbei fungieren wir als Schnittstelle zwischen zentralem, dezentralem sowie internem und externem Qualitätsmanagement. Das Team Qualitätsentwicklung ist zuständig für die Organisation und Koordination nationaler und internationaler Akkreditierungen, die Unterstützung der Rankingaktivitäten, die Durchführung und Weiterentwicklung von Evaluationen sowie die Bereitstellung von Monitoring-Instrumenten zur Unterstützung des Programmmanagements bei der Identifizierung von Entwicklungsbereichen.

Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Online-Bewerbung.

	Hier bewerben

Inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld

Weiterbildung

Netzwerk

Familie & Beruf

Chancengleichheit

Fit und Gesund

Inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld

An der HSG als führende Wirtschaftsuniversität Europas agieren wir in einem unternehmerisch denkenden Umfeld und Sie treffen auf hochqualifizierte, ambitionierte Expert*innen regional und international. Beispielsweise profitieren Sie von einer modernen IT-Infrastruktur und in unserer Bibliothek via HSGswisscovery von einem schweizweiten Zugang zum wissenschaftlichen Informationsbestand.

Weiterbildung

Wir unterstützen interne und externe Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten. Unser internes Weiterbildungsprogramm bietet Ihnen praxisnahe, engagierte und didaktisch ausgereifte Wissensvermittlung in Form von Seminaren, E-Learnings, Coachings und kollegialer Beratung. Aufgabenspezifische externe Weiterbildungen unterstützen wir finanziell und zeitlich.

Netzwerk

Wir fördern unsere Kultur der bereichsübergreifenden Zusammenarbeit und schaffen Raum für das Knüpfen wertvoller Beziehungen – auch zu externen Partner*innen. Regelmässiger Austausch und interne Veranstaltungen helfen diese Beziehung zu festigen und langanhaltend zu gestalten.

Familie & Beruf

Wir stellen unseren Mitarbeitenden flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle mit variabler Wochenstundenanzahl zur Verfügung. Als familienfreundliche Arbeitgeberin bieten wir Teilzeitanstellungen an, 16 Wochen Mutterschaftsurlaub und eine subventionierte Kinderkrippe sowie Betreuungsangebote in den Ferien.

Chancengleichheit

Die Universität ermöglicht allen Beschäftigten und Studierenden die gleichen Chancen. Das betrifft das Studium, die Arbeit genauso wie die akademische Karriere, die Besetzung universitärer Leitungsfunktionen oder die Vereinbarkeit von Studium, Beruf und privatem Engagement. Hierfür engagieren wir uns mit diversen Massnahmen in den Bereichen Lehre, Forschung, Verwaltung und Rektorat.

Fit und Gesund

Wir unterstützen Sie, fit und gesund zu bleiben. Neben unserem vielseitigen, grösstenteils kostenfreien Unisportangebot und Aktionswochen zum betrieblichen Gesundheitsmanagement bieten wir Ihnen Früchte am Arbeitsplatz. In unserer Mensa finden Sie eine breite Auswahl an frisch zubereiteten Gerichten – von vegetarischen Speisen bis hin zu Fischgerichten – zu vergünstigten Preisen.

Weitere Informationen zum Arbeiten an der HSG finden Sie hier.

Für Fragen zur Stelle

Dr. Karen Tinsner-Fuchs
Leiterin Ressort Internationales Engagement und Qualitätsentwicklung
Tel: +41 71 224 29 20
[email]

«Werden Sie ein wichtiger Teil unseres Teams, indem Sie Ihren eigenen Aufgabenbereich entwickeln und verantworten, qualitativ hochwertige Daten und Informationen erstellen und analysieren, die fundierte Erkenntnisse liefern für die Qualitätsentwicklung.»

Arbana Nuhiji
Fachfrau Personalrecruiting und -beratung
Tel: +41 71 224 35 36
[email]

«Die Deckung unseres Personalbedarf ist immens wichtig. Ich freue mich, dass Sie sich für unsere freie Stelle interessieren. Ich freue mich auf Ihre Bewerbung und auf ein persönliches Kennenlernen!»

Ihr Arbeitsort

Die HSG
«Ein Ort, der Wissen schafft» - Als eine der führenden Wirtschaftsuniversitäten Europas engagiert sich die Universität St.Gallen (HSG) in der Ausbildung von über 8800 Studierenden und bietet als eine der grössten Arbeitgeberinnen der Region rund 3330 Mitarbeitenden ein attraktives und innovatives Umfeld in Forschung, Lehre, Weiterbildung und Verwaltung.»

ABOUT US

Code Lane is a fast-growing Zurich-based startup working on cutting-edge cloud technologies. Our products and services range from interactive web experiences, cloud architectures for video streaming and cloud rendering, to computer vision and 3D graphics for AR and VR. We are looking for mid-level and senior frontend software engineers.

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-3-01-2022-03-09008-1-037733070", "text": "Chief Executive Officer

Codos Foundation - Chief Executive Officer

Codos platform motivates people all around the world to shift their commuting patterns away from regular combustion engine cars, towards environmentally friendly modes of commuting. Codos APP uses machine learning and AI to automatically detect the form of transport you are using in a privacy-preserving way, in order to measure the avoidance of CO2 compared to using a car. Every Commute Counts! Codos Foundation is a Swiss Non-Profit entity that leads the development of Codos. We are a young and motivated team which shares the passion for finding solutions and tackling the biggest challenge of our generation - climate change.

Codos Foundation CEO Job Responsibilities:

Creates an environment and culture that focuses on fulfilling the Codos Foundation’s mission, vision, and values.

Operational management of all business departments.

Analyzing organization operations; identifying opportunities for improvement, cost reduction, and systems enhancement;

Ensures that the Foundation is staffed with well-trained, quality, and engaged employees at all times; works closely with the executive management team to develop effective hiring, training, and compensation plans to retain our quality talent; and leads and mentors staff.

Creating and sustaining a work environment that is collaborative and inclusive, one which honors and values diverse opinions and allows staff to balance work and life.

Oversees financial performance and risk profile while ensuring that all of regulatory obligations are met; manages the design and implementation of the Codos Platform; and oversees brand development and the implementation of effective marketing strategies.

Represents the Foundation at important business functions, community events, industry training and events, and networking opportunities.

Ensures quality metrics are achieved through sound business processes following regulatory agency guidelines.

Focuses on consensus building efforts and strategic planning.

Ensures the timely submission of month-end financial and operational reviews, contributes to the development of and participation in strategic planning efforts.

Monitors Foundation performance by measuring and analyzing results, initiating corrective actions, and minimizing the impact of variances.

Communicates circumstances and events of operations to officers, managers and other appropriate people to keep all apprised.

Effectively manages contract negotiations and statutory compliance.

Updates job knowledge by remaining aware of new regulations, participating in educational opportunities, reading professional publications, maintaining personal networks, and participating in professional organizations.

Chief Executive Officer Qualifications/Skills:

Corporate management

Financial planning and strategy

Strategic planning and vision

Promotion of process improvement

Forecasting

Marketing and business development

Budget development

Passion for battling climate change

Ability to develop a shared vision and strategic directions with the Board and manage that vision to successful outcomes.

Ability to lead and inspire staff and Board in support of the goals of the organization.

Superior oral and written communication skills.

Ability to work effectively and flexibly in a dynamic and at times rapidly changing environment.

Valid driver’s license and ability to travel as needed.

Possess the willingness to maintain a flexible work schedule necessary to fulfill the responsibilities of this position, including occasional evenings and weekends.

Education, Experience, and Licensing Requirements:

Master’s degree in business, finance, engineering or a related field

A natural leader able to shape the future of climate change and building up and motivating an international team

Minimum of 3 years' experience as a CEO, CTO or similar management background

In-depth understanding of risk management, compliance, and regulatory requirements

In-depth understanding of budgeting, and capital planning management

Experience with corporate governance, business development and business planning

Strong negotiation skills in bringing together stakeholders

Strategic leadership ability and proven experience in building and leading a team

Fluent oral and written English skills; any additional language skills are advantageous

Compensation:

This is a full-time benefited; salaried; exempt position offering an attractive salary for the selected candidate with a starting salary range of 110,000 CHF to 140,000 CHF, commensurate with experience and qualifications. Codos Foundation also offers a comprehensive and generous benefits package. The salary and benefits for this position are negotiable.
