The Foundation for Research on Information Technologies in Society (IT’IS), an independent, nonprofit research organization closely associated with the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology (ETH) Zurich, is currently seeking applicants for the post as

Software Engineer, Computer Graphics

IT’IS, together with its partner organizations Schmid & Partner Engineering AG (SPEAG) and ZMT Zurich MedTech AG (ZMT), forms the Zurich43 alliance. Z43’s dedicated mission is to expand the knowledge and technology for the (i) characterization, optimization, and application of the electromagnetic near-field and (ii) predictive modelling of interactions between physical agents and physiology in complex anatomies.

Your challenges:

Development of novel and maintenance of existing visualization-related features in our computational science platform Sim4Life

Development of novel algorithms that operate on and are for visualizing very large computational human anatomical models

Development of GPU shaders for both processing and visualization of scientific data

Involvement in all stages of product development, from detailed analyses to the global level

Your strengths:

University or technical college degree (Bachelor, Master, or PhD) in Computer Science or equivalent knowledge

Experience with graphics frameworks and libraries or other graphics-related technologies such as OpenGL, GLSL, Vulkan, Metal

Fascination for the design of high-quality, user-friendly, and reliable software

Above-average knowledge of C++, practical experience writing C++ code

Excellent knowledge of algorithms and experience with computer graphics, meshing, computational geometry, and related problems

Strong sense of responsibility and highest quality standard of work

Self-motivation, good organizational and communication skills, impeccable attention to detail, friendly personality and team-spirit, sensitivity to customer needs, and ability to manage several tasks simultaneously, work independently in a fast-paced environment, and to meet tight deadlines

Good to excellent command of the English language (both written and spoken), ability to communicate in German a plus

Our offer:

Stimulating environment for innovation at the forefront of our research areas and key technologies

State-of-the-art laboratories, high-performance computing clusters, and production facilities

Vibrant and open company culture thanks to a diverse and creative mix of people from across the globe with various backgrounds in physics, electronics, mathematics, biology, etc.

Colleagues who are smart, competent, and passionate about valuable, cutting-edge work and who strive to meet high ethical standards

Applications will be accepted until the position is filled. Direct applications are preferred; applications submitted via recruitment agencies are discouraged. Please note that incomplete applications will be disregarded.

Please send your application documents (in English) consisting of motivational letter, detailed CV (max 2 pages), diplomas, transcripts (with grades), work certificates and/or reference letters (if available) to:

	).

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-3-01-2022-03-09018-1-025330917", "text": "Senior Business Development Manager

Zühlke Engineering AG

zurück

Drucken

Weiterempfehlen

Zu Merkliste hinzufügen

Bewerben

Zurück zur Trefferliste

Senior Business Development Manager

Die Marktbedürfnisse von morgen verkaufen!

An unserem Standort in Wien suchen wir eine/n

(Senior) Business Developer (m/w)

Welche Aufgaben erwarten Sie?

Sie verkaufen erfolgreich die wegweisenden Dienstleistungen und Lösungen von Zühlke. Sie sind verantwortlich für Kundenumsatz, sowie Pflege und kontinuierliche Erweiterung des Netzwerkes mit Entscheidungsträgern und C-Levels.

Sie identifizieren und realisieren Verkaufspotentiale für Zühlke in dem Sie Marktbedürfnisse erkennen und sich aktiv daran beteiligen, unser Portfolio mit dem Marktteam ständig weiterzuentwickeln.

Begriffe wie Industrie 4.0, Internet of Things, Data Analytics, Artificial Intelligence und Digital Twin sind nicht nur Floskeln für Sie. Durch Ihr Know-How sind Sie ein Partner auf Augenhöhe.

Kontinuierlicher Austausch mit Entscheidungsträgern unserer Kunden und Experten aus dem Markt helfen Ihnen, Trends und Innovationen frühzeitig zu erkennen und diese chancenreich für unsere Accounts einzubringen.

Sie begleiten unsere Kunden von der Pre-Sales bis zur After-Sales-Phase und sind für das Account Management wichtiger Partner verantwortlich.

Sie übernehmen Verantwortung für den Business-Teil von Angeboten, sowie Vertragsverhandlungen gemeinsam mit Engagement Managern.

Es ist wichtig, Kunden vor Ort von unseren Lösungen zu überzeugen, daher werden Geschäftsreisen auch ein Teil Ihrer Tätigkeit sein.

Was sollten Sie mitbringen?

Sie haben mehrjährige Erfahrung in einer vergleichbaren Funktion mit den erforderlichen Kenntnissen in der Erarbeitung und Umsetzung erfolgreicher Marketing- und Verkaufsstrategien, sowie gutes Gespür für Kundenbedürfnisse und Kreativität in der Konkretisierung von Kundenanfragen.

Verantwortung für Account Management, Marktentwicklung und Verkauf von komplexen Dienstleistungen.

Sie haben Wirtschaftswissenschaften mit dem Schwerpunkt (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen oder ein technisches/naturwissenschaftliches Fach mit wirtschaftswissenschaftlicher Weiterbildung studiert.

Sie sind es gewohnt, mit Entscheidungsträgern und Stakeholdern in einem etablierten Netzwerk erfolgreich zu kommunizieren und zu interagieren.

Juristisches Grundwissen und Fähigkeit komplexe Dienstleistungsverträge sowie Werkverträge im Sinne des Risikomanagements von Zühlke zu beurteilen.

Unser Angebot:

Zühlke unterstützt Ihren Erfolg mit einer einzigartigen Unternehmenskultur. Es ist uns wichtig, dass wir Sie durch kontinuierliche, hochwertige Weiterbildungen fördern. Wir sind interdisziplinär ausgerichtet, tauschen uns regelmäßig aus und lernen voneinander - hier spüren Sie, dass wir offen miteinander kommunizieren, uns selbst ehrlich einschätzen und gerne im Team arbeiten. Dazu bieten wir ein attraktives Leistungspaket, moderne Arbeitsplätze und die gemeinsame Leidenschaft, jeden Tag das Beste zu geben!

Freuen Sie sich außerdem auf:

die kollegiale Zusammenarbeit in einem motivierten und dynamischen Team

ein Umfeld der Innovation, in dem eine Partnerschaft auf Augenhöhe mit unseren Kunden gelebt wird

einen Arbeitsplatz, an dem eine Vertrauenskultur gelebt wird und der Ihnen viel Gestaltungsfreiheit bietet

Lassen Sie sich vom Zühlke Spirit anstecken und lesen Sie unsere

	Success Stories

	aus den Projekten.

[email]

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-3-01-2022-03-09018-1-036392638", "text": "(Senior) Data Engineer (all genders)

(Senior) Data Engineer (all genders)

(Senior) Data Engineer (all genders)

Welche Aufgaben erwarten dich?

Du entwickelst für und mit unseren Kunden komplexe Softwarelösungen auf Datenplattformen und operationalisierst Machine Learning Projekte. Du begleitest sie dabei von der Idee über die maßgeschneiderte Lösung bis hin zum Betrieb und Weiterentwicklung.

Du bist in deinem Spezialgebiet zentraler Ansprechpartner und konzipierst Lösungen zusammen mit einem interdisziplinären Team von Domain Experts, Software Developers und Data Scientists.

Du bist ein wichtiger Experte für Data Platforms, informierst dich über Trends im Markt und hast aktuelle Entwicklungen stets im Auge.

Du entwickelst innovative Softwareprodukte in den unterschiedlichsten Branchen und schaffst Mehrwert für unsere Kunden.

Was solltest du mitbringen?

Du trägst zum Kundenerfolg durch den Einsatz aktueller Technologien, Plattformen und Methoden bei. In der Umsetzung komplexer Software ist dir ein nachhaltiges Design und exzellente Qualität wichtig.

Du hast einschlägige Erfahrung im Bereich Data Platforms und Machine Learning Operations.

Du fühlst dich in der Cloud und On-Premise «zuhause» und kannst die für den Kunden optimale Lösung entwerfen und umsetzen.

Neben deinem breiten Grundlagenwissen hast du tiefes Fachwissen in einem der folgenden Bereiche:

Python Ecosystem for Machine Learning

Data Modeling für operative Systeme und Data Warehouses

Data Governance

Du bist ein kundenorientierter Teamplayer, der sich für Innovation und Agilität begeistert. Du arbeitest selbstorganisiert von der Idee bis zur erfolgreichen Umsetzung.

Du kommunizierst sicher in Englisch und hast gute Deutschkenntnisse, oder bist bereit, diese auf umgangssprachlichem Niveau zu erlernen.

Was das Arbeiten bei Zühlke ausmacht:
Bei Zühlke fördern wir ein Growth Mindset und unterstützen den Erfolg unserer Mitarbeitenden durch kontinuierliche Weiterbildung und Coaching, um deine Karriere, deine Fähigkeiten und deine Persönlichkeit zu fördern. Wir tauschen regelmäßig Ideen aus, geben uns gegenseitig Feedback und lernen voneinander. Dabei legen wir Wert auf eine offene Kommunikation miteinander.

Profitiere außerdem von einem attraktiven Leistungspaket und der gemeinsamen Leidenschaft, jeden Tag unser Bestes zu geben.

Flexible Arbeitsmodelle

Erfolgsbeteiligungen

Familienfreundlicher Arbeitsplatz

Initiativen für Gesundheit und Wohlbefinden

Selbstmanagement und die Möglichkeit, Verantwortung zu übernehmen und an neuen Herausforderungen zu wachsen

Einzigartige Veranstaltungen und teambildende Events

Wir lernen alle ständig dazu
Du hast das Gefühl noch nicht alle Anforderungen zu erfüllen? Wir erfahren gerne mehr über dich, deine Ambitionen und Ideen und freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!

[email]"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-3-01-2022-03-09018-1-037317891", "text": "Applikationsmanager*in Media Management Applikationen 80-100%

Applikationsmanager*in Media Management Applikationen 80-100%

Übersicht

Angebot

Auskünfte

Über das USZ

AGB Personalvermittler

Applikationsmanager*in Media Management Applikationen 80-100%

Stellenantritt nach Vereinbarung

Ihre Hauptaufgaben

Betrieb der Media Management Applikationen (Langzeitarchiv, PACS, Digitales Diktieren und Spracherkennung, automatisiertes Scannen, div. fachspezifische medizinische Applikationen)

Benutzerunterstützung für die oben genannten Applikationen (2nd Level Support, Schulung, Beratung)

Selbstständige Durchführung von Projekten im Umfeld der Media Management Applikationen

Planung, Evaluation und Einführung neuer Applikationen

Mitarbeit bei der strategischen und operativen Weiterentwicklung der Media Management Applikationen

Enge Zusammenarbeit mit unserem klinischen Personal, den Mitarbeitenden der Forschungsbereiche, den Kolleg*innen anderer Informatikabteilungen sowie unseren Systemlieferanten

Vergüteter Bereitschaftsdienst im Turnus mit den anderen Teammitgliedern (etwa 10-12 Wochen im Jahr), wobei die seltenen Einsätze keine Anwesenheit vor Ort erfordern

Ihr Profil

(Medizin-) Informatikausbildung mit Fach-/Hochschulabschluss oder (medizin-)technische Ausbildung mit Weiterbildung in Informatik

Berufserfahrung im Gesundheitswesen mit Applikationen aus dem Umfeld Media Management von Vorteil

Grundwissen Systemtechnik (Server, Speicher, Netzwerk, IT Security) von Vorteil

Erfahrung in der Applikationsbetreuung und dem Benutzersupport

Selbständiges Arbeiten, Eigeninitiative und teamorientiertes Handeln

Rasche Auffassungsgabe und die Fähigkeit zu vernetztem Denken

Ein hohes Mass an Verlässlichkeit und Dienstleistungsorientierung

Vor allem viel Freude am Umgang mit Menschen

Unser Angebot

Wir bieten Ihnen eine vielseitige Tätigkeit in einem engagierten, jungen und sehr motivierten Team, welches in hohem Masse selbstständig und eigenverantwortlich arbeitet, dies aber in engem Austausch miteinander und mit anderen Informatik Teams und unseren Lieferanten sowie den Kolleg*innen der Betriebsabteilung "Medizintechnik".

Sie arbeiten in einem vielfältigen und sehr spannenden Arbeitsumfeld, lernen die neuesten Technologien und Einsatzmöglichkeiten der Informatik kennen und können gemeinsam mit unseren Kunden, den Kliniken und Instituten, die Zukunft des USZ aktiv mitgestalten. Dabei möchten wir unter Berücksichtigung Ihrer Interessen gemeinsam mit Ihnen Schwerpunkte Ihrer Tätigkeit setzen. Während Ihrer Einarbeitungsphase begleiten wir Sie eng, bis Sie sich sicher genug fühlen, «eigene Schritte» zu gehen.
Im Team herrscht ein sehr freundlicher und freundschaftlicher Umgang und ab und zu unternehmen wir auch mal etwas zusammen (wo Corona dies zulässt...).

Das USZ bietet zahlreiche interne Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und zudem unterstützen wir Sie, wenn Sie sich extern weiterbilden möchten. Sie profitieren ausserdem von diversen Vergünstigungen für USZ-Mitarbeitende. Wenn gewünscht, wird ein Handy-Abo gestellt. In Absprache mit Ihrem Teamleiter sind natürlich auch flexible Arbeitszeiten und Homeoffice möglich.

Wir hoffen, dass wir Ihr Interesse für eine Mitarbeit bei uns wecken konnten und würden uns freuen, Sie vielleicht schon bald persönlich kennenzulernen.
Warum ans USZ

Weitere Auskünfte

Sollten Sie Fragen haben, melden Sie sich gerne jederzeit bei Herrn Ola Bengtsson.

Mail

[email]

Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung
Tanja Greissenegger
Recruiting

Über das USZ

Das Universitätsspital Zürich ist eines der grössten Spitäler in der Schweiz. Unsere über 8'600 Mitarbeitenden und rund 700 Auszubildende setzen sich täglich für das Wohl unserer Patienten ein. Knapp 43'000 stationäre Patientinnen und Patienten und rund 700'000 ambulante Konsultationen pro Jahr zeugen von dem grossen Vertrauen in das USZ und seine Mitarbeitenden. Bei uns finden Sie ein attraktives und herausforderndes Umfeld für Ihr Wissen und Können.

Mehr Details

Gesundheit

Gesundheit

Wir unterstützen Ihre Gesundheit. Neben persönlichen Beratungen und Kursen des Gesundheitsmanagements, die für Ihr gesundheitliches Wohl sorgen, bietet Ihnen ein subventioniertes Jahresabonnement beim ASVZ Zugang zu über 120 Sportarten.

Flexibilität

Flexibilität

Wir unterstützen eine ausgewogene Work-Life-Balance: Fast die Hälfte unserer Mitarbeitenden arbeitet Teilzeit und 50% der Arbeit kann im Homeoffice erledigt werden, wo immer es der Berufsalltag erlaubt.

Familienfreundlichkeit

Familienfreundlichkeit

Mütter haben Anrecht auf mindestens 6 Monate Mutterschaftsurlaub (16 Wochen mit vollem Lohn), Väter auf mindestens 2 Monate Vaterschaftsurlaub (2 Wochen mit vollem Lohn).

Weiterbildung & Entwicklung

Weiterbildung & Entwicklung

Wir begleiten unsere Mitarbeitenden über ihre ganze berufliche Laufbahn und unterstützen sie in ihrer Entwicklung mit individuellen Karriere- und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten.

Versicherungen

Versicherungen

Wir übernehmen 60% der Pensionskassenbeiträge und bieten Sonderkonditionen für Ergänzungsversicherungen.

Mobilität

Mobilität

Unsere Mitarbeitenden profitieren von einem persönlichen ZVV-Verbund-Jahresabonnement zum Spezialpreis oder erhalten einen fixen Geldbetrag als Beitrag zu einem Generalabonnement (GA).

Telefonie

Telefonie

Alle USZ-Mitarbeitenden sowie deren Familienangehörigen profitieren von Sonderkonditionen für ihr privates Mobil-Abonnement.

Weitere Vorteile
Details

Besuchen Sie uns auf

Weitere Stellen am USZ

Arztsekretär*in 80 – 100%

Details

Collaborator in Human Ocular Tissue Recovery and Preservation / Labormitarbeiter*in 100%

Details

Studienkoordinator*in Urologie 80-100%

Informationen

Teilen in sozialen Netzwerken

Teilen aktivieren

Welche Aufgaben erwarten dich?

Als strategischer Recruiting Partner für Experten und Nachwuchskräfte im MINT-Bereich begleitest du den gesamten Recruitingprozess von „start to finish“ und stehst den verantwortlichen Hiring Managern in sämtlichen Recruiting-Fragen als Sparringspartner zur Seite.

die kollegiale Zusammenarbeit in einem motivierten und dynamischen Team

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-3-01-2022-03-09019-1-037913143", "text": "Data Engineer (100%) (w/m/d)

Nächste Stelle

Data Engineer (100%) (w/m/d)

IAZI AG / CIFI SA

Bewerben

Zürich

Immobilienvermittlung

IAZI ist einer der Marktführer für Immobilienbewertungen in der Schweiz, mit über 100 Mitarbeitenden und Büros in Zürich und Lausanne sowie Goa und Kerala in Indien.
Seit über 25 Jahren bietet IAZI professionelle Dienstleistungen für die nationale und internationale Immobilienwirtschaft. Dazu gehört das universitäre Weiterbildungsprogramm «Certificate of Advanced Studies (CAS) in Banking mit Schwerpunkt Real Estate Finance», dass sich an erfahrene Berater und Spezialisten aus der Immobilien- und Finanzwelt richtet.

Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams in Zürich suchen wir per sofort oder nach

Vereinbarung eine(n): Data Engineer (100%)

Aufgaben

Aufbau und Verwaltung einer Dateninfrastruktur

Organisieren des Imports von Kundendaten in unsere Systeme

Implementierung von Richtlinien für den Umgang mit Kundendaten

ETL-Logik und -Implementierung (Extract-Transform-Load)

Kontrolle blick über die verschiedenen Daten, die wir im Unternehmen haben

Automatisierung von Datentransfer- und Datentransformationsprozessen

Verwaltung von Datenbanken und unstrukturierten Dateisystemen

Datenkonsolidierung, -aufbereitung und -bereitstellung für Data Science, Datenanalyse oder Dashboarding

Datenerfassung über APIs, Crawling, Scraping, usw.

Aufbau und Pflege von Datenpipelines mit Java, Python und SQL

Operationalisierung von Datenprodukten (z. B. Modelle für maschinelles Lernen) in die Kanallandschaft eines Unternehmens

Einrichtung und Unterstützung von Cloud-Infrastrukturen wie AWS, Microsoft Azure oder Google Cloud

Qualifikation

Abgeschlossenes technisches oder naturwissenschaftliches Studium (Uni/ETH, FH, HF)

Arbeitserfahrung in Datenbankmanagement und Cloud Computing

Fundierte Kenntnisse in Relational Data Modelling, Requirements Engineering und Schnittstellenkonzeption

Routinierter Einsatz von gängige Programmiersprachen (....)

Offene und kommunikative Art und Freude am Umgang mit Menschen

Selbstständiges, gewissenhaftes Arbeiten

Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse, Französisch von Vorteil

Benefits

Ein familiäres, hochgradig innovatives, motiviertes, am Puls der Zeit arbeitendes, interdisziplinäres Team aus Immobilien-, Finanz- und IT-Spezialistinnen und Spezialisten

Flexible Arbeitszeiten und hybride Arbeitsformen

Kurze Entscheidungswege und Offenheit für neue Ideen und die Möglichkeit Deine Perspektive einzubringen

Coole Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten und die Chance deine Skills kontinuierlich weiter zu entwickeln

Wir legen grossen Wert auf Chancengleichheit, Vielfalt und Inklusion

Attraktive Anstellungsbedingungen in einem dynamischen und modernen Umfeld

Bitte sende uns deinen Lebenslauf inklusive Motivationsschreiben. Wir freuen uns bereits heute, dich kennenzulernen."}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2023-03-05036-1-000258319", "text": "Application Engineer

WyzoTM is a fast-pacing spin-off from delta robotic pioneers' company whose vision is to set the new benchmark for accessible workplace automation in pick and place technology. The WyzoTM ecosystem design seamlessly integrates with and complements human operation, empowering new enterprising manufacturers to grow and transform their business - a big mission that requires people driven by big passion. So join us in this journey, and let's make the industrial workplace "Fast and further, together"!

Job Description

We are now looking for an Application Engineer to integrate our cross-functional structure in the Lausanne area to train, support and develop high performing integrators' base to meet the needs of business and our customers today and in the future. The aim for you is to be the first and best sidebot provider for existing and new integrators and distributors. In addition, you contribute to optimizing the value chain that creates a better ecosystem with our end-users and partners.

While reporting to the Business Developer Manager, you will work closely with development team and integrators.

Among Other Things, You Will

Evaluate and research solutions and concepts in the scope of developing the product Wyzo and its eco-system to support the development team.

Conduct validation of new release of WyzoTM products and accessories.

Support the development engineers and the industrialization team in supply chain management.

Prepare and deliver integrators training on the product WyzoTM on software, safety, vision, grippers technologies.

Provide on-site or remote support to integrators on deployment and implementation of the sidebot WyzoTM.

Support sales in helping integrators to understand the capabilities of the WyzoTM.

Create customized demos and assist with a technical proof-of-concept to demonstrate WyzoTM capabilities and how the solution will work within the customer's existing environment.

Provide after-sales technical support on WyzoTM programming and applications.

Communicate integrator's needs and product enhancement feedback to the development team.

Generate applications notes and knowledge base documentation.

Willingness and ability to travel domestically and internationally.

To shine and succeed in this role, we wish that you:

Hold a Bachelor's degree or higher in Mechanical or Mechatronic Engineering

Have experience with structured sales, plans, budgets, and pipeline management.

Have excellent communication & negotiation skills and the ability to build trustful relationships

Having overseas working experience in an English-speaking environment would be nice.

Bachelor/Master degree, in degree in mechanical/mechatronic engineering, robot technology

Have passion for robotics and solving technical problems

Have good debugging skills and innovative mindset

Be customer oriented and able to communicate with customer / integrators positively and in a timely manner.

Have business proficiency in English and/or German (written and spoken).

Must have very good communications skills, both written and verbal.

Does this sound like you? Yes? Then, why not apply?

We offer you a position in a fast-paced, truly global environment with an endless supply of future opportunities!"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2023-03-05076-1-000254378", "text": "Servicetechniker (gn)

Standort:
Wohlen, CH, 5610

Servicetechniker (gn)

Willst Du etwas bewegen und hast Du Spass an Auslandseinsätzen weltweit (ca. 60%) Dann bist Du bei uns richtig!

Dein Aufgabenbereich ...

Du bist für die weltweite Installation und Inbetriebnahme von thermischen Beschichtungssystemen verantwortlich (Einsatzdauer ca. 4-6 Wochen). Dabei arbeitest Du sehr eng mit unserem Kunden zusammen

Du bist verantwortlich für interne Abnahmen von Beschichtungssystemen

Du führst Service-, Kalibrier- und Wartungsarbeiten an thermischen Beschichtungsanlagen durch, sowie Umbauten und Aufrüstungen

Du erstellst einfache Rapporte von deinen Einsätzen

Du gibst Schulungen und berätst die die Bediener vor Ort

Du unterstützt bei Innovationsprojekten

Das kannst du von uns erwarten ...

Ein sehr aufregendes, spannendes, internationales Arbeitsumfeld im High-Tech-Bereich

Du kannst dich persönlich und beruflich weiterentwickeln

Wir sind offen und ehrlich im Umgang miteinander

Wir sind ein Team dass Dich stets unterstützt

Wir bieten fortschrittliche Anstellungsbedingungen, ein attraktives Vergütungspaket, mit guten Sozialleistungen

Über die Pensionskasse bieten wir Dir eine gut ausgebaute Altersvorsorge

Dein Profil ...

Du hast eine abgeschlossene Ausbildung als Elektrotechniker, Mechatroniker oder Automatiker (m/f), sowie Erfahrung im Anlagenbau mit Steuerungs-/Regeltechnik und vorzugsweise erste Robotik Kenntnisse

Du zeigst Interesse an einer Herausforderung, die einen breitem technischen Hintergrund sowie Einfallsreichtum und Flexibilität fordern

Der Kunde steht für Dich an erster Stelle und Du setzt alles daran im Team Projekte erfolgreich umzusetzen

Du fühlst Dich wohl in Deutsch und Englisch mit internationalen Kunden zu kommunizieren

Fühlst Du dich angesprochen? Dann sind wir neugierig darauf, Dich kennen zu lernen! Bewirb Dich sich bitte online über unsere Career-Seite [wwwadr]

Über uns

Oerlikon ist eine globale Innovationsschmiede für Oberflächentechnik, Polymerverarbeitung und additive Fertigung in Schlüsselindustrien wie Luft- und Raumfahrt, Automobil, Energie, Werkzeugbau und Textilien. Wir unterstützen unsere Kunden dabei, ihre Ziele zur Leistungsoptimierung, Funktion und Nachhaltigkeit ihrer Produkte und Herstellungsverfahren zu erreichen.
Unsere Lösungen reduzieren  Emissionen im Luft- und Straßenverkehr, maximieren die Langlebigkeit und Leistung von Werkzeugen, verbessern die Energieeffizienz und fördern intelligente Werkstoffe sowie nachhaltige Polymerverarbeitung. Diese Leistungen sind unser Markenzeichen.

Bei Oerlikon leben wir Vielfalt. Dies spiegelt sich in mehr als 11.800 Mitarbeitern aus über 93 Nationalitäten und unserer Präsenz in mehr als 38 Ländern und 207 Standorten weltweit wider.

Erfahren Sie mehr über Oerlikon:

Wohlen, CH, 5610"}

Perspektive im internationalen Umfeld!
Wir sind ein international führender Hersteller von hochwertigen Spezialprodukten der Medizintechnik. An unserem Hauptsitz in Tuttlingen sowie in mehreren Produktionsstätten, Vertriebs- und Servicegesellschaften beschäftigen wir weltweit in über 40 Ländern 8.500 Mitarbeiter.

Simulation von FPGA-basierten Modulen anhand von Systemanforderungen (in MATLAB)

Routine in der Bildverarbeitungsentwicklung oder einem verwandten Bereich

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2023-03-05098-1-000258625", "text": "IIoT Solution Architect

Our Opening and Your Responsibilities With increased integration of our solutions into IT and OT, system understanding, and architecture will gain further importance. Our Global Industrial Division is expanding the Global R&D team by building a new R&D competence center in Switzerland, facilitating an end-to-end development of our high-end terminals, paving the way to leverage Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT), with the terminal as a key-component in edge computing.  That is why we are looking for a motivated IIoT Solution Architect 80%-100% (f/m/d).This role is based in our global operational Headquarters in Nänikon-Greifensee.
In this role, you will be part of the new R&D team who will shape the future of METTTLER TOLEDO products in the journey towards device connectivity and IIoT solutions.
Your responsibilities would include:

Be a key member of the team who defines the future system architecture for the Industrial division. This involves software solutions across the entire technology stack, with IIoT and device connectivity as a major part of it.

Define the IIoT solution architecture design, which will shape and optimize the production environment of our customers.

Design solutions that comply to all demands in terms of cyber security, have strong customer orientation with an emphasis on scalability, modularity, flexibility, serviceability, and performance.

Bring experience in Device Identity Provisioning, Connectivity Configuration / Management, device claiming and device “fleet” monitoring area etc.

Define / consult IIoT capability roadmaps and embed these into the overruling divisional software roadmap.

Shape the underlying data-pipeline and define criteria, how customer data is used in our IIoT solutions.

Shape the selection process for client, server, storage, and cloud infrastructure solutions, and be part of strategic decision making (buy, build, partner).

Guide innovation projects with the target to develop outstanding IIoT services.

Work closely with your cooperation partners, who are product managers, software development team, IT security and cloud infrastructure team.

What You Need to Succeed Following requirements are necessary for this role:

Master/ Bachelor’s degree in engineering or science (Informatics, Computer Science or equivalent)

Several years of experience in IIoT solutions, supporting in similar industries and connected devices.

Strong technical knowledge and experience of IIoT device life cycle management capabilities

Know the relevant industrial communication protocols, such as OPC-UA, MQTT, WebSocket streams and Kafka.

Solid knowledge of integration patterns and best practices such as synchronous vs. asynchronous communications, RESTful APIs, messaging, publish-subscribe

Cloud system architecture, best practices, container-based architectures, Docker, Kybernetes as well as Azure and Alibaba cloud technologies.

Basic knowledge of data engineering, data science, advanced algorithmics and machine learning in industrial applications. Programming skills in relevant languages, such as Python, C, C# and C++.

Hands-on experience with containers and orchestration platforms

Ability to communicate across different functional teams with various cultural backgrounds

Experience in working in CI/CD, knowledge in DevOps and Agile Frameworks

Experience working in industrial environment

Fluent in English, German is a big advantage

You have the capability to learn fast in case you don’t fulfill all of the above requirements.

Learn more about our solutions:  METTLER TOLEDO Get Ready for Industry 4.0 - METTLER TOLEDO Industrial - en - YouTube Our Offer to You We are offering:

Where applicable flexible working hours, a hybrid work model and a wide portfolio of training opportunities

40h week with at least 25 vacation days per year plus 4 to 7 additional days off (i.e. in between bank holidays)

Free parking spaces and direct access to public transport from our facilities

Healthy menus cooked onsite and special prices for employees at our own METTLER TOLEDO restaurant

A range of additional attractive benefits like discounts for sport clubs and others

You can expect challenging, interesting, and varied tasks in an innovative and international environment, with the opportunity to network globally and realize your next career goal.
Have we raised your interest? Then we look forward to receiving your online application. If you have any question, please do not hesitate to contact us. Our e-mail address is
[email]
.
We consider only direct applications. About Mettler Toledo METTLER TOLEDO is a leading global supplier of precision instruments and services. We are recognized as an innovation leader and our solutions are critical in key R&D, quality control, and manufacturing processes for customers in a wide range of industries including life sciences, food, and chemicals. We operate throughout the world with a culture shaped by innovation and international flair. Equal Opportunity Employment We promote equal opportunity worldwide and value diversity in our teams in terms of business background, area of expertise, gender and ethnicity. For more information on our commitment to Sustainability, Diversity and Equal Opportunity please visit us
here
.
For those who prioritize precision, Mettler Toledo is precisely where you belong.

Referenznummer
13100

Zürich Nänikon-Greifensee
Pensum
Vollzeit

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2023-03-05219-1-000247583", "text": "Supply Chain Compliance Manager (f/m/d)

Job Purpose
Compliance of external suppliers (component suppliers, contract manufacturers, service providers, 3rd party product suppliers) and goods/services purchased with Straumann procedures and applicable regulations.

Execution of the supplier audit program

Perform audits according to the supplier audit program.

Manage supplier audit records in order to ensure correct documentation, effective closure, including re-audits and observations handling

Inform the corporate level on audit results allowing the corporate hierarchy to take preventive action.

Monitor and follow-up Corrective Action and Preventive Action (CAPA) derived from corporate supplier audits.

Supplier compliance and Vendor Management

Define the qualification requirements for external suppliers and support during the qualification process.

Process changes and requests for new suppliers. Reevaluation of existing suppliers.

Maintain the Approved Supplier List (ASL): Maintenance of quality related data in Vendor Management module in SAP.

Supplier performance monitoring including trending, data mining and reporting.

Quality assurance

Create, update, maintain and train the incoming product inspection planning and release the quality data packages for Headquarter

Formal batch/product release based on quality certificates and/or record review for goods delivered from external suppliers (excluding Straumann manufacturing sites) to HQ.

CAPA processing

Investigate, Review and Approve in the Exception Management Process

Assess non-conforming products and decide on their disposition

Main Tasks and Responsibilities

Ensure that an appropriate quality assurance system is established throughout the supply chain in order to support the marketing activities.

Set up and maintain quality assurance agreements (QAA) with the suppliers

Ensure application of quality assurance agreements and verify their application.

Identify quality issues and escalate them in an appropriate manner (analytical skills)

Support Straumann and its subsidiaries and distributors with regards to compliance with distributor obligations.

Ensure that required regulatory documentation for 3rd party products is available for the distribution chain.

Maintain and improve processes

Support other Departments in regard of interpretation of quality assurance requirements

Communicate new quality assurance requirements and support in implementing these.

Identify possible improvements in the supplier compliance and QA processes, define and lead the implementation.

Share best practice realization among the Straumann organization to ensure a more functional business development opportunity.

Auditing (if qualified): Lead Auditor for Quality System Audits (Supplier, Corporate, Internal).

Profile:
Education:

University degree or equivalent in an applicable field (quality, engineering or other relevant scientific discipline). Advanced graduate studies/degrees are an asset.

Formal qualification / training / certification on medical devices regulations such as ISO13485, Regulation (EU) 745/2017 (MDR), US FDA 21CFR Part 820 and other MDSAP regulations.

Experience:

3+ years of previous experience within the medical devices/pharmaceutical industry or 5+ years of experience within quality management, preferably at manufacturing site.

Proven experience of Supplier Management and Purchasing Controls regulatory requirements.

Proven experience with medical devices, including product design, manufacturing, life cycle management.

Expert understanding of global medical device regulations and quality requirements as well as industry practice.

Experience in audit process as auditor or lead auditor. Strong analytical and investigational skills.

Proven project experience, preferably for process improvement projects (Lean, Six Sigma), are an asset.

Personal Attributes
:

Excellent communication skills, as demonstrated in a multi-cultural and multi-lingual environment. Distinct customer orientation both internally and externally. Team player with open, positive attitude and respect for others

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or disability.

Employment Type: Full Time

Alternative Locations: Switzerland : Basel

Travel Percentage: 0 - 10%

Requisition ID: 8843"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2023-03-05236-1-000254145", "text": "Internship Software Engineering (w/m) 80-100%

Internship Software Engineering (w/m)

Operations Research

Internship Software Engineering (w/m)

Operations Research
You will contribute to the software development of optimisation applications in the energy environment and independently implement performance improvements, new functionalities and prototypes. We offer you the opportunity to apply your knowledge of mathematical optimisation and your programming skills in an innovative environment and to implement your ideas profitably in a 3-6 month internship. We are looking for a new team member in this interesting field with a passion for mathematical optimisation (operations research) and software development in Python.
Adrian Hauswirth
, Senior Data & Optimisation Scientist, has found the following position for you:
You are passionate about this field
You will support the Endaprime team in the further development of the HIVE application for the planning of cellular energy systems. You will be responsible for improving the code quality and the computing times of the central optimisation application (linear optimisation). For this purpose, you will perform refactorings, evaluate alternative optimisation solvers (GUROBI, CPLEX, etc.) and optimise parameters. Thanks to your previous experience and know-how, you can offer your help in developing new features for the optimisation application. You also enjoy helping to develop innovative prototypes and proof-of-concepts in the area of optimisation and machine learning for energy systems.
We're impressed by your expertise

You have completed your Bachelor's or Master's degree in natural sciences or engineering and attended lectures on mathematical optimisation.

You have programming experience in Python (incl. object-oriented programming) with a focus on numerical computations (numpy, pandas, pyomo), ideally in a collaborative environment (incl. code versioning, issue tracking, etc.).

You have already applied your knowledge of mathematical optimisation and machine learning in projects or internships.

With your careful and structured way of working you write clear and efficient program code of high quality and you understand how to explain technical issues in a simple way.

Thanks to your willingness to learn and apply yourself, as well as your enjoyment of new topics, you take responsibility for your tasks.

We are not interested in enquiries from recruitment agencies.

What you can look forward to
As a responsible employer, we offer:

Fair and market-oriented remuneration

Flexible working models

Personalised training and development opportunities

Comprehensive health management system

A progressive infrastructure

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2023-03-05850-1-000270024", "text": "Technical Solutions Architect - Cloud Infrastructure & Software Group

We change the World and you'll love it. Our employees' groundbreaking ideas make huge impact on everyone's life and our digital world. We address challenges and take ideas from the drawing board to real-world solutions. Become part of an outstanding team that cares about customers, lives technology and enjoys having fun while learning every day. We are waiting for you to join us and to become passionate about your employer and the brand we represent.

What You'll Do

As a Technical Solutions Architect, you play a key role in the success of Cisco field sales teams in selling our technology products and solutions tailored to customers. You will work together with other Cloud Infrastructure & Software Group (CISG) specialists to position our software, unified computing & cloud networking solutions. You will drive presales engineering and will collaborate with other teams across organizational boundaries and geographies to overcome technical and commercial challenges to win against opposing offerings.

You'll Work With

In a strong team, covering Switzerland you are free to put innovation to practice and seek tremendous opportunities for growth. You will succeed because we have your back, and because we do listen to our customers and help them anticipate market shifts and technology transitions.

Our customers span from government to private enterprises. They are diverse, but all need technology to adapt fast and grow purposefully. The Specialist Team provides you with outstanding opportunities to succeed at Cisco. You will love the team and a spirit that supports and empowers you.

Who You Are

You are curious and inspired. You are enthusiastic about technology, and love the hard work, getting things up and running. But you also love having fun with colleagues and customers. You enjoy to learn and grow along with your work.

Your background is around Software Development, Cloud, Compute & Network Architectures. If you have experience with Cisco products, even better. Software solutions and distributed systems, monitoring and observability tools, data center networking, converged and hyper-converged infrastructure, storage systems, backup solutions. Experience with cloud Technologies, virtualization and observability are of high interest.

Our minimum requirements for this role include:

Self Starter + Team Spirit + Desire to Learn

Stamina to overcome challenges

The ability and comfort level to present easily to customer architects, engineers, managers, and executives to effective position the value of the Cisco solutions and how it solves the customer problems or achieves their goals

Basic knowledge of Cisco Data Center product portfolio is a must

Hands-on experience with large-scale distributed systems, infrastructure (networks and servers) and software solutions are a must

Knowledge and understanding of cloud computing and cloud architectures - IaaS, SaaS, PaaS, Private and Public Clouds

Familiarity with the Cisco Full-Stack Observability tools (AppDynamics, ThousandEyes and Intersight) are a big plus

Network routing and switching with extensive knowledge of L2 and L3 protocols

Programming or scripting skills are seen as a plus

CCNA, CCNP, CCIE or Cloud Certifications are a plus

Fluency in German, French and English is a strong plus.

We Are Cisco

#WeAreCisco. Each person counts, we bring our talents to work and make a difference. We learn, we have fun and here is how we do it:

We live digital, and we help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we're 30 years "old" and only about hardware. But we're also a software company, and a security company, we implement and use Machine Learning. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do - you can't put us in a box!

We take difference to heart, because without diversity and a commitment to equality and free thoughts for all, there is no moving forward. So, you have colorful hair, tattoos? Don't care. Like polka dots? That's cool.

Cisco is an Equal Opportunity Employer and you will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, or any other legally protected basis.

#li-emeaam1#li-priority"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2023-03-05855-1-000250078", "text": "Unkrautmanagement im (mehrjährigen) Kräuteranbau 100 %

Unkrautmanagement im (mehrjährigen) Kräuteranbau (100 %)
Art des Angebots: Bachelorarbeit
Problemstellung

Die Wahl effizienter Unkrautbekämpfungsmethoden ist für die Wirtschaftlichkeit der Kräuterkulturen entscheidend. Je nach Kultur, Lage, Anbausystem und Anbaujahr,  unterscheiden sich die Massnahmen gegen Unkräuter sehr. Eine Übersicht über bestehende Methoden, neu entwickelte oder kombinierte Methoden zu behalten, ist für die wenigsten Produzent*innen realistisch. Deshalb werden in der Schweiz ganz unterschiedliche, zum Teil sogar von den Produzent*innen selbst entwickelten Lösungen für die Unkrautbekämpfung angewendet.
Dabei verfolgen die Produzent*innen folgende Ziele:

Der Erhalt von sauberem Erntegut (mit wenig Unkraut),

Zeit beim Jäten (von Hand, sowie mechanisch) zu

sparen

und gute Erträge erhalten.

Mithilfe der studentischen Arbeit, sollen abhängig von der Lage und Kultur, Empfehlungen formuliert werden. Damit soll den Landwirt*innen z.B. die Entscheidung einer grösseren Investition vereinfacht werden, um die die Unterhaltskosten über das Jahr zu minimieren.
Die Massnahmen, welche 2022 in den Versuchen untersucht werden, wurden von den Landwirten evaluiert und mitausgesucht. Sie umfassen traditionelle mechanische
Methoden, die auch im Gemüsebau anzutreffen sind; fortgeschrittene, mechanische Methoden, wie der Einsatz von Feuer, Wasser oder Elektrizität; Robotik und agronomische Methoden, wie Mischkulturen, Bodenabdeckungen oder Fruchtfolgen

Vorgehen/Methode

Planung und Durchführung von Feldversuchen in Zusammenarbeit mit Produzent*innen, zur Erhebung wesentlicher Faktoren für die Formulierung von Empfehlungen.
Die Methoden werden von den Produzent*innen und nicht von Studierenden durchgeführt (ausser der Wunsch und die Fähigkeit dazu besteht).

Kontaktperson

Sheila Hofer

Bearbeitungszeitraum

Die Hauptsaison für den Kräuteranbau ist von April bis Oktober. Im Optimalfall könnte die Arbeit über ein Jahr Teilzeit durchgeführt werden. Jedoch kann diese auch für das FS22 vorgesehen werden.

Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung!
Jetzt bewerben"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2023-03-05878-1-000262151", "text": "Beratung Abacus SVM/ABEA 80-100 %

Abacus@Abraxas, welche tolle Kombination! Wir bieten dir eine einmalige Gelegenheit bei einem aufstrebenden Vertriebspartner.

Das bewirkst du

Sicherstellung der Fachberatung

Begleitung und Unterstützung unserer (Neu-)Kunden bei Abacus-Einführungen, Upgrades, Konfigurationen und weiteren Vorhaben

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2023-03-05879-1-000260786", "text": "Service Line Specialist

What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an ambitious spirit who want to make a difference in this world.
Cognizant's delivery model infused with a distinct culture of high customer happiness. We consistently deliver positive relationships, cost reductions, and business results.
Be one of our change-makers and join the success story: we are looking for a

Service Line Specialist
Location: Zürich / Switzerland

The Opportunity
Data and artificial intelligence are changing the world by uncovering insights that were hidden in plain sight. Hence this role is highly pivotal for us as this role will be enabling our clients to take advantage of our expertise and Intellectual Property in data and AI to revolutionize their business. As a seasoned sales leader in data and AI, you will join a larger digital business and technology sales team in Germany / Switzerland focussed on growing the data and AI business and thereby growing our reputation as a leader in data and AI with our customers.

Your Key Result Areas:

	•  Ability to articulate Cognizant’s value propositions in data and artificial intelligence to showcase the business outcomes that can be achieved by applying data and Al offerings

	•  Proactively generate leads from prospective customers across an industry or a set of industries of your choice

	•  Build and nurture relationships with key technology partners to support the clients jointly

	•  As a sparring partner you will build the bridge between our technical experts and the customers to make sure both parties get the best outcomes possible

	•  Guide and steer the data and Al experts from Cognizant to identify, shape, and win large opportunities with customers in DACH

	•  Work closely with wider digital and vertical sales teams to achieve desired targets

Your Qualification:

	•  University degree

	•  Be passionate about data and Al and how it will reimagine businesses

	•  Wide variety of experience ranging from business development to solutioning of problems with data

	•  Understanding of data analytics technology stack (e.g. Data lakes, data streaming, ETL, Data Governance & Management, Data Science)

	•  You have strong exposure to data and artificial intelligence ecosystems, and you know how to modernize the data landscape from legacy data platforms

	•  Knowledge of Cloud-native data and Al solutions and services from hyperscalers

	•  Experience in selling solutions with market-leading Business Intelligence and Analytics as well as data warehousing technologies

	•  Excellent track record in consulting-led sales for data and Al offerings

What you can expect

	•  An organization driven by technology – We have a tremendous technology backbone

	•  Open, ‘can do’ team spirit

	•  An environment where you can make your own ideas a reality

	•  Drive your own career

	•  Market conform benefits

Are you interested in this position?

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2023-03-05879-1-000260799", "text": "Capital Markets Enterprise Architect - Sell-side

Capital Markets Enterprise Architect – Sell-side

Location: Switzerland, Zurich preferred

Type: Permanent

Cognizant is enabling customer’s Digital transformation journey using our proven “Digital at Scale” framework. Our “Digital at Scale” framework is based upon customer centric innovation and core modernization by using technology as transformation lever and being agile to bring time to market. Technology transformation involves moving from legacy landscape to new platform foundation and it helps deliver enhanced customer experience, scalability, maintainability, and security with reduced TCO (including CAPEX & OPEX).

BFS Transformation and Architecture Office (BFS TAO)

BFS TAO is the group responsible for driving emerging technologies across leading financial services clients of Cognizant, nurturing and delivering a holistic competency, focusing on technology and business transformation initiatives of our clients working with senior client stakeholders, Cognizant internal service lines and industry partners.  This is a niche group of Enterprise and Solution Architects across the globe actively providing solutions on Architecture, Design and Technology Road map for leading financial services providers.

Why is this a good opportunity?

As a Technology Leader, you will get a chance to drive technology thought leadership, architecture, and solution engineering capabilities in the Capital Markets, specifically focusing on the Broker /Dealers, Execution venues, settlement and clearing domain areas.

The Role

This job opportunity will fulfil the role of Capital Markets Enterprise Architect – Sell-side. This is an anchor role to drive business growth – working closely with commercial and delivery leadership in the region, bringing domain aligned technology thought leadership in creating the mindshare, identifying, and qualifying opportunities and positioning with clients and prospects.

You are also expected to build the team of capital markets domain aligned solution architects to fulfil demand and deepen client engagements.

Key Responsibilities

Domain aligned technology thought leadership – emerging technology trends and adoption, impact on the business and future directions, approaches for addressing key industry pain points such as technology modernization, engineering, and automation focus

Engagement in key client / prospect conversions bringing Cognizant point of view, understanding, and translating client business and technology context to solution ideas and value propositions

Drive innovation in ideating, qualifying, and elaborating industry aligned repeatable solutions ideas, value proposition, and frameworks / reference models

Support commercial teams in RFX, proactive proposals and business development activities in this domain

Anchor end to end solution for large complex pursuits, involving customer, internal and partner stakeholders. Steer win themes, solution considerations and supporting financial construct for complex deals through effective solution design and clearly articulated architecture guiding principles

Build a reputation as a trusted partner who understands the business and collaborates to deliver on commitments and drive business result, supporting customers in their technology roadmap, Digital Journey and share industry views

Build a team of domain aligned solution architects

Qualifications & Experience

15+ years of experience in capital markets sell-side industry across broker-dealer / execution venues / clearing and settlement firms as domain enterprise architect, technology leader, consultant, or equivalent role focusing on architecting solutions of strategic importance to respective organizations

Track record as technology consultant, enterprise architect aligned to broker-dealer / clearing / execution venues / market infrastructure functions in reputed financial services firms, technology consulting firms

Established credential as thought leader in the investment banking space – broker-dealers /market infrastructure / custodial firms; having architected, designed, and led transformation for leading market players

Domain aligned technology leadership in driving business outcomes with technology leverage – across modernization, new business, operations, and technology operating models

Established credentials in providing thought leadership such as thought leadership papers, developed solution ideas, addressing industry pain points, participation in industry forums, etc.

Understanding of data architecture and analytics, data democratization, leveraging the power of data in context of sell side, securities services, and market infrastructure – thinking in terms of data products, opportunities to monetize data, as well integrate third-party data products

Knowledge, understanding of business and technology trends across AI / ML, Cloud, Intelligent Process Automation, Engineering practice in the Capital Markets, with specific focus on the broker / dealers, execution venues, clearing and settlement area, and articulation of business impacts – threats, opportunities and emerging technology enabled business models

Ability to communicate at all levels of the organization, with public speaking expertise presenting at meetups and conference

Solid understanding of different software development lifecycle models and expert knowledge in agile and traditional principles, with the ability to blend processes to find the right fit for technology and business.

Understanding of the breadth of end-to-end technology stack and depth with at least one platform, especially contemporary cloud-oriented platforms being used in enterprise business software space (GCP, Azure or AWS).

A strong foundation in systems thinking, design thinking, complexity management and domain driven design paradigms

Ability to get the hands-dirty/roll-up the sleeves to “lead by example” on the ground.

Are you interested to be part of this project? Then please share your CV in English.

For questions please contact [email]

Who we are?

Cognizant (CTSH) is one of the world’s leading professional services companies, transforming clients’ business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our industry-based, consultative approach helps many of the best-known organizations in every industry and geography envision, build and run more innovative, efficient businesses.

We engineer modern businesses to improve everyday life.

Travel : No

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2023-03-05880-1-000246734", "text": "Senior Architect mit einem, Flair für Data & AI

Data & AIWie du deine Zeit verbringst
Als Lead Architect mit einem Gespür für Daten & KI bist Du der zentrale Akteur bei der Konzeption, Entscheidungsfindung & Implementierung von datengetriebenen Plattformen & Lösungen. Du agierst in mehreren Rollen, setzt dich aber immer dort ein, wo dein Potenzial voll zum Tragen kommt:
Du bist Architekt - Du bist dafür verantwortlich, Anforderungen in komplexen Umgebungen in Lösungen umzusetzen und trägst so zum Erfolg und zur Zufriedenheit unserer Kunden bei. Du legst den Grundstein für State-of-the-Art-Lösungen von anspruchsvollen datengetriebenen Lösungen und Machine-Learning-Projekten, sei es in der Cloud oder on-premise. Anschließend stellst Du diese den relevanten Stakeholdern vor, um sie zu inspirieren und für ein Buy-In zu gewinnen.
Du bist ein Thought Leader - Du nimmst die Herausforderung an, ein Thought Leader im Bereich der Datenplattformen zu werden und das Thema intern und extern strategisch voranzutreiben. Du gibst dein Wissen an Kollegen weiter, schulst Kunden und hilfst bei der Entwicklung junger Talente.
Du bist Entrepreneur - Du bist ein wichtiger Experte für Data-Engineering-Projekte und damit aktiv an der Entwicklung von Zühlke Services beteiligt, positionierst unser Angebot am Markt (Pre-Sales) und erstellst Angebote. Zudem bist Du mit Markttrends vertraut und hast die aktuellen Entwicklungen stets im Blick.
Was uns wichtig ist

Du bist in der Lage, optimale Kundenlösungen in der Cloud oder vor Ort zu konzipieren und zu implementieren, und hast nachweislich Erfahrung im Management und in der Arbeit an technischen Projekten

Du hast eine Leidenschaft für nachhaltige, zuverlässige Softwarearchitekturen im Bereich Data Engineering. Idealerweise hast Du bereits mehrere Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Data Engineering im Aufbau von zuverlässigen und sicheren Datenplattform-Architekturen und bist mit der ML-Operationalisierung vertraut.

Durch Dein sicheres Auftreten in der Kommunikation mit Kunden und deinem starken Antrieb und deiner Leidenschaft strebst Du danach, Verantwortung in Projekten und in der Weiterentwicklung unserer Data- und Machine-Learning-Kompetenz zu übernehmen. Exzellente Kommunikationsfähigkeiten mindestens in Englisch sind Voraussetzung

Deine Architekturentscheidungen werden maßgeblich von nicht-funktionalen Anforderungen wie Verfügbarkeit, Flexibilität, Stabilität, Wartbarkeit und Sicherheit in Verbindung mit wirtschaftlichen Überlegungen beeinflusst. Du weisst, welche konkreten Auswirkungen Ihre Architekturentscheidungen auf die Code-Ebene haben

Du verfügst über einen technischen Hochschulabschluss (ETH, Uni) in Informatik, Mathematik oder in einem vergleichbaren Bereich.

Du willst der Technologie-Polyglott im Bereich Big Data sein - sei es Apache Airflow, Apache Beam, Kubernetes, Docker, oder relationale, spaltenbasierte oder NoSQL-Datenbanken, Stream- oder Batch-Verarbeitung, Python, SQL oder Scala, Cloud oder on-prem, AWS oder Azure.

Was das Arbeiten bei Zühlke ausmacht

Einzigartige Kultur - wir kommunizieren offen miteinander, schätzen uns selbst ehrlich ein und arbeiten gerne im Team.

Weiterentwicklung - wir investieren 10% unseres Umsatzes in die Entwicklung unserer Mitarbeitenden. Wir helfen dir, durch kontinuierliche und qualitativ hochwertige Weiterbildung zu wachsen.

Wissensaustausch - wir verfolgen einen interdisziplinären Ansatz, eine Kultur des Wissensaustauschs und des voneinander Lernens.

Internationale Topic Groups - wir tauschen Erfahrungen und Wissen miteinander aus und unterstützen uns gegenseitig bei der Weiterentwicklung innerhalb unserer internen Communities (z.B. Data Platforms, AI & Data Science).

Toller Arbeitsplatz - wir bieten eine Kultur des Vertrauens, ermutigen unsere Mitarbeitenden, über den Tellerrand zu schauen und ihre Ideen zu teilen.

Nachhaltigkeit - eine Herzensangelegenheit für uns. Wir zielen darauf ab, unsere Projekte und Services möglichst nachhaltig zu erbringen und auch unsere Kund:innen nachhaltiger zu machen.

Permanent 80-100% Zürich ,  Bern Jetzt bewerben"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2023-03-05882-1-000268483", "text": "PAS Senior Consultant / Manager- Learning Transformation (in Geneva, Basel or Zurich)

PAS Senior Consultant / Manager- Learning Transformation (in Geneva, Basel or Zurich)
Location:	Grand-Lancy / Geneva Other locations:  Anywhere in Country Salary:CompetitiveDate:  06-Feb-2023
Job description
Requisition ID:  1404589
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

Our People Advisory Services business (PAS) is focused on people management and our vision is to help our clients get it right in all its facets. PAS has three key pillars: Transformation (Workforce Advisory), mobile talent and workforce enablement (Integrated Mobility) and transactions (Reward). In Workforce Advisory, where this position is located in, we help organizations put talent and purpose at the heart of their transformation agenda.

To further strengthen our People Advisory Services – Performance team we are looking for a Senior Consultant / Manager  to join either our Geneva, Basel or Zurich offices.

The opportunity

As a member of our Learning & Change Team, you will be working with high profile clients and leaders to identify additional solutions to increase transformation projects and strategically partner with various customers to identify learning needs and possible solutions for organization, departments and individuals.

Your key responsibilities

Act in a high-profile client facing capacity, working with clients to deliver and shape the implementation of their learning strategy and transformation projects (this role does not cover any internal learning projects within EY).

Assist with go to market activities and the development of our propositions with clients to achieve personal and team new business targets.

Analyze, design and deliver creative and innovative learning & change solutions tailored to client needs to help with their strategy or transformation projects.

Influence clients as a result of your deep learning & change knowledge regarding latest market trends whilst taking into account the complexities of Learning within large organizations.

Lead multi-disciplinary teams to deliver high quality services in line with our proven global methodologies and tools

Conduct and manage teams responsible for learning or change needs analysis initiatives and present recommendations when required.

Provide strategic recommendations on the use of learning technologies / digital tools to enhance innovative, effective learning experiences to our customers.

Promote the professional and personal development of your team members and take the lead in knowledge sharing and training delivery activities.

Develop long-term client relationships by introducing and presenting PAS offerings as well as by keeping up to date with current developments and trends in learning and industry knowledge

Skills and attributes for success

To qualify for this role, you must have

Bachelor or Master degree in relevant topic areas

8+ years of relevant Consulting (or Sales experience) in our focus areas of Learning and Development, Leadership and Organizational Design.  Industry experience will be considered as beneficial.

Experience of managing a sales pipeline, budgets and understanding of engagement economics

You demonstrate experience in supporting Learning projects (project management & facilitation skills)

Proven ability to conduct and/or analyze research related to consumers, teams and individual performer

Excellent command of English – French and / or German seen as a benefit

Ideally, you’ll also have

Strong and effective strategic thinking and problem-solving skills with high degree of emotional intelligence and the ability to identify and solve tactical issues involving training across varied regions/divisions

The ability to excel in dynamic and unconstrained environments framing complex and ambiguous issues

What we look for

People with energy, passion, a strategic mind, a will-do attitude, an eye for detail and a motivation for delivering the best

People with intellectual curiosity, adaptability, and a desire to be of service to the team and the broader community

People who build long-term relationships and overseeing the continued development, performance and profitability of key accounts

This role will help develop and execute on the future of human performance.  We highly encourage candidates from diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives.

What we offer

International multi-cultural team of highly motivated professionals

Continuous personal development with a steep learning curve – a system of trainings, mentoring, counselling and on-the-job learning

Modern working environment and equipment, fostering mobile working flexibility

Transparent performance-based recognition and progression system

Acquire a fully accredited corporate MBA (EY Tech MBA) from Hult International Business School, whilst working with EY, completely free*

If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

For further information please contact our recruitment team ([email] / +41 58 286 33 66).

* exception of EY contractors, interns and alumni.

EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today."}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2023-03-05888-1-000261994", "text": "Head of Data Excellence

Syngenta is a leading AgTech company, dedicated to bringing plant potential to life. Each of our 30,000 employees in more than 100 countries work together to solve one of humanity’s most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture.

Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. No matter what your position, you will have a vital role in safely feeding the world and taking care of our planet. Join us now and help shape the future of agriculture.

Syngenta Crop Protection is headquartered in Switzerland.

This role can be based either in Basel, Switzerland or Jealott's Hill, UK.

In Crop Protection R&D, we design and evolve cutting-edge data capabilities to allow us to access, connect, share and harness our R&D data at an unprecedented scale and pace. We cover a wide spectrum of data from Research (chemistry and biology research data) to open field IoT (environmental sensors, drones), NLP and image analysis. We firmly believe in FAIR, shared and connected data products, empowered and data-savvy people, agile delivery and open source.

We are looking for a progressive leader with deep expertise in R&D data management processes, coupled with outstanding interpersonal and business skills to play a key role in CP R&D-wide foundational capabilities and transformation efforts, such as data quality, master and reference data management, ontologies, data catalogues and data platforms for analytics and innovation.

Key accountabilities and expectations

Drive the effective creation, management and exploitation of trusted and reliable FAIR data assets within and across R&D functions to drive project and business decisions and enable more effective analytics and data science

Set the CP R&D strategy on the priority, application and platforms for proactive and impactful data management, including data quality

Define and govern a set of CP R&D-wide standards on data, metadata and access/security within Syngenta R&D and CROs

Establish and chair data excellence activities to ensure business data ownership, stewardship and sponsorship, prioritize work and resolve data issues

Lead CR R&D-wide data transformation initiatives, such as the creation and management of data access, data glossary, data catalogue, and data harmonisation/interoperability in our R&D data platform

Lead change management campaigns on FAIR, data culture and data literacy

Act as the business product owner for cross-functional data capabilities such as the management of master data, data quality, ontologies and data access platforms.

MSc/PhD in STEM or data-related sciences and engineering

More than 10 years of experience leading data management initiatives in complex organizations and related industries (chemical, pharma, science-driven R&D) with deep technical understanding of R&D concepts and how scientific data is produced, managed and used

Advanced knowledge of data governance practices, business and technology issues related to management of enterprise information assets and approaches related to data quality, privacy and architecture

Superb consulting skills, coupled with change management concepts and strategies, including communication, culture change and performance measurement design

Proven knowledge and experience of data management tools and technology solutions, such as data catalogues, data modelling and ontology management platforms

Knowledge of agile and product management principles and methodologies is desired

Essential personal capabilities

Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills and proven ability to explain complex data management concepts as simple comprehensible messages for senior leaders

Ability to challenge, shape and influence the way things are done

Ability to self-direct and take on broad, R&D-wide projects from beginning to end

Ability to build networks across regions, cultures, and countries

Highly organized and structured in planning and execution of responsibilities

Proven people management skills, mentoring and coaching.

Please send your complete application with CV and motivation letter.

We offer a variety of financial and non-financial benefits including:

A position which contributes to valuable and impactful work in a stimulating and international environment

	A superb working environment with an open culture and diverse workforce where new ideas are always welcome

The opportunity to work with and learn from highly qualified and experienced employees and gain scientific and technical excellence

Learning culture (Together we Grow) and wide range of training options

Competitive pension fund plan, attractive bonus system, onsite doctor, fitness room, canteen, and other benefits (Family friendly initiatives, Child and Family allowance...)

	World-class headquarters in Basel, R&D Science Campus in Jealott’s Hill and the Global Research Center in Stein

Did you know? Syngenta has been ranked as a top employer by Science Journal.

Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status."}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2023-03-05892-1-000251825", "text": "Student Researcher, 2023

Participate in research to develop solutions for real-world, large-scale problems.

Minimum qualifications:

Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Math, or related technical field.

Experience in one area of computer science (e.g., Natural Language Understanding, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Algorithmic Foundations of Optimization, Quantum Information Science, Data Science, Software Engineering, etc.).

Preferred qualifications:

Currently enrolled in a full-time degree program and returning to the program after completion of the internship.

Experience as a researcher, including internships, full-time, or at a lab.

Experience contributing to research communities or efforts, including publishing papers in major conferences or journals.

Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages (e.g., C/C++, Java, MATLAB, Go, Python, etc.).

Ability to speak and write in English fluently.

The Student Researcher Program’s primary objective is to foster academic collaborations with students through research at Google. Join us for a paid Student Researcher position that offers the opportunity to work directly with Google research scientists and engineers on research projects.

The Student Researcher Program offers more opportunities for research students to work on critical research projects at Google in a less structured way. The program allows for flexibility beyond the limitations of our traditional internship program on aspects such as duration, time commitment, and working location (with options for on-site or remote).

The topics student researchers work on tend to be open-ended and exploratory, and don't always have a clear deliverable like a traditional internship would.

Google Research is building the next generation of intelligent systems for all Google products. To achieve this, we’re working on projects that utilize the latest computer science techniques developed by skilled software engineers and research scientists. Google Research teams collaborate closely with other teams across Google, maintaining the flexibility and versatility required to adapt new projects and foci that meet the demands of the world's fast-paced business needs."}
