{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2024-03-05710-1-000349856", "text": "Revolutionize enterprise search with Generative AI - Internship 6 months COO_IT

Karriere und Ausbildung Vacancies
Offene Stelle :
Revolutionize enterprise search with Generative AI - Internship 6 months

Zweigstelle :
Geneva

Eintrittsdatum :
01.03.2024

Arbeitszeit :

Domain :
COO_IT

Share

email

print

Revolutionize enterprise search with Generative AI - Internship 6 months

Description

The Bank’s entire operations are managed by COO Division and are headed up by the Chief Operating Officer. It strives to provide both in-house and external clients with a first-rate service to ensure our business operates efficiently and at the best possible cost. The COO division comprises Operations, Finance, Information Management, Human Resources and Logistics. COO employees are committed to providing, with professionalism and enthusiasm, an efficient, proactive, high-quality service that meets the needs of clients within the context of the Bank’s overall strategy.

Mission

The goal of this internship is to investigate how we can build and interrogate a knowledge base in natural language like you would do it with Chat-GPT but without exposing client identifying data outside the bank.

Challenges

Finding the right information at the right time is a challenge that can elevate the enterprise's capabilities, making it more efficient and setting it apart from competitors.

Main responsibilities

Research within the enterprise plays a fundamental role in improving the work of employees. However, in the age of numerous information sources, this task has become complex. A recent study revealed that 44% of users made wrong decisions because they were unaware of information that could have helped, and 43% of users reported failing to notice important information.

Deploy a search engine, as a Proof of concept, based on one of the solutions studied.

Demonstrate how generative artificial intelligence, based on LLMs, can revolutionize the way we design search engines.

Demonstrate how Intelligent enterprise search prevents information islands and enables organizations to easily find, surface, and share information and their corporate knowledge of their best employees

Measure the improvements brought about by our new research approach and propose an architecture and solution for implementation.

Estimate the implementation budget and total cost of ownership (TCO) of the recommended solution.

Education

Education: Master Degree

Technical skills: Specialization in AI, or at least demonstrates a strong interest in AI

IT Tools: Development (Nodejs, Python, java, .NET/C#, ...). Knowledge of modern development environment (DevOps)

Experience

Years of experience: N/A

Experience in private banking: N/A

Language

English: Fluent

Personal skills

Swiss resident: Optional

Excellent communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a team, collaborating with developers, and stakeholders. Creativity and passion for exploring new ideas, pushing the boundaries of generative AI technology.

Zurück zur ListeOnline-Bewerbung

Portal für Online-Bewerbungen – Richtlinien für den Umgang mit personenbezogenen Informationen potenzieller Kandidaten/innen

Das System für Online-Bewerbungen (nachfolgend das «Online-Bewerbungsportal» oder «Portal») der Union Bancaire Privée, UBP SA, (nachfolgend «die UBP») wird von unserem Hauptsitz in Genf aus gemäss schweizerischem Recht, namentlich den Datenschutz betreffend, sowie auf der Grundlage nachfolgender Grundsätze betrieben. Es ermöglicht allen Personen (nachfolgend «die Kandidaten/innen»), Bewerbungen zu den im Online-Bewerbungsportal ausgeschriebenen offenen Stellen sowie Spontanbewerbungen einzureichen. Davon ausgenommen sind Personalvermittlungsunternehmen und Headhunters.

Die UBP garantiert, dass sie über das Online-Bewerbungsportal übermittelte Personendaten wie Vor- und Nachnamen, Anschrift und andere im Zusammenhang mit der Identität oder dem beruflichen Werdegang der Kandidaten/innen stehende Informationen (nachfolgend die «Personendaten») vertraulich behandeln wird. Die Bank wird diese auf einem internen gesicherten Server speichern, zu dem nur die zur Bearbeitung der betreffenden Bewerbung ermächtigten Personen Zugriff haben. Mit der Übermittlung der Personendaten über das Online-Bewerbungsportal akzeptieren die Kandidaten/innen die Risiken der Datenübertragung via Internet, die keinen absoluten Datenschutz garantiert.

Durch die Übermittlung ihrer Personendaten erlauben die Kandidaten/innen, dass diese von der UBP und/oder jeder Zweigstelle der UBP Gruppe (nachfolgend «die UBP Gruppe»), insbesondere von den jeweiligen Human-Resources-Abteilungen im Rahmen der Rekrutierung neuer Mitarbeiter zur Prüfung und Nachverfolgung der Bewerbungen verwendet werden. Liegt für eine offene Stelle der Arbeitsort ausserhalb der Schweiz oder könnte ein Kandidaten/innenprofil eine Zweigstelle der UBP Gruppe im Ausland interessieren, erklären sich die Kandidaten/innen im Voraus damit einverstanden, dass ihre Personendaten der betreffenden Zweigstelle zugestellt werden. Des Weiteren akzeptieren sie, dass das für besagte Zweigstelle im Ausland geltende Recht nicht unbedingt einen dem schweizerischen Recht entsprechenden Daten- oder Arbeitnehmerschutz gewährleistet.

Die UBP verpflichtet sich, ohne Zustimmung der Kandidaten/innen keine vorgenannten Personendaten an Dritte ausserhalb der UBP Gruppe weiterzuleiten, zu veröffentlichen und/oder zu verkaufen, es sei denn, diese Informationsübermittlung erfolge auf Anfrage einer staatlichen, gerichtlichen oder anderen Aufsichtsbehörde und/oder sei von Gesetzes wegen verordnet. Teilen die Kandidaten/innen der UBP den Namen einer Referenzperson mit, müssen sie diese im Voraus davon in Kenntnis setzen und akzeptieren, dass die Vertreter der UBP mit ihr Kontakt aufnehmen.

Falls Kandidaten/innen ihre Bewerbung sowohl über ein Personalvermittlungsunternehmen oder einen Headhunter als auch über das Online-Bewerbungsportal einreichen, wird die UBP einzig die zuerst eintreffende Bewerbung berücksichtigen. Die Kandidaten/innen werden daran erinnert, dass sie laut schweizerischem Recht Zugang zu den sie betreffenden Personendaten haben und dass Ihnen das Recht zusteht, falsch mitgeteilte Informationen zu berichtigen. In diesem Falle werden die Kandidaten/innen gebeten, die UBP über das Online-Bewerbungsportal mit der genauen Angabe des Zwecks ihrer Anfrage zu kontaktieren. Die Bewerbungsunterlagen der Kandidaten/innen werden während der zu ihrer Prüfung erforderlichen Zeit aufbewahrt, die Originale in der Folge an die Kandidaten/innen zurückgeschickt und allfällige Kopien zerstört. Eine Ausnahme bilden die mit dem Einverständnis der Kandidaten/innen aufbewahrten Unterlagen.

Mit der Eingabe von Personendaten in das Online-Bewerbungsportal der UBP

stimme ich einer Bearbeitung damit gemäss den oben erläuterten Grundsätzen zu, die ich zur Kenntnis genommen habe.

stimme ich einer Aufbewahrung meiner Bewerbungsunterlagen durch die UBP zu, falls die Bank dies im Hinblick auf künftige Stellen für sinnvoll erachtet."}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2024-03-05721-1-000366992", "text": "(Senior) GenAI Platform Engineer (all genders) 70 -100 %

Come to AXA, Switzerland's leading insurance company, as

(Senior) GenAI Platform Engineer (all genders)

70-100% , Winterthur / Smart Working

You want to be part of something big? We can offer you a great team in a dynamic environment in one of the hottest topics around!
The Competence Center Data & Analytics focusses on solving complex business problems using Generative AI and Machine Learning. Your ambition is to use Generative AI to optimize our business across the insurance value chain. Current projects are Call Center Automation, Underwriting Knowledge Assistants, Complex Claims Handling and many more.
You will actively develop our GenAI – Core Platform that provides the technical foundation for the GenAI-Applications in AXA Switzerland The platform is going to provide capabilities in the handling of unstructured content (documents, voice), GenAI-capabilities (e.g. RAG) and AI-safety and guardrail features.
At AXA you get the space you need to implement your ideas. We support you in training and offer you a culture where you can thrive. And of course, you are going to work with state of the art technologies.
Your contribution

Developing the GenAI Core Platform using state of the art software engineering methods

Provide stable operations incl. security and regulatory compliance

Setting developer standards and provide education to your colleagues in the product teams

Analyze technical trends in the field and drive innovation

Participate or lead knowledge exchanges within the local and global AXA GenAI Community and work with technology companies (e.g. Langchain)

Effective communication with different stakeholders to drive user adoption

Setup and live a new way of working with the product teams (inner source)

Your capabilities and talents

A solid understanding of Software Engineering

Experience in the principles of GenAI (e.g. RAG, CoT, Agents) and GenAI Frameworks (e.g. Langchain/Langsmith, Vector Stores)

2-3 years of experience in DevOps (Git Flow)

Proficiency in Python

Proficiency in working with cloud technologies, preferably Google Cloud Platform

Collaborative, creative, product and user focused

Passionate about generating business value and drive the user adoption

Master or Ph.D. degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Machine Learning, Math, Physics

Around 600 software and system developers work for AXA in Switzerland and are developing tomorrow's technology inhouse. To do this, we are also working in global teams and networks. Our agile product teams organize themselves and work independently where they are responsible for everything from A to Z. Our tasks include programming, integrating the latest tools and arranging hackathons.
Your future workplace Pionierstrasse 3, Winterthur, Switzerland Contact us Apply online now Questions?
Please contact for any questions you may have regarding this open position Angela Capaul via E-Mail [email]

We are unable to accept applications through staff referral agencies for this position.

Advantages
Health

Own AXA health management

Massage offers

Various sport and relaxation courses

Health management seminars

Relaxation rooms

Mobility

Refund of half-fare subscription (GA) (pro rata)

Reduced purchase of Reka Checks

Discounts for buying, leasing or renting cars

Work & family

Maternity leave up to 5 months with full pay

Paternity leave up to 6 weeks with full pay

Company’s family allowance

Family-friendly meeting times

Other benefits

5,000 Swipoints annually (value CHF 500) for use on swibeco.ch

AXA share plan

Discounted catering options through Lunchcard or staff restaurants

Discounts for shopping, events, leisure offers

Insurance products

30% discount on AXA products

private insurance for occupational and non-occupational accidents

Flexibility and scope

Various models for flexibly organizing working hours (AXA Flexwork)

Min. 5 weeks vacation

Extra 2 weeks leave granted every 5 years

Flexible purchase of vacation of up to 10 days

3-day personal study period

Pension fund

Pension fund benefits and employer contributions well above statutory minimum

Free choice of savings plan

Flexibility on retirement

About AXA

Every success story starts with self-belief.
At AXA, we see ourselves as a partner that supports and believes in you. This is why we challenge and encourage you and proactively show you opportunities for your future. We motivate you and offer you freedom so that you can bring together things that are important to you. Together with your commitment and individual contribution, this creates a forward-looking partnership. For you, for us and for our customers. And not just for now. But also for the long term.
Write your own success story with us. Know You Can.
Additional information
Smart Working

At AXA, the emphasis is on trust, flexibility, and teamwork. Our new Smart Working model is all about the contribution you make to the company's objectives – rather than the place where you actually work.
Find out more about Smart Working & Flexwork
Our distinctions

Our goal is to offer existing and future employees the best working environment possible. Discover more about our distinctions here.
Additional Vacancies"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2024-03-05722-1-000365579", "text": "Transformation Manager (m/w/d) 80-100%

Transformation Manager (m/w/d) 80-100%

Finden Sie weitere Stellenangebote
Karrierestufe:	Berufserfahren Standort:
Wallisellen (Zürich), Zürich, CH
Fachgebiet:	Operations Einheit:  Allianz Schweiz Einstellende Einheit:  Allianz Suisse Versicherungs-Gesellschaf Vollzeit/Teilzeit:  Vollzeit oder Teilzeit Homeoffice:  Hybrides Arbeiten Beschäftigungsverhältnis:  Dauerhaft ID:  41580 Funktions-Cluster:  Non-Executive
Als Transformation Manager leistest du einen entscheidenden Beitrag zur strategischen Weiterentwicklung und Implementierung von Artificial Intelligence bei Allianz Suisse. Deine Aufgabe beinhaltet die Entwicklung einer Roadmap und Governance-Struktur sowie die Initiierung erster Use Cases. Um diese dauerhaft in das Unternehmen zu integrieren, setzt du auf agile Methoden, förderst den Aufbau einer unternehmensweiten Community of Practice und entwickelst Weiterbildungsformate. Dabei liegt dein Schwerpunkt auf der Stärkung einer Kultur, die Innovationen vorantreibt. Zeige Mut – wir sind gespannt auf deine Bewerbung.

Das kannst du bewirken

Entwicklung und Implementierung einer innovativen Strategie und Governance für den Einsatz von Artificial Intelligence (AI) bei Allianz Suisse, um eine effektive Steuerung der AI-Initiativen im Einklang mit den Unternehmenszielen zu gewährleisten

Förderung des Austausches von Best-Practices und Aufsetzen von Weiterbildungsmaßnahmen, um das Wissen und die Fähigkeiten der Mitarbeiter im Bereich AI zu erweitern

Etablierung einer unternehmensweiten AI-Community, um den Austausch, die Zusammenarbeit und Innovationen im Bereich AI über Abteilungsgrenzen hinweg zu fördern

Kontinuierliche Bewertung des Reifegrads der AI-Technologien und -Praktiken innerhalb der Allianz Suisse und Überwachung der Ergebnisse aller AI-Initiativen, um Fortschritte transparent zu machen und strategische Anpassungen vorzunehmen

Das bringst du mit

Breite Erfahrung in einem Versicherungsunternehmen mit praktischer Erfahrung in der Förderung einer innovationsgetriebenen Kultur

Tiefgreifendes Verständnis von Datenmanagement, Governance und Herausforderungen im Bereich AI

Strategische Denkweise sowie strukturierte und lösungsorientierte Vorgehensweise

Affinität für Daten und Technologien insbesondere in Bezug auf AI, dem Umgang mit KPIs, Dashboards und Tracking von Ergebnissen

Ausgeprägte kommunikative Fähigkeiten und Freude an Stakeholder Management

Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

Darum startest du mit uns

«Let’s care for tomorrow» heisst für uns auch, ein flexibles Arbeitsumfeld zu schaffen, das die Individualität unserer Mitarbeitenden berücksichtigt: Mit der Möglichkeit von Jobsharing, mit 8 Wochen Vater- und 16 Wochen Mutterschaftsurlaub, der Option, 10 zusätzliche Ferientage pro Jahr zu kaufen, bis zu 25 Tagen pro Jahr im Ausland zu arbeiten, Weiterbildungen und weiteren Benefits. Lies hier mehr Allianz Careers.

41580 | Operations | Berufserfahren | Non-Executive | Allianz Schweiz | Vollzeit oder Teilzeit | Dauerhaft

Über die Allianz

Als eines der grössten Versicherungs- und Finanzunternehmen weltweit liegt uns die Zukunft unserer Mitarbeitenden am Herzen. Gemeinsam schaffen wir ein Umfeld, in dem sich jede und jeder dazu befähigt fühlt, Neues zu entdecken, persönlich wie beruflich zu wachsen und die Zukunft für unsere Kundinnen und Kunden zu gestalten. Unsere Vielfalt macht uns einzigartig und stark. Sie erlaubt uns, innovativ zu sein und Probleme aus verschiedenen Perspektiven zu betrachten. Deshalb setzen wir uns besonders für Chancengleichheit, Diversity und Inklusion ein. Wir freuen uns auf neue Kolleginnen und Kollegen, die unsere Werte leben und offen für neue Herausforderungen sind.

Hast du Fragen zur Stelle?

Monika Kettenmann Buensoz, Senior Talent Sourcing & Recruiting Manager, Telefon 058 358 74 90 steht dir gerne zur Verfügung. Wir freuen uns über deine Online-Bewerbung mit aussagekräftigen Bewerbungsunterlagen (Lebenslauf,
Motivationsschreiben, Arbeitszeugnissen und Diplomen) ausschliesslich über unser Recruiting-Tool."}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2024-03-05731-1-000349894", "text": "Security Operations Center Engineer (SOC)

Wer sich für eine Karriere bei Lombard Odier entscheidet, ist für einen renommierten, globalen Vermögensverwalter und Asset Manager tätig, der sich auf nachhaltige Investitionen fokussiert. Wir sind eine unabhängige und innovative Bank erster Wahl für private und institutionelle Kunden. Unsere Gruppe ist eine der bestkapitalisierten weltweit. Wir verwalten rund CHF 300 Milliarden und sind auf vier Kontinenten von über 25 Niederlassungen aus tätig.

Mit unserer über 225-jährigen Geschichte sind wir ein Investmenthaus mit umfassendem Angebot an diskretionärer und beratender Portfolioverwaltung sowie Finanzdienstleistungen. Unsere hochmoderne Technologie-Plattform vermarkten wir auch erfolgreich an andere Finanzinstitute. Über Lombard Odier Investment Managers bieten wir Vermögensverwaltungsdienstleistungen und Anlagestrategien an.

"Rethink Everything" ist unsere Philosophie – sie steht im Zentrum unseres Handelns. Wir sind durch mehr als 40 Finanzkrisen stärker geworden, indem wir die Welt um uns herum ständig neu gedacht haben. So bieten wir unseren Kundinnen und Kunden stets neue Anlageperspektiven.

Nous sommes à la recherche d'un(e) data(e) scientist talentueux(se) pour rejoindre notre équipe de sécurité en constante évolution. Vous serez responsable de la conception d’alertes, d’analyser les évènements de sécurité et proposer les remédiations adéquates. Dans le cadre de son activité, vous serez amené à avoir une collaboration renforcée avec le Data Science Office et à contribuer à la communauté AI dans le groupe. Vous serez aussi responsable de la mise en œuvre et de la maintenance de solutions de sécurité automatisées pour améliorer l’efficience de notre Security Operation Center (SOC).

VOTRE MISSION :

Collecter, nettoyer et analyser les données de sécurité pour identifier les tendances, les menaces et les vulnérabilités potentielles

Créer des modèles prédictifs pour aider à identifier les risques de sécurité et à prévenir les incidents de sécurité

Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les ingénieurs de sécurité pour élaborer des plans d’action et mette en œuvre des solutions de sécurité

Participer à la revue des alertes et de la réponse à incident (prévoir un service d’astreinte)

Réaliser et maintenir les solutions informatiques couvrant les besoins du SOC en suivant les standards de qualité

Élaborer des workflows et des playbooks de sécurité pour automatiser les tâches récurrentes

Concevoir, mettre en œuvre et maintenir des solutions de sécurité automatisées pour le SOC, y compris la sécurité des événements, la gestion des incidents et la réponse automatisée aux incidents

VOTRE PROFIL :

Etudes supérieures en informatique (Master EPF ou Uni, Bachelor HES ou équivalent) ;

Excellentes connaissances de développement en Python ;

Expérience dans la sécurité informatique et connaissance des outils d’analyse sécurité et de pen-testing un atout ;

Esprit analytique et rigoureux, excellentes capacités d’organisation et à travailler en autonomie ;

Anglais courant, connaissances du français et volonté d'apprendre ;

Domicile ou possibilité de se domicilier en Suisse.

Respekt ist das Fundament unserer Interaktionen, und Integrität leitet unser Handeln. Gemeinsam sind wir ein Team, das sich mit leidenschaftlichem Engagement in den Dienst unserer Kundinnen und Kunden stellt.

Should you recognise yourself in this mission statement, we would be happy to receive your application. It will be handled in the strictest confidence."}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2024-03-05731-1-000349899", "text": "DevOps Engineer

Wer sich für eine Karriere bei Lombard Odier entscheidet, ist für einen renommierten, globalen Vermögensverwalter und Asset Manager tätig, der sich auf nachhaltige Investitionen fokussiert. Wir sind eine unabhängige und innovative Bank erster Wahl für private und institutionelle Kunden. Unsere Gruppe ist eine der bestkapitalisierten weltweit. Wir verwalten rund CHF 300 Milliarden und sind auf vier Kontinenten von über 25 Niederlassungen aus tätig.

Mit unserer über 225-jährigen Geschichte sind wir ein Investmenthaus mit umfassendem Angebot an diskretionärer und beratender Portfolioverwaltung sowie Finanzdienstleistungen. Unsere hochmoderne Technologie-Plattform vermarkten wir auch erfolgreich an andere Finanzinstitute. Über Lombard Odier Investment Managers bieten wir Vermögensverwaltungsdienstleistungen und Anlagestrategien an.

"Rethink Everything" ist unsere Philosophie – sie steht im Zentrum unseres Handelns. Wir sind durch mehr als 40 Finanzkrisen stärker geworden, indem wir die Welt um uns herum ständig neu gedacht haben. So bieten wir unseren Kundinnen und Kunden stets neue Anlageperspektiven.

At Lombard Odier, sustainability is our core philosophy. Representing the next economic revolution, it is our conviction that sustainable investing is the way to generate long-term returns and grow our clients' prosperity in perpetuity. Sustainability, via the transition to a circular, lean, inclusive and clean (CLICTM) economic model, is therefore central to Lombard Odier’s approach to its business and investment philosophy. We believe this ‘sustainability revolution’ has already become one of the most important drivers of risk-adjusted returns today.  Will you be part of it?

Lombard Odier Investment Managers (“LOIM”) is the asset management business of the Lombard Odier Group.  In order to strengthen our technology team, we are looking for a:

DevOps Engineer

About the role

You will join a global business of more than 120 investment professionals and a network of 13 offices across Europe, Asia and North America. Our technology team works directly and closely with the Business. Our IT ecosystem is based on state-of-the-art tools from leading financial software providers. In addition to this, we develop our own solutions using agile development and DevOps techniques. You will report to the head of IT development based in Geneva and contribute to our technical infrastructure.

How will you make an impact at LOIM

In this role, your main responsibilities will include the following

Assist the team in designing and implementing a unified end-user computing platform

Collaborate with Developers, Data Scientists, and Portfolio Managers from multiple business units

Optimize and streamline CI/CD pipelines and job automations for various teams

Ensure the reliability of the infrastructure

Support users, share knowledge, and encourage good development practices

The skills you will demonstrate

University degree in computer science or equivalent

Proficiency with Python or other scripting languages

Experience with Linux and Shell scripting

Good knowledge of CI/CD tooling

Knowledge of Kubernetes, containerization and distributed computing a plus

Interest in data management and machine learning tooling a plus

Interest in Finance

Why join us

You will join a highly collaborative, multicultural, entrepreneurial and passionate team. We are committed to providing employees a stimulating work environment where creativity and innovation are encouraged for improving business opportunity and effectiveness.

LOIM is an equal opportunity employer

We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment, where talented people inspire the organization with a diversity of thought, background, experience and identity to reinforce our innovation and deliver excellence. We firmly believe this is how we will continue to thrive. To deliver on this, we have actively embedded Diversity & Inclusion in our business strategy.

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2024-03-05733-1-000362031", "text": "Stage universitaire 12 mois - Audit interne (TIC & cyber)

Stage universitaire 12 mois - Audit interne (TIC & cyber)
30061
Annonce

Objectif carrière : le programme BCV pour jeunes diplômés

Chaque année, près de 100 personnes sont formées aux métiers de la banque selon différents programmes: stages pour universitaires, apprentissages, stages pour porteurs de maturité, ainsi que «Rejoignez-nous» destiné en priorité aux femmes souhaitant intégrer le milieu bancaire.

Pourquoi pas vous ?

Notre programme de stage universitaire vous propose un cycle d’un an pour découvrir la diversité d’une banque universelle. Cette première expérience professionnelle vous permettra de côtoyer des spécialistes rares en Suisse romande et de développer vos compétences.

La BCV dispose d’une culture d’entreprise qui favorise la coopération et la recherche de performance. Sa stratégie d’affaires est orientée vers la création de valeur dans une perspective de développement durable.

Saisissez l’opportunité de mettre à profit vos atouts et votre savoir-faire dans un environnement dynamique et ambitieux. Vos compétences et votre engagement sont les clés de notre succès !

Le stage universitaire à la BCV:

un programme qui vous ouvre la porte sur tous les métiers de la banque universelle,

un soutien actif au développement de vos compétences,

une taille humaine qui rend visible votre contribution au succès de la Banque,

un plan de formation personnalisé, défini en tenant compte de votre profil, de vos aspirations et des besoins spécifiques de la banque.

Stagiaire universitaire 12 mois – Audit interne (TIC & cyber)

Vos missions principales:

participer à des missions d'audit interne qui traitent de la gestion des risques TIC (technologies de l’information et des communications) et cyber,

contribuer à faire évoluer les méthodologies d’audit relatives à l’évaluation des risques TIC & cyber (notamment : développement de programmes de travail et de tableaux de bord),

contribuer à opérer la veille technologique,

accompagner les démarches en cours relatives aux data analytics (y c. machine learning),

soutenir l’équipe d’audit interne dans ses tâches.

Votre profil:

formation supérieure en informatique et/ou sécurité de l’information EPFL/HES

intérêt pour le domaine de l’audit, et plus particulièrement pour la gestion des risques TIC & cyber,

aisance relationnelle, dynamisme, organisation, proactivité, capacités d’apprentissage et de synthèse,

maîtrise des outils informatiques usuels,

résidence en Suisse.

La BCV, c'est:

	•  la possibilité, rare en Suisse romande, d'exercer l'ensemble des métiers de la banque à tous les niveaux de responsabilité,

	•  une taille humaine qui rend visible votre contribution au succès de la Banque et vous donne l’opportunité de réaliser des missions diversifiées,

	•  une entreprise dont la réussite s’inscrit dans la durée grâce à une gestion rigoureuse,

	•  un employeur qui s’implique activement dans la communauté vaudoise,

	•  une entreprise responsable vis-à-vis de ses collaborateurs qui offre un cadre de travail favorisant l’équilibre vie professionnelle et vie privée.

Pour en savoir plus, consultez les
10 bonnes raisons
de nous rejoindre, le descriptif de
nos métiers
et l'ensemble des
offres d'emploi
."}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2024-03-05735-1-000358431", "text": "Master Thesis - Analyst AI roadmap

Your team

The Pictet Group is one of the world’s leading independent wealth and asset managers. Founded in 1805 and headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland, the Group is represented in 27 offices in financial centres worldwide and currently employs over 5300 people. Pictet Wealth Management combines more than 200 years of Swiss banking heritage with global investment expertise. The partner-owned financial services group offers a comprehensive service for wealthy individuals and families, including discretionary and advisory investment solutions and family office services.

We are seeking to recruit a Trainee who is keen to become immersed in the world of finance and banking. You will work alongside a diverse group of professionals and be part of one of the internal project management teams. Your mission will be to consolidate internal requirements related to the potential use of AI within the Wealth Management division of our bank, conduct in-depth research to identify AI technology directions and priorities in the banking sector, and suggest a strategy on how to implement such technologies to enhance internal investment expertise and improve internal efficiency, productivity and customer experience.

Your role

You will be responsible for :

Consolidating internal requirements related to AI applications across units within the Wealth Management division (Investment Platform, Risk & Compliance, Communications, Operations & Middle Office, etc.).

Conducting in-depth research to identify AI technology trends and priorities in the banking sector considering input from peers, top consulting firms and technology leaders (fintech, software solution providers, etc.).

Identifying viable project options and conceptualising ideas for AI integration aimed at enhancing efficiency, productivity and customer experience in banking

Developing a concise short-to-medium-term AI strategy and roadmap, focusing on quick wins and alignment with internal needs

Suggesting priorities for AI projects, providing well-structured business cases for shortlisted topics

Delivering a comprehensive written report and presentation to senior management outlining findings, strategies and recommendations

Your profile

Master’s student in Management or Finance.

A strong interest in the finance and banking sector, encompassing all aspects of operations (investment products, client interactions, transactions execution & processing, compliance, etc.).

A solid interest and understanding of technology, specially AI and its potential future uses.

Proficient in the use of standard office tools (MS Office, etc.).

Demonstrable ability in written and verbal communication for presenting research findings.

Strong organisational skills, attention to detail, proactive and solution-oriented mindset.

Ability to analyse, evaluate and come up with conclusions/recommendations.

Capacity to work independently.

Proficient in both French and English.

Start date: 01.01.2024

Location: Geneva

Ref: MTAAIR/SN/CJ

Note
We will not accept any CVs via agencies
Diversity & Inclusion

Pictet is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to creating a diverse environment. We respect all individuals and seek their inclusion in the workplace."}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2024-03-05850-1-000368683", "text": "Distinguished Engineer - Applied Science - Outshift

Please note this posting is to advertise potential job opportunities. This exact role may not be open today, but could open in the near future. When you apply, a Cisco representative may contact you directly if a relevant position opens.

Who We Are
We are a part of Outshift by Cisco focused on identifying breakthrough emerging solutions that create new markets and businesses for Cisco. We incubate these new opportunities in partnership with our business groups, corporate partners, and other startups. The team also continues to progress Cisco’s important work with Standards bodies and runs research partnerships with groundbreaking Universities.
Our organization is anticipating high growth. We are seeking talent with the agility and creativity to explore opportunities and fill in needs as they arise across our teams. Applicants should be seeking a flexible role, in which they not only provide leadership in their primary function but also contribute in meaningful ways to other projects. We are looking for individuals who are passionate about shifting quickly to different domains that may be outside of their normal scope of responsibilities.

Learn more about us at [wwwadr]

Who You'll Work With
The Outshift team is highly visible within Cisco as it's leading the future innovation for the business. As part of the Strategy, Incubations & Applications group led by Cisco’s Chief Strategy Officer, you’ll be working with some of the organization’s most forward thinkers.
In this role, you can expect to work with engineering, design, and scientists in defining and executing the product plan:

Conduct customer, market, competitive, and industry research. Additionally, have a proven grasp on overall landscape for generative AI machine learning models, tooling, and/or applications, and develop a clear strategy around how to elevate competitive differentiators

Own the creation of Minimal Viable Product (MVP) definition and then defining a product roadmap that elevates the competitive differentiators at every stage. Define customer value prop and return on investment at each stage

Work with marketing and business development teams in identifying and executing effective Go-To-Market (GTM) strategies for your product. Establish Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and metrics to track progress

Key metrics & measures – Establishing milestones & metrics to evaluate the success and failure of the project. Also, pay close attention to metrics and measures important to customer stakeholders and establish a compelling Return On Investment (ROI) for them

Collaborate with marketing team in identifying key collaterals – product documents, data sheets, value props, sales decks, ROI calculators, demo videos (it is especially important for the product manager to own demo scripts and video during MVP and initial stages of the product life cycle).

What You'll Do
In this role, you will work in an innovative team, apply, and advance powerful AI technologies in products that make tangible business impacts, create the latest AI-powered user experiences on various platforms, work alongside committed generative AI product management, software engineering teams gain expertise in the most in-demand AI domains for the future, and contribute to shaping Cisco’s AI strategies for the next decade.

The Impact You’ll Make
If you want the challenge of fast-paced growth, the satisfaction of seeing your thoughtful ideas come to life, and the pride in helping grow a best-in-class AI team, this is the place for you.

Your Responsibilities Will Include

Lead a team of applied scientists and drive applied ML initiatives across products.

Drive the Generative AI strategy and lead pivotal initiatives to employ the most recent advances in ML/AI including Large Language models (LLMs) in a fast-paced, experimental environment and create differentiation.

Lead development, implementation, and optimization of LLMs and generative AI technologies, including training, fine-tuning and computation optimizations, and deliver novel and highly impactful features.

Work with peer leaders in Outshift and wider Cisco Senior AI practitioners (PE, DE, Fellows) from other business groups to align strategies and collaborate on AI initiatives.

Conduct research and develop innovative AI models using state-of-the-art techniques across various modalities including NLP, CV, time series, and multimodal.

Mentor applied scientists and hold us to a high standard of technical rigor and excellence in ML.

Guide the team on State-of-the-Art techniques, and model architectures including LLMs and Gen AI.

Minimum Requirements

PhD in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or related quantitative field.

12+ years of industry experience in Deep Learning, Natural Language Processing/understanding, Reinforcement learning.

10+ yrs exp in Java, C++, Python, or other related languages.

Practical experience in developing, training, deploying, and evaluating AI models in real-world applications and knowledge of deep learning frameworks.

Understanding and hands-on experience in Large Language Models, Natural Language Processing, Computer vision, Image Processing, and generative AI techniques.

Preferred Requirements

Depth and breadth in state-of-the-art machine learning technologies.

A highly driven leader who is known to deliver in high growth and highly dynamic environments.

Be an advocate for creative technical trends. Acknowledged for driving decisions collaboratively, resolving challenges, and ensuring follow-through.

Extraordinarily resourceful & rigorous, you can operate successfully among forward-thinking and charismatic people.

Equally comfortable and capable of interacting with technologists as with business executives.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Why Cisco?

#WeAreCisco. We are all unique, but collectively we bring our talents to work as a team, to develop innovative technology and power a more inclusive, digital future for everyone. How do we do it? Well, for starters – with people like you!

Nearly every internet connection around the world touches Cisco. We’re the Internet’s optimists. Our technology makes sure the data travelling at light speed across connections does so securely, yet it’s not what we make but what we make happen which marks us out. We’re helping those who work in the health service to connect with patients and each other; schools, colleges and universities to teach in even the most challenging of times. We’re helping businesses of all shapes and size to connect with their employees and customers in new ways, providing people with access to the digital skills they need and connecting the most remote parts of the world – whether through 5G, or otherwise.

We tackle whatever challenges come our way. We have each other’s backs, we recognize our accomplishments, and we grow together. We celebrate and support one another – from big and small things in life to big career moments. And giving back is in our DNA (we get 10 days off each year to do just that).

We know that powering an inclusive future starts with us. Because without diversity and a dedication to equality, there is no moving forward. Our 30 Inclusive Communities, that bring people together around commonalities or passions, are leading the way. Together we’re committed to learning, listening, caring for our communities, whilst supporting the most vulnerable with a collective effort to make this world a better place either with technology, or through our actions.

So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us! #WeAreCisco

#li-ha1

#LI-Remote"}

You will be part of the incubation team to develop new products and bring them to market in a startup-like environment.

What You'll Do

In this role, you will work in an innovative team, apply and advance powerful AI technologies in products that make tangible business impacts, create the latest AI-powered user experiences on various platforms, work alongside a committed generative AI product management team, gain expertise in the most in-demand AI domains for the future, and contribute to shaping Cisco’s AI strategies for the next decade. You will also collaborate across teams within Cisco, to drive a common AI strategy across the company.

The Impact You’ll Make

Want the challenge of fast-paced growth along with the happiness of seeing thoughtful ideas come to life? The pride in helping grow a world-class AI team. This is the place for you!

Your responsibilities will include

Design and develop end-to-end products to enable easy adoption of generative AI for enterprises.

Collaborate with multi-functional teams including product managers, applied scientists, and other engineers and identify and implement the most effective system design and solutions.

Design and build services and integrations for ML pipelines for LLM fine-tuning, prompt tuning and engineering, Benchmarking and RAG for various generative AI models.

Stay up to date with the latest advancements in the field of AI and apply them to develop cutting- edge solutions.

Minimum Requirements

Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Statistics, or a related field.

7+ years strong programming skills in Java, C++, Python or other related languages.

5+ years deep coding experience in developing and delivering complex, distributed, enterprise class software.

Understanding of infrastructure needed for building and adoption of Large Language Models, Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, Image Processing, and generative AI techniques

Preferred Requirements

Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently or in a team.

Comfortable and capable of interacting with technologists as with business executives.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Why Cisco?

#WeAreCisco. We are all unique, but collectively we bring our talents to work as a team, to develop innovative technology and power a more inclusive, digital future for everyone. How do we do it? Well, for starters – with people like you!

Nearly every internet connection around the world touches Cisco. We’re the Internet’s optimists. Our technology makes sure the data travelling at light speed across connections does so securely, yet it’s not what we make but what we make happen which marks us out. We’re helping those who work in the health service to connect with patients and each other; schools, colleges, and universities to teach in even the most challenging of times. We’re helping businesses of all shapes and size to connect with their employees and customers in new ways, providing people with access to the digital skills they need and connecting the most remote parts of the world – whether through 5G, or otherwise.

We tackle whatever challenges come our way. We have each other’s backs, we recognize our accomplishments, and we grow together. We celebrate and support one another – from big and small things in life to big career moments. And giving back is in our DNA (we get 10 days off each year to do just that).

We know that powering an inclusive future starts with us. Because without diversity and a dedication to equality, there is no moving forward. Our 30 Inclusive Communities, that bring people together around commonalities or passions, are leading the way. Together we’re committed to learning, listening, caring for our communities, whilst supporting the most vulnerable with a collective effort to make this world a better place either with technology, or through our actions.

So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us! #WeAreCisco

#LI-HA1"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2024-03-05874-1-000365532", "text": "PhD position in the field of transmission electron microscopy of rechargeable all-solid-state-batteries 100%

With our cutting-edge research, Empa's around 1,100 employees make essential contributions to the well-being of society for a future worth living. Empa is a research institution of the ETH Domain.Empa's Electron Microscopy Center located in Dübendorf conducts forefront research in the development and application of new electron microscopy techniques in materials science and is offering a PhD position to carry out cutting-edge research in the field of all-solid-state-batteries (ASSBs). The goal of this project is to deliver a comprehensive understanding of lithium-ion transport in rechargeable ASSBs during realistic battery operation. The project will be carried out in close collaboration with the Laboratory of Thin Films and Photovoltaics at Empa lead by Dr. Yaroslav Romanyuk.Your tasksAs part of a larger effort at Empa, you will contribute to a research project in the field of ASSBs. Master's degree in physics, materials science or a related discipline

Enthusiasm for the research areas listed above

Self-motivated and willing to take initiatives

Prior experience in transmission electron microscopy, image analysis, machine learning and/or programming (e.g. Matlab, Python)

Ability to work in interdisciplinary teams

Proficient in English (written and spoken)

Our offerWe offer internationally competitive conditions, optimal experimental and computational facilities and the opportunity to work in a multidisciplinary environment. The project will be carried out at Empa Dübendorf under the supervision of Dr. Marta D. Rossell. You will be registered as a PhD student at the ETH Zurich under the guidance of Prof. Dr. Rolf Erni. {"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2024-03-05876-1-000367625", "text": "PostDoc in Spatial-Temporal Scaling of Thermal Landscapes 80-100% (f/m/d) 80% - 100%

Swiss Federal Institute for Forest, Snow and Landscape Research WSL  The Swiss Federal Institute for Forest, Snow and Landscape Research WSL is part of the ETH Domain. Approximately 600 people work on the sustainable use and protection of the environment and on the handling of natural hazards.
In a collaboration between Yale University and the WSL, we are working to understand how heat extremes, and refugia, change across spatial and temporal scales, in order to project thermal landscapes on an ever-changing plant. This project is part of a larger, multi-institutional initiative led by Yale University to understand how life adapts (or not) to hot climate states. In the framework of this program, the Spatial Evolutionary Ecology Group in the Research Unit Biodiversity and Conservation Biology, in collaboration with the Dynamic Macroecology group in the Land Change Science Research Unit of WSL, is searching for a one-year (with option for one year of extension) with a start between March 1 and May 1, 2024PostDoc in Spatial-Temporal Scaling of Thermal Landscapes 80-100% (f/m/d)Extreme heat affects life at the individual scale –in the location and time in which they exist. On a warm and warming planet, how thermal refugia scale in space and time is a key factor for survival. A goal of this research is to explore the relationship of (macro-)climate to microclimate as it varies in response to major determinants like topography, land cover, distance from water, etc. As part of this project, we aim to generate a number of bioclimatic variables related to heat stress in different major groups of organisms (ecotherms, endotherms, plants). This project will be carried out in close collaboration with the technical support scientist in the Dynamic Macroecology group downscaling the climate data, as well as the project mentors. You will investigate the spatial-temporal scaling of temperature extremes in using highly resolved climate data in order to project the effect of extreme heat on organisms in the coming decades. In the second phase of the project, you will leverage these relationships to model the likely thermal exposure of a range of organisms to extreme heat by 2100. You will be based at WSL in Birmensdorf in the Research Unit Biodiversity and Conservation Biology, and will work in collaboration with the Dynamic Macroecology group at WSL and with Yale University in the United States.You have a PhD in climate science, environmental sciences, geography, ecology or a related field. Experience in handling and analyzing big data sets and in working with environmental layers and ecological data is a requirement. Skills in Python and R are a necessity in this position. Strong skills in using computing, data science and/or AI, are a plus. You should be proficient in English, have a demonstrated capacity to write scientific papers, and be ambitious, creative, and highly motivated. You should also be used to a high standard of independent, structured, and careful work, and be excited to work in a collaborative team of international and interdisciplinary researchers. If this describes your background and working style, you have the right qualifications for this position.
Please submit your complete application to Michèle Bucher, Human Resources WSL, by uploading the requested documents through our webpage. Applications via email will not be considered. For further information, contact Dr. Catherine Graham catherine.graham(at)wsl.ch, Dr. Pincelli Hull pincelli.hull(at)wsl.ch and Dr. Dirk N. Karger dirk.karger(at)wsl.ch. WSL strives to increase the proportion of women in its employment, which is why qualified women are particularly called upon to apply for this position. Applications will be considered until the positions are filled, but we will start evaluating applicants immediately and thus encourage submissions by mid to late January 2024.Apply now Zürcherstrasse 111, CH-8903 Birmensdorf
Website
Company-Video"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2024-03-05880-1-000355843", "text": "Experienced Data Strategy Consultant

Data & AI
Als Data Consultant in Zühlkes AI + Data Practice schlägst Du die Brücke zwischen AI-Technologien und dem Business – und wirst so zum «Trusted Advisor» für Entscheidungspersonen bei unseren Kunden in AI-Projekten.

Deine Aufgabe:

Du planst, organisierst und leitest Workshops und verwendest Beratungsmethoden zur Unterstützung unserer Kunden.

Du kommunizierst gut und gerne mit Entscheidern bei unseren Kunden – und es macht Dir Spass, unser AI-Offering zu positionieren und damit unser AI-Geschäft aktiv noch weiter zu entwickeln.

Du bist als BotschafterIn unserer Disziplin AI in- und extern aktiv und entwickelst unsere Offerings und unsere Expertise weiter.

Du positionierst Dich als «Thought Leader» für Dein Spezialgebiet im Bereich AI und hilfst, junge Talente zu entwickeln.

In AI-Projekten und Programmen setzt Du Zühlkes holistischen Ansatz um, indem Du alle relevanten Ebenen und Disziplinen wie beispielsweise Datenplattformen, Data Governance, Algorithmik und Anwendungsfälle berücksichtigst und die Zusammenarbeit von entsprechenden Experten moderierst. Damit stellst Du den Projekterfolg und die Wertgenerierung sicher.

Du entwickelst die richtige Strategie für unternehmerische Vorhaben im Bereich AI und Daten und unterstützt unsere Kunden bei ihrer Transformation zum datengetriebenen Unternehmen in verschiedenen Dimensionen.

Du verstehst AI- und Daten-Technologien als Werkzeuge, um faktenbasierte Entscheidungen zu ermöglichen, Prozesse zu optimieren oder neue Produkte und Dienstleistungen zu entwickeln. Damit erkennst Du bei unseren Kunden Potenziale, um mit diesen Werk-zeugen echten Wert für ihr Business zu generieren.

Dein Profil:

Du verfügst über ein Hochschulstudium im Bereich Business Management o. ä. mit einer Zusatzausbildung im Bereich AI oder über ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes technisches Hochschulstudium in Computer Science oder Engineering.

Erfahrung in Leitung von Beratungsprojekten.

Expertise im Bereich Data Strategy, Data Governance, Data Management, Data Organization.

Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von digitalen Produkten und Dienstleistungen wäre ideal.

Beherrschung von Methoden der Innovationsberatung (Lean Start-Up, Design Thinking), der Prozessberatung, der agilen Business-Analyse bzw. des agilen Arbeitens (Scrum, Kanban).

Überzeugende Kommunikationsfähigkeiten sowie sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkennt-nisse runden dein Profil ab.

Deine Persönlichkeit:

Du bist eine durchsetzungsfähige, eloquente und proaktive Persönlichkeit, die in der Lage ist, selbständig und eigenverantwortlich zu agieren.

Du bringst hohe Kundenorientierung mit und besitzt die Fähigkeit, interdisziplinär zu denken und zu kommunizieren.

Ebenso bist du ergebnisorientiert und kannst Stakeholder und Entscheider für sich gewinnen.

UnsereArbeitsphilosophie

Bei Zühlke fördern wir ein Growth Mindset und unterstützen den Erfolg unserer Mitarbeitenden. Wir tauschen regelmäßig Ideen aus, geben einander Feedback und lernen voneinander. Dabei le-gen wir Wert auf eine offene und klare Kommunikation miteinander. Wir gehen mit Hindernis-sen und Misserfolgen eigeninitiativ um, haben eine optimistische Grundhaltung und ergreifen Maßnahmen zur langfristigen Sicherung der Leistungsfähigkeit.  Veränderungen begegnen wir agil, aktiv und offen, denn aus jeder Herausforderung können wir etwas lernen.

Unser Angebot:

Work-Life Balance - wir bieten dir eine familienfreundliche Arbeitsumgebung, flexible Arbeitszeiten ohne Kernzeiten und Homeoffice.

Wertschätzende Kultur - wir kommunizieren offen miteinander, schätzen uns ehrlich ein und arbeiten gerne im Team.

Weiterentwicklung - wir helfen dir, durch kontinuierliche und qualitativ hochstehende Weiterbildung zu wachsen.

Wissensaustausch - wir verfolgen einen interdisziplinären Ansatz, eine Kultur des Wissensaustauschs und des voneinander Lernens.

Internationale Topic Groups - wir tauschen Erfahrungen und Wissen miteinander aus und unterstützen uns gegenseitig bei der Weiterentwicklung innerhalb unserer internen Communities.

Toller Arbeitsplatz - wir bieten eine Kultur des Vertrauens, ermutigen unsere Mitarbeitenden, über den Tellerrand zu schauen und ihre Ideen zu teilen.

Haben wir Dein Interesse geweckt?

Dann gestalte Deine Zukunft noch heute und bewirb Dich bei Zühlke!
Festanstellung 80-100% Zürich Jetzt bewerben"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2024-03-05882-1-000353976", "text": "(Senior) Manager - Technology Risk Consulting / EMEIA Financial Services in Zurich

(Senior) Manager - Technology Risk Consulting / EMEIA Financial Services in Zurich
Location:	Zurich Other locations:  Primary Location Only Salary:CompetitiveDate:  Feb 9, 2024
Job description
Requisition ID:  1466733
The world is changing more and faster than ever. Our global promise: "Building a better working world" guides our more than 300,000 employees around the world and provides the basis for the work we do every day. With our innovative services in auditing, tax consulting and transaction and management consulting, we lead our clients into the future.

Our advisory business offers a wide range of functional and cross-border services aimed at providing high quality and trusted advice to our clients. Our Financial Services Organization (FSO) is the only one of the Big 4 companies with a functional and international specialization in the financial services sector. In this way, we provide seamless, consistent, and high-quality services to our clients around the world.

The Opportunity

Work on exciting technology risk projects with leadership roles at some of the largest Swiss banks, asset management and insurance companies.

Gain insight into state-of-the-art IT environments and our established practices based on global methodologies

Learn frontline thought leadership in response to today's changing marketplace, ever-increasing regulatory requirements and new digital challenges

Grow your expertise with each project alongside our partners and mentor less experienced consultants

You will have the opportunity to work with people from all over Europe and the world

Your most important tasks

Your focus is on technology risk consulting, information security and IT risk management for banks, asset managers and insurance companies

You will manage a portfolio of clients while working on projects on current topics such as digital resilience, cloud risk management, third party management, data management, transformation, and artificial intelligence.

In addition, you will take on tasks in the areas of technology risk assurance in terms of internal controls as well as risk and compliance management

As an Engagement Manager, you will be responsible for the successful planning, execution, and completion of complex projects with various internal and external stakeholders

You further develop our consulting services and thereby contribute significantly to the strategic development of the team

You actively doing go-to-market and acquire consulting mandates as well as audit-related additional services for our financial services and insurance clients

Skills and qualities for success

What you bring with you:

Bachelor's or master’s degree in business administration or (business) information technology is a prerequisite, relevant certifications (e.g. CISA, CRISC, etc.) round off your profile

Relevant experience (min. 5 years for Manager and min. 8 years for Senior Manager) in the areas of Technology Risk such as IT Risk, Governance and Compliance, Digital and Cyber Resilience, Cloud Risk Management, Transformation Risk, Artificial Intelligence Risk or similar

Sound organizational and technical knowledge in the area of technology risk, including experience with relevant security standards and frameworks (e.g. ISO 27001, COBIT, ITIL, NIST, etc.)

A must: Passion for consulting and technology risk issues and proven entrepreneurial skills

Experience in the areas of leadership, team mentoring, customer and project management

Success factors that will get you ahead with us: Ability to work in a team, determination, readiness for action and a quick grasp of things

As an international company, we require German and English (fluent)

What we are looking for:

Are you as ambitious as we are? As a member of our high-performing teams, you'll develop the tech skills and mindset to become the leader you want to be - the leader the world needs. Use our reach, our technology, our teams and our culture to fulfil your potential and change the world. Learn from the best, surround yourself with the brightest minds and ask better questions to get even better answers. The unique experiences you gain at EY will stay with you for life. It's in your hands - It's yours to build.

What we offer:

An international, multicultural team of highly motivated professionals

Broad and established national and international client portfolio

A culture that promotes diversity and continuous learning

An innovative and dynamic environment that constantly opens new doors for you through the exchange of knowledge, flexibility and recognition

An open and collaborative work culture based on honesty, integrity and mutual respect

Numerous training opportunities and online courses to improve your knowledge and skills in technical and non-technical areas

During your employment with us, you will have the opportunity to earn an accredited, proprietary and free MBA (EY Tech MBA) from Hult International Business School*

Are you interested? Do you think you meet the above criteria? Do you want to advance your career and experience a unique culture? Then apply to us now and take the next step! Apply online for your new challenge.

For more information, please contact our recruitment team ([email] / +41 58 286 33 66).

The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build."}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2024-03-05885-1-000357120", "text": "Career Start IT Audit and Process Analytics - Trade, Industries and Services - Herbst 2024

Career Start IT Audit and Process Analytics - Trade, Industries and Services - Herbst 2024
Be a part of The New Equation.
Dein Impact

Prüfe die IT- und Geschäftsprozesse unserer Kund:innen im Bereich Trade, Industries and Services hinsichtlich IT-Risiken, regulatorischer Vorgaben und bewährter Methoden und unterstütze die Kund:innen beim besseren Verständnis der Systemlandschaft und deren Einfluss auf die Prozesseffizienz.

Setze unsere digitalen Werkzeuge während Jahresabschlussprüfungen ein, um einen modernen Prüfungsansatz mit Automatisierung, künstlicher Intelligenz, Datenanalysen und anderen innovativen Methoden zu verfolgen.

Nutze die Gelegenheit, bei einer Vielzahl von Kunden, in verschiedenen Industrien und Technologien mitzuwirken, um deine unternehmerischen Fähigkeiten, Wissen und Beziehungen zu entwickeln – für eine Karriere, die weit über Zahlen hinausgeht.

Sei Teil eines vielfältigen Teams in unserem internationalen Netzwerk und profitiere von unserer kontinuierlichen Weiterbildung.

Dein Skill Set

Bachelorabschluss in Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder einem ähnlichen Feld, oder kurz vor dem Abschluss.

Ausgeprägtes Flair für vernetztes und analytisches Denken sowie grosses Interesse an IT Prozessen und neuen Technologien.

Hohe Lernbereitschaft und Absicht, eine weiterführende Ausbildung wie das CISA Zertifikat zu absolvieren.

Ausgeprägte Kommunikations- und Teamfähigkeit mit hoher Kunden- und Serviceorientierung.

Stilsicheres Deutsch und Englisch in Wort und Schrift.

Dein Kontakt
Luzia Kuhn
Recruitment Team
+41 58 792 44 97"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2024-03-05886-1-000363717", "text": "Senior IT Business Analyst Financial Services (part-time possible, all genders)

Du willst die Digitalisierung von Unternehmen in Voll- oder Teilzeit fördern und dabei Themen wie Design Thinking, agile Softwareentwicklung, Automatisierung, DevOps, Artificial Intelligence und Blockchain adressieren? Du willst unseren Kunden bei komplexen Transformationsprojekten den Weg zur zügigen Systemintegration eröffnen? Das ist genau dein Ding?

Dann lebe deine Leidenschaft in einer Position, in der du frische Impulse im Industriebereich Financial Services setzt.

Das erwartet dich

Du begleitest die strategischen Projekte unserer Kunden aus der Banken- & Versicherungsbranche von der Konzeption bis zur technischen Umsetzung.

Dabei konzipierst und lenkst du die Anforderungserhebung (Business Analysis / Requirement Engineering / Business Process Modelling) und stellst die Umsetzung in interdisziplinären Teams sicher.

Du moderierst Workshops zur Modellierung der kundenspezifischen Lösungen und agierst als Expert:in für Systemintegrationen.

Bei entsprechender Erfahrung agierst du als Product Owner, Scrum Master oder Lead Business Analyst und coachst agile Delivery Teams, oft in Zusammenarbeit mit Near-/Offshore-Kolleg:innen.

Darauf freuen wir uns

Abgeschlossenes Studium der Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informatik, Mathematik, Naturwissenschaften oder Technik sowie Erfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung, Technologieberatung und/oder Systemintegration mit Einblicken in die Finanzdienstleistungsindustrie

Idealerweise Praxis in der technischen Business Analyse bzw. im Requirements Engineering und Kenntnisse in agilen Methoden (Scrum/SAFe)

Hohe Kundenorientierung und die Fähigkeit, komplexe Probleme zu zerlegen

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2024-03-05886-1-000363728", "text": "EMBARK Program: Tech Transformation Manager (part-time possible)

Are you a woman with professional experience seeking opportunities to rejoin the workforce after a break, such as maternity leave or sabbatical?

Well then, welcome to Accenture, where a unique offer awaits you. EMBARK is tailored for highly skilled women who aim to resume their career journey as managers or senior managers after a career break.

Here’s how it all works. Upon your return, you will undergo a three-month preparation and development phase that includes personalized training and job shadowing. You will be supported by experienced Accenture executives who will act as your trusted advisors and mentors. Following that, you start your dream job, enjoying excellent career opportunities and developing in an environment that nurtures and inspires. You can shape your work according to your preferences and needs, whether part-time or full-time, on site, or remotely. The choice is yours!

Your daily work

As a Technology Transformation Manager, you guide and lead our clients through increasingly complex and fast-paced changes, with the aim of developing efficient technological infrastructure that generates sustainable value.

You develop strategies and roadmaps for ambitious IT transformations backed by compelling business cases.

You forge architectural frameworks and optimize the application portfolio to achieve our clients’ objectives.

Collaborating with multidisciplinary teams and clients from various industries, you resolve complex business problems with innovative technology solutions.

As a lifelong learner, you continually seek to acquire new knowledge about cutting-edge technologies and leverage this expertise to strengthen our reputation as a thought leader in the technology industry and create impulses for innovation with our clients.

In summary, you collaborate with a diverse range of customers to implement effective strategies. To achieve that, you draw from your expertise in cloud computing, data analytics, artificial intelligence, and intelligent automation solutions to generate tangible business value. Your responsibilities also include realizing companies’ IT-target and providing guidance during the realignment of IT organizations.

Who you are

You hold a university degree in a relevant field, such as business informatics or computer science, and possess excellent written communication skills in English and at least one of the official regional languages (German, Italian, or French).

You demonstrate either broad technical knowledge and a passion for new technologies, modern architectures, and IT organizations, or possess detailed industry and sector experience and specific platform and solution expertise.

Possess strategic thinking abilities, strong communication skills, and prior experience in analyzing, evaluating, and developing modern IT landscapes.

What we offer

You are important to us. For that, we are committed to creating a supportive work environment that reflects this every day. As a responsible employer, we offer a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your needs:

As a member of our tech community, you will have access to personalized training, specialized thought leadership programs, and a range of certification opportunities

Personal mentoring and on-the-job training

Exciting employee events

A diverse and inclusive work culture

Contact us

Any questions? Contact us by e-mail at [email] or by phone at 00 800 450 450 45.

We look forward to meeting you!

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2024-03-05886-1-000363755", "text": "Junior Consultant Financial Services (part-time possible, all genders)

Are you ready to make a difference in Accenture’s consulting team, where we boost our clients’ productivity, innovation and performance by combining our economical, digital and technological know-how? Can you picture yourself setting fresh impulses in our industry area of Financial Services, in the context of exciting projects for our leading insurance company clients, with highly motivated, friendly colleagues and lots of room for your ideas concerning strategy, simplification and efficiency, customer experience, digital business models and new technologies such as Intelligent Automation, Cloud, AI and platforms?

Does this sound right up your alley? Then live your passion in a position where you develop groundbreaking strategies and, as an innovation consultant, introduce new technologies that make a positive difference to our customers.

What awaits you

From conceptualization to successful closing, you’ll be involved in futuristic projects for digital transformation. In cooperation with the leading FinTechs and your colleagues from Accenture Digital, the Innovation Team and other departments, you’ll develop sustainable solution ideas.

Armed with your knowledge of the finance and insurance industry and a basic affinity to technology, you’ll expand your horizons and grow both as a professional and as a person.

You’ll start in one of the following areas: banking, capital markets, customer insight & growth, finance & risk, insurance, or technology advisory.

Right from the beginning, you’ll take charge of high-responsibility tasks at our clients’ location, supported by experienced colleagues.

Our consequent on-the-job training, our counseling model and the opportunities for international further training programs that we offer, can bring your career to the next level in no time at all.

What we’re looking forward to

University degree with good grades (Master’s)

First insights into banks, insurances, finance service providers or consulting

Affinity to new technology and digitalization processes

Fluency in both German and English

You’re capable of solving problems both creatively and with sharp analytical thinking, and you enjoy working on different and changing projects in versatile teams

Your benefits at Accenture

Flexible working time models

Home office

Overtime compensation

Helpful support and thorough induction by experienced mentors and project managers

interesting career options

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2024-03-05888-1-000349297", "text": "Spécialiste en Excellence Opérationnelle (H/F/N)

Le titre du poste peut différer en interne

Mission :

Le spécialiste OPEX joue un rôle central pour atteindre et préserver l’excellence opérationnelle sur le site de Monthey. Il apporte un regard extérieur aux différentes équipes ou départements pour continuellement évaluer, améliorer et simplifier les manières de travailler et faciliter le partage de bonnes pratiques.

Il/elle :

Est garant(e) de la mise en œuvre des éléments du système de production de Syngenta (SPS), en assurant la cohérence de l’approche sur l’intégralité du site.

Apporte un soutien méthodologique pour le pilotage de la performance dans les bâtiments de production et auprès des partenaires clés.

Est garant des processus d’amélioration continue et apporte une aide méthodologique pour estimer les gains attendus, prioriser les idées et mesurer les gains effectifs.

Accompagne le changement et contribue à développer une culture de gestion du changement axée sur les personnes. Il coache les différents acteurs, contribuant au succès des changements tout en améliorant les compétences de ceux qu'il soutient.

Agit comme catalyseur entre les secteurs et départements pour assurer la pérennité des processus et du succès du site de Monthey.

Responsabilités

Agir et être reconnu(e) comme expert(e) des outils Lean et garant(e) de l’Excellence Opérationnelle.

Evaluer la performance actuelle en termes de discipline opérationnelle dans un domaine d'expertise spécifique (fiabilité, gestion de performance, amélioration continue, état d'esprit et comportements...) dans un environnement défini.

Soutenir les employés (équipes/chefs d’équipe, etc..) vers l’identification des opportunités d'augmentation de productivité, la définition et la mise en œuvre d’un plan d’implémentation.

Mettre en place des indicateurs de suivi des processus SPS et définition avec les parties prenantes de la gouvernance appropriée.

Former/accompagner les responsables de projets d’amélioration continue en leur amenant l’expertise OPEX et en assurant le standard dans le déploiement et suivi des projets.

Accompagner les leaders dans le déploiement du changement centrée sur les personnes :

Conception de nouveaux outils

Formation des employés sur les pratiques standardisées (SPS)

Coaching sur le terrain.

Animer des séances de travail lors de l’utilisation des outils du LEAN management. Identifier les besoins en formation et animer des sessions de formation pour les différentes populations du site.

Présenter de manière articulée, passionnée et régulière les activités OpEx à tous les niveaux de l'organisation, renforçant ainsi le soutien et l'engagement pour les changements futurs.

Maintenir un contact fort avec le réseau Manufacturing Excellence & Operational Excellence Global et les autres sites AI pour le partage des bonnes pratiques.

Qualifications

Bachelor/Master en Ingénierie (chimique ou mécanique) ou dans un domaine connexe.

5 à 10 ans d'expérience ou plus dans un environnement de production chimique/industriel, avec un historique de réalisations prouvées.

Accréditation externe en pratiques et méthodologies d'amélioration continue, en particulier en gestion du changement axée sur les personnes, coaching ou expérience équivalente.

Compréhension approfondie des méthodologies d'amélioration continue (Lean / Six Sigma...).

Expérience démontrée dans l’accompagnement à la gestion du changement.

Compétences informatiques approfondies et connaissance approfondie d'outils d'analyse et de visualisation de données.

Compréhension des processus de fabrication chimique, ou dans un environnement similaire au rythme rapide et complexe.

Bonne connaissance des processus de gestion de projet incluant les approches Agile et traditionnelles en cascade.

Aptitude à travailler en bonne intelligence avec d'autres personnes dans un environnement d'équipe matriciel.

Informations supplémentaires

Avantages offerts aux collaborateurs Syngenta :

40h/ semaine de travail avec flextime et jours de cumul

Fond de pension privé Syngenta

Initiatives pour les familles

Bonus basé sur la performance individuelle et l'atteinte d'objectifs de Syngenta

Campus Syngenta : Restaurant d’entreprise, parking gratuit, médecin sur site

Syngenta s'engage pour la Diversité. Nous encourageons toutes les candidatures indépendamment de l'origine sociale et culturelle, de l'âge, du genre, du handicap, de l'orientation sexuelle ou des croyances religieuses. #LI-ED1
Description de l'entreprise

En tant que leader mondial du marché de la santé des plantes, nous aidons les agriculteurs à protéger les cultures et à ainsi garantir une alimentation sûre, nutritive et accessible à tous - tout en minimisant l'utilisation des terres et des autres intrants agricoles.

Syngenta Crop Protection protège les plantes du semis à la récolte : du moment où la graine est plantée, jusqu'à la récolte, les cultures doivent être protégées des mauvaises herbes, des insectes et des maladies, ainsi que de la sécheresse et des inondations, de la chaleur et du froid.

Le siège de Syngenta Crop Protection est situé en Suisse.

Syngenta Monthey est un site de production de substances actives, fort de 900 collaborateurs. Ses activités sont principalement liées à la protection des plantes et dans une moindre mesure au secteur Produits professionnels."}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-2-05-2024-03-05888-1-000349299", "text": "Global Product Manager Disease Control (m/f/d)

The role could be based in different locations in Europe.

Role Purpose:

Maximize the short and long-term value of new and existing Active Ingredients (AIs) through excellence in Product/Portfolio Life Cycle Management.

Accountabilities:

Lead global Active Ingredient Management (AIM) teams of functional and technical experts to set direction, recommend improvements to the portfolio and solve unique and complex portfolio challenges.

Work with Regions and countries to determine size and attractiveness of market needs, and opportunities, with clear guidelines around strategic requirements and proposed priorities.

Develop business cases for portfolio related investments and gain approval through the relevant governing bodies (CPPT, DeCo).

Prepare robust 5-year plans, aligned with the regions, including risks and opportunities.

Support Global 3rd Party Relations manager and regional 3rd party teams to develop successful in and out-licensing strategies to fill portfolio gaps and/or improve sales.

Develop branding and brand plans for all strategic products in portfolio, refreshing as needed, in conjunction with global branding lead.

Prepare global product launch kits and events and support product launches in key countries.

Share best-practice examples and learning across the regions.

Qualifications

Advanced knowledge of fungicides, crops, growers, and competitors.

Marketing: expertise in branding, pricing, positioning, market research plus basics of channel management.

Strategy: highly analytical, ability to model scenarios, prepare competitive/game changing plans.

Finance: understanding of P&L, NPV, working capital, investment planning, business cases.

Basic understanding of R&D stage gate development process and functional milestones.

Commercial and/or customer facing experience at country level.

Fungicide and agronomic expertise.

Management of complex multi-year projects.

Leadership: influencing people across functional boundaries and externally.

Additional Information

What we offer:

We offer a position which contributes to valuable and impactful work in a stimulating and international environment

Flexible working arrangements and environment with an open culture and diverse workforce

The opportunity to work with and learn from highly qualified and experienced employees

Learning culture (Together we Grow) and wide range of training options

You will profit from an onsite doctor, gym, canteen, and other benefits

Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status

#LI-ED1
Company Description

Syngenta Group is one of the world’s leading agriculture innovation companies, with roots going back more than 250 years. Its 48,000 people across more than 100 countries strive to transform agriculture through breakthrough products and technologies that play a vital role in enabling the food chain to feed the world safely, sustainably and with respect for our planet. Swiss headquartered and Chinese-owned, the Group draws strength from its four business units – Syngenta Crop Protection headquartered in Switzerland, Syngenta Seeds headquartered in the United States, ADAMA headquartered in Israel, and Syngenta Group China – that provide industry-leading ways to serve customers everywhere.
Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. We invite you to help us shape the future of agriculture. At Syngenta, we believe every employee has a role to play in safely feeding the world and taking care of our planet."}
