	•  Perform preventative maintenance and proficient repairs of production equipment

	•  Provide professional assistance with fault analyses, servicing activities, and technical conversions

	•  Targeted optimization of procedures in order to improve machine uptime

	•  Work in close collaboration with Facility Management and external suppliers

	•  Ensure detailed documentation of machinery condition and all work performed

	•  Work in shifts on four-shift basis

	•  Several years of service experience relating to machinery/systems used in semiconductor production

	•  Demonstrable expertise relating to electrical systems, electronics, PLC, pneumatics, vacuum technology, and robotics engineering

	•  Knowledge of Sputtering (Evatec Clusterline®), Evaporation (Evatec BAK®) and PECVD (Novellus C1 and C2) equipment is of advantage

	•  Good command of English and/or German"}

Know-how in setting up an automated testing environment and familiar in using data analysis tools to provide statistical data to the management

Experienced in using Network Protocols (TCP/IP, HTTP, and SSL)

Familiar in using Gateways, Firewalls and using Remote Access

Subject matter expert for Communications protocols between instruments and Laboratory informations systems(LIS). Provide guidance and support to others. Flexibility to transfer knowledge to different tasks/subprojects within SD.

Experimental design and execution of the experiments in the lab. Creation of Test Cases based on Product Requirements. Execution of Test Cases, analysis of the results, and creation of the respective regulatory documents. Issue tracking and verification of bug fixes/Anomalies.

Generate required documentation/procedures/technical reports in support of daily activities and be able to author official documents in English (e.g., Design history Files) for the preparation of milestones. Prepare and deliver presentations of project results to own or other groups.

Coordinate efforts with other functional areas to accomplish tasks: Hardware-, Software-, Consumables-, Assay-and Algorithm-Development.

Who you are

You’re someone who wants to influence your development. You’re looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies. Where a job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but the starting point.

To be successful in this role (you provide):

Degree in a technical or life sciences discipline (e.g., Software- or Electrical Engineering,

Electronic/Automation, Bio- and Process-Engineering,) or related job experience.

Minimum 1 years of work experience in the development of diagnostic systems in a System Development or related field

Ability to work independently, handling cross-departmental development tasks

Excellent communication skills and fluency in English and German

Strong analytical and interdisciplinary thinking

Experience in statistical data analysis

Experience in and willingness to work in a highly regulated industry and labs with biosafety levels S1and S2

Who we are

At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.

Roche Diagnostics International in Rotkreuz is a leading provider of diagnostic systems solutions, and the largest manufacturer of fully automated in vitro diagnostic systems in Switzerland. We are more than 2’700 passionate colleagues from over 65 nationalities. Find out more about our site in Central Switzerland, here.

Besides extensive development and training opportunities, we offer flexible working options, 18 weeks of maternity leave and 10 weeks of gender independent partnership leave. Our employees benefit from multiple services on site such as child-care facilities, medical services, restaurants and cafeterias, as well as various employee events.

We believe in the power of diversity and inclusion, and strive to identify and create opportunities that enable all people to bring their unique selves to Roche.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer."}

Erfahrung in der Entwicklung mit Avaloq Script, PL/SQL oder ähnlichen Programmiersprachen.

Starke analytische Fähigkeiten und die Fähigkeit, komplexe Geschäftsanforderungen in technische Lösungen umzusetzen.

Teamorientierte Arbeitsweise und die Fähigkeit, in einem dynamischen Umfeld erfolgreich zu arbeiten.

Attraktive Vergütung und Zusatzleistungen, die auf Ihre Fähigkeiten und Erfahrungen zugeschnitten sind.

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-3-01-2024-03-09019-1-055842847", "text": "Internship / Master Thesis : Ticket sales bot detection

Jobs

Nächste Stelle

Vor 6 Stunden

Internship / Master Thesis : Ticket sales bot detection

Elca

Internet, IT

Lausanne

Studierende

Vor Ort

	Zu den Ersten gehören

Zur Arbeitgeber-Website

About SECUTIX

SECUTIX is the market leader in advanced digital solutions for the events industry. Offering a seamlessly integrated and open cloud platform, SECUTIX gives organizations complete control and a suite of tools to help better understand and digitally engage with audiences, monetize products and services, secure operations and take audience experiences to the next level. SECUTIX serves a range of organizations on a global scale, including sport clubs, stadiums and arenas, museums, live entertainment organizations, leisure parks and festivals. Its emblematic customers include the UEFA, Ópera National de Paris, Centre Pompidou, Paléo Festival, Musée Picasso Paris and many more.

Your role

The SecuTix 360° ticketing solution is a global integrated software suite, which has been developed for professionals in the fields of entertainment, leisure, and events, who wish to expand their offering and revenue but also to excel in managing their customer relationship.

During large online ticket sales, bot detection is increasingly important for our clients. In addition to protecting the system from an unsustainable load, excluding robots also helps restrict the black market and results in a fairer sales process. Robot-generated sales and users also pollute customer data, affecting marketing campaigns and other BI analysis. In this context, the aim of this internship is to design and implement a real-time user-specific "robot index”, recording the likelihood a given user is a robot. In addition, we will look at providing a real-time interface for monitoring live sales and taking relevant operational actions.

Objectives:

Assess current state-of-the-art techniques for detecting internet robot activity and applicability to the ticketing business (machine learning, other data analysis tools)

Design and integrate a robot index tracking on the Secutix internet sales channels

For use during live ticket sales, design and implement a real-time interface for monitoring the current robot activity and taking actions against identified threats.

Run system load tests to validate the result.

Our offer

› A dynamic work and collaborative environment with a highly motivated multi-cultural and international sites team

› Attractive prospects for career path & Personal development through training and coaching

› The chance to make a difference in peoples’ life by building innovative solutions

› Various internal coding events (Hackathon, Brownbags), see our technical blog

› Monthly After-Works organized per locations

› Good work-life balance (2 days per week from home)

› Attractive pension fund with 3 types of Job Category employees’ contributions

› Premium and worldwide coverage with Zurich

Your profile

›Good knowledge of the software development process, ideally with some Java experience

›Good knowledge of web technologies and protocols

›Experience with machine learning or other data analysis tools would be a plus

›Team oriented

›Project will be focused on providing a useful tool for live sales, so an interest in system operation and monitoring aspects would be good"}

{"ad_id": "sjmm_suf-3-01-2024-03-09019-1-055842908", "text": "Head of Data Strategy and Intelligence

Jobs

Nächste Stelle

Vor 10 Stunden

Head of Data Strategy and Intelligence

FE fundinfo

Internet, IT

Zürich

Vollzeit

Vor Ort

	Zu den Ersten gehören

Zur Arbeitgeber-Website

Description

Reporting to the Chief Product Officer, the Head of Data Strategy & Intelligence will be responsible for all aspects of data strategy, standards and intelligence that underpin our products and drive business growth.

Responsibilities

Data Strategy

Create and activate a comprehensive data/information strategy with clearly defined objectives and measures aligned with the company's overall goals and initiatives

Explore and develop a ‘build, buy, partner' plan to optimise the FE fundinfo data/information strategy most effectively and efficiently

Identify which information/data to collect, from where, and how to commercialize it, working with the product, commercial and data teams to align on prioritised objectives and execution

Help facilitate revenue growth of regional markets through the execution of the data/information strategy

Data Regulations & Horizon Scanning

Proactively conduct horizon scanning for emerging fund data legislation and standards, positioning FE fundinfo and our clients to rapidly adapt and maintain a leading edge

Lead the agenda for FE fundinfo's engagement on industry data standards & regulations, coordinating our representation with 3rd parties such as openfunds, investment associations and regulatory bodies

Regulatory data refresh (often annual) working with data teams to ensure asset managers and distributors successfully navigate the change and provide the data

Data Analytics and Information Intelligence

Work with the Product teams, spearheading the identification of advanced data analytics to be integrated into the products that surface actionable insights and deliver value for clients

Ensure data insight visualisation and storytelling is clear and actionable for better decision making for our clients when using our products

Collaborate with Engineering and Data Operations in the development and implementation of advanced analytics offerings for our teams regionally

Identify opportunities to leverage data through artificial intelligence and machine learning to inform our AI technology and data operations roadmap

Leadership

Build and lead a high performing data organisation in across EMEA and APAC with future aspirations for the Americas

Operating global teams, acting locally, which are aligned with corporate strategy and the industry

Partner closely with commercial, product, engineering, and data operations teams to deliver on growth objectives

Manage the departmental budget and resource allocation efficiently and effectively

Foster a culture of innovation, collaboration and accountability

Qualifications

You must have a proven track-record in a similar leadership role within the fintech industry

You must have strong knowledge of data governance, data management, and data analytics best practices

You must have experience with artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning

You must have hands-on technical skills and experience managing/collaborating with technical and product development teams

You must have deep domain expertise, with knowledge and relationships in global financial markets.

You must be familiar with regulatory requirements and compliance frameworks in the financial sector

You will have the willingness to think creatively and challenge the ‘norms,' while being cognisant of the voice of the customer

You will be commercially astute, considering and clearly demonstrating the resulting value of any proposed investment or strategy. Be motivated by commercial and customer oriented KPI's

You must have the ability to quickly understand key business drivers and goals, validate them with business colleagues and then translate into a data strategy and roadmap

You must have experience in hiring and developing quality candidates in order to create a team that has the behavioural/interpersonal and technical skills to be successful

Hiring organization

FE fundinfo is a global leading provider of information, technology, and services for the investment management community. Trusted for our enriched information, connected technology solutions, and managed services, their platform bridges the gap between financial product manufacturers such as asset managers and fund managers to distributors such as wealth managers, financial advisers, and platform distribution channels

Employment Type"}

Mechanical Design Engineer (m/w/d | 80-100%)

Unsere Geräte werden nach höchsten Qualitätsstandards in der Schweiz und den USA hergestellt und weltweit vertrieben. Wir sind ein Eldorado für Ingenieure und stetig am Wachsen. Aus diesem Grund suchen wir zur Erweiterung unseres R&D Teams eine erfahrene und engagierte Persönlichkeit mit genialen Lösungsansätzen und technischem Knowhow.

Deine

Erarbeiten von mechatronischen Lösungen für unsere Liquid Handling Produkte

Enge Zusammenarbeit sowohl im interdisziplinären Projektteam wie auch mit externen Lieferanten und Kooperationspartnern

Organisieren von Bauteilen für Prototypen in Zusammenarbeit mit dem Projektteam

Aufbau, Inbetriebnahme und Testen, der von Dir konstruierten Baugruppen und Geräten

Abgeschlossene Lehre als Konstrukteur, Polymechaniker oder Automatiker

Studium in Maschinenbau, Mechatronik oder adäquat auf Stufe FH/HF

Langjährige Berufserfahrung in einer vergleichbaren Funktion

Profunde Erfahrung in der Geräteentwicklung

Ausgezeichnete CAD Kenntnisse

Begeisterung für kreative Lösungen und innovative Produkte

Gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch

Wir bieten Dir

Eine spannende Stelle in einem wachsenden, international tätigen Unternehmen

Aktive Mitgestaltung unserer zukünftigen Liquid Handling Produkte

Moderne Arbeitsplätze mit guter Verkehrsanbindung sowie eine von gegenseitigem Respekt geprägte Unternehmenskultur
